Addin::Ask to Launch EnableGrammarly.exe in LOCALAPPDATA

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


If my previous instructions didn't help, we suggest that you launch the EnableGrammarly.exe file by following these instructions:


  1. Close Word.
  2. Press Win+R
  3. Copy and paste %LOCALAPPDATA%\Grammarly\Grammarly for Microsoft Office Suite into the search line. This will open the Grammarly folder on your PC. Navigate to the folder with the latest Grammarly version.
  4. There should be a folder similar to B788D630FFA4301BCC50E5A81D7BE34; please open it.
  5. Right-click on EnableGrammarly.exe, and select Run as administrator.
  6. Click the Open Grammarly button.


Thank you and many apologies for the inconvenience,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

To resolve this issue, we recommend reattaching the Grammarly sidebar:

​​​​

addin_reattach_embedded_grammarly_sidebar, addin development sidebar
Addin::Ask to Whitelist Folders in Windows Defender (System Slow / Add-in Stops Working - Step 2)

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for your message.


To resolve the issue, we recommend that you add Grammarly and MS Office folders to the exceptions list of the Windows Defender:

1. Click the Start button (Windows key), type virus, then open Virus & thread protection that you'll see in the results.

2. In the window that opens next, click Manage settings under the Virus & thread protection settings. Scroll down to the Exclusions section, and select Add or remove exclusions.

3. Click Add an exclusion, and select Folder. Paste %LocalAppData% into the address-bar, and press Enter. Open the Grammarly folder, and then click the Select Folder button.

4. Follow the same instructions to add the Microsoft Office folder to the Exceptions list. Typically, this folder is stored at C:\Program Files (x86)

I hope this helps, but please let us know if you require any further assistance regarding this. Many apologies for the inconvenience!


{{ticket.assignee.first_name}}

addin_ask_to_whitelist_folders_in_windows_defender_system_slow_or_addin_stops_working, addin development

1. Click Log out:

Addin::Avoid Checking the Entire Email Thread in Outlook (No)Hi {{ticket.requester.name}}, Thank you for contacting Grammarly! I'm happy to answer this for you. Currently, the Grammarly add-in for MS Outlook checks the whole email thread by design. Unfortunately, there is no option to disable this feature at the moment. We apologize for any inconvenience this may be causing. Should you need any further assistance, please let me know. Sincerely, {{ticket.assignee.name}}addin feature_request, addin_avoid_checking_the_entire_email_thread_in_outlook_no
Addin::Can Grammarly start where I left off?Hello {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thanks for reaching out! My name is {{ticket.assignee.first_name}}, and I am happy to assist you today. Unfortunately, no such option is currently available. Every time you save a document, Grammarly needs to re-scan it to check whether any of the paragraphs have changed. This is required because Microsoft Office and other add-ins you may have installed can access and change your document between the start and completion of the saving procedure. Because there is no way for us to control or detect any of these changes, we need to take a look at the whole document again to be sure it hasn't changed. Breaking your document up into several smaller ones and checking them one by one might help you save time. I hope this explanation makes sense, but please let us know if we can assist you further. Kindly, {{ticket.assignee.name}}addin_feature_request_start_where_left_off, addin feature_request
Addin::Check Only Parts of Document (No)Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thanks for reaching out! My name is {{ticket.assignee.first_name}}, and I am happy to answer this for you. Unfortunately, there's no setting to exclude certain parts of your text from checking. If you would like to avoid distractions and focus on the content first, you can disable Grammarly. Simply find the Grammarly tab in the toolbar and click Close Grammarly. You can open it again when you are ready to move on to proofreading your writing. I hope this helps! Please let us know if we can assist you further. Kindly, {{ticket.assignee.name}}addin_feature_request_check_parts_of_document_no, addin feature_request
Addin::Checks Only Emails in Outlook (Task, Notes, Calendar)Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thanks for contacting Grammarly! I'm happy to assist you today. Please note that Grammarly for Microsoft Office works only with emails in Outlook. Unfortunately, other features like contacts, appointments, etc. are not supported by our service at this time. Please feel free to contact us with any questions or concerns you may have. We apologize for any inconvenience. Sincerely, {{ticket.assignee.name}}addin_checks_emails_only_in_outlook, addin feature_request
Addin::Citrix Environment (Suggest to Install for All Users)

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for reaching out. That's a great question!


I'm pleased to inform you that Grammarly for Microsoft Office can be installed on a terminal server. Simply run the installation for "all users":


  1. Download Grammarly for Microsoft Office at https://grammarly.com/office-addin
  2. Double-click the GrammarlyAddInSetup.exe file
  3. When you see “Welcome to Grammarly” window, click Get Started while pressing Shift and Ctrl keys on your keyboard
  4. Check the Install for all users option and click Next:


​


Note: The add-in will need to be installed on the same Citrix box as the Microsoft Office.


If you need to perform a quiet background install manually, please run this command in the command line:

GrammarlyAddInSetup.exe /fastforallmode /silent


You can use this command for uninstallation:

GrammarlyAddInSetup.exe /fastforallmode /silent /uninstall


Please feel free to contact us with any questions or concerns you may have. We are committed to making your experience at Grammarly pleasant and rewarding.


Kindly,

{{ticket.assignee.first_name}}

addin_citrix_environment_suggest_to_install_for_all_users, addin development

A "conf" label above the Grammarly icon means that the file is marked as “confidential” by Azure Information Protection. I hope this helps, but please let me know if there’s anything else I can do for you. Kindly, {{ticket.assignee.name}}addin_conf_azure_information_protection, addin development
Addin::Delays Closing MS Word (Explain)

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for your message!

I've consulted with our technical team, and they informed me that the delay may be explained by the size of your document. We suggest that you try splitting your document into smaller parts or disable the add-in by clicking "Close Grammarly" before closing the document itself.

Also, the more add-ins you have installed, the more time it may take to close MS Word. We apologize for the delay and will investigate what we can do on our side to improve your experience with our product in the future.

Thank you for your patience and understanding,


{{ticket.assignee.first_name}}

Addin::Delete Grammarly Key from the Registry - Sidebar issues (Step 1)

Hello {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for contacting Grammarly. I'm sorry to hear you are experiencing this issue.


To troubleshoot this, please delete the Grammarly key from the registry by following the instructions below:

  1. Close all programs that are running
  2. Download and run the file from https://grammarly-support-static.s3.amazonaws.com/Grammarly_key.reg (confirm your actions if prompted)
  3. Open Microsoft Word or Outlook, and see if the issue persists after logging in to your Grammarly account.


I hope this helps! Please feel free to contact us with any questions or concerns you may have.


Best regards,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

  2. Download and run the file from https://grammarly-support-static.s3.amazonaws.com/Grammarly_key.reg (confirm your actions if prompted)

Addin::Disable Background CheckingHi {{ticket.requester.name}}, Thanks for reaching out! I’m happy to assist you with this. You can tweak your settings to prevent Grammarly from scanning your documents when Grammarly is disabled. To do this, please click the Settings button in the Grammarly tab and uncheck the box next to "Allow background checking when Grammarly is not opened." Please feel free to contact us with any questions or concerns you may have. We are committed to making your experience with Grammarly pleasant and rewarding. Sincerely, {{ticket.assignee.name}}addin_disable_background_checking, addin
Addin::Disables Autosave (Explain)Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thank you for contacting Grammarly. I'm happy to clarify this for you. Once Grammarly for Microsoft Office has been turned on, the Autosave feature in Word and Outlook gets disabled. In order to save the edited text, click the "Save" button located in the Word toolbar. The reason Grammarly has to disable Autosave is that MS Word would otherwise save all of the underlines and highlights Grammarly uses to flag mistakes in the text. I hope this clarifies the matter, but please feel free to contact us with any questions or concerns you may have. We apologize for any inconvenience. Kindly, {{ticket.assignee.name}}addin_disables_autosave_explain, addin
Addin::Disappeared from Word/Outlook - MS-1139 (TS-4045)

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for reaching out. I'm sorry to hear about this and will be happy to assist you in resolving the issue.


We suggest that you do the following:


1. Uninstall your current version of Grammarly for Microsoft Office (go to the Control Panel > Programs and Features > right-click Grammarly for Microsoft Office > select Uninstall).


2. Download the latest version at http://www.grammarly.com/office-addin/


3. Right-click the GrammarlyAddInSetup.exe file that has been downloaded to your machine and choose "Run as administrator". If you don't have this option, log in to Windows using an administrator account and try installing the add-in again.


***


If that doesn't help, please reinstall the Grammarly add-in for "all users" by following the steps below:


1. Uninstall your current version of the Grammarly add-in via Control Panel > Programs and Features > right click on Grammarly for Microsoft® Office Suite > select Uninstall.

If you use Windows 10: go to Windows search in the start menu, search for “Control Panel desktop app” and click > Programs > Programs and Features > right click on Grammarly for Microsoft® Office Suite > select Uninstall.

2. Download the latest version from http://www.grammarly.com/office-addin/

3. Double-click the GrammarlyAddInSetup.exe file

4. When you see “Welcome to Grammarly” window, press and hold Shift and Ctrl keys on your keyboard and then click Get Started


5. Check the Install for all users option and click Next:



If you don't see the option to install for "all users", please download and run this file: https://gram.ly/HSJT


Let us know if there's anything else we can do for you!


Best wishes,


{{ticket.assignee.first_name}}


development system_bug addin_broken, addin addin_disappeared_from_word_or_outlook_ms1139_and_ts4045
Addin::Doesn't Check Footnotes (Explain)Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thank you for contacting Grammarly. I'm happy to answer this for you. Please note that Grammarly for Microsoft Office doesn't check footnotes for spelling and any other issues at this time. However, if you have doubts about the grammatical accuracy of your footnotes, you can copy-paste them into the main body of your text to see if Grammarly flags any issues. I hope this helps, but please feel free to contact me with any additional questions or comments. Kindly, {{ticket.assignee.first_name}}addin feature_request, addin_doesnt_check_footnotes_explain

Please feel free to contact us with any questions or concerns you may have. Sincerely, {{ticket.assignee.name}}addin_embed_grammarly_window_into_ms_word_outlook, addin sidebar development
Addin::Enable Definitions and Synonyms (No)Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thank you for contacting Grammarly Support! I’m happy to answer this for you. Unfortunately, the vocabulary enhancement feature that suggests synonyms is not available for MS Office at this time. However, you can take advantage of this feature using the Grammarly extension for your preferred browser (Chrome, Safari, Firefox, or Edge), the online Grammarly Editor at https://app.grammarly.com/, and the native (desktop) app. Simply double-click on any word in your text in the online Grammarly Editor or while browsing a web page with the Grammarly browser extension enabled. I hope this helps! Please do not hesitate to contact us with any questions or concerns you might have. Best regards, {{ticket.assignee.name}} addin_enable_definitions_and_synonyms_no, addin feature_request
Addin::Errors:: N/A, N/A, N/A, 0x80070643 (Solution #1)

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}​,


Thank you for contacting Grammarly! I'm sorry to hear that you are experiencing this issue.


The error "N/A, N/A, N/A, 0x80070643" usually means that you either don't have the administrative privileges to perform the installation, or the antivirus software on your computer is blocking our services. To troubleshoot this issue, please follow the steps below:


  1. Disable your antivirus software (e.g., McAfee or Norton)
  2. Download the latest version of Grammarly for Microsoft Office from https://grammarly.com/office-addin
  3. Install Grammarly for Microsoft Office as an administrator: right-click the GrammarlyAddInSetup.exe file that has been downloaded to your machine and choose "Run as administrator". If you don't have this option, log in to Windows using the administrator account and install the add-in.
  4. Re-enable your antivirus software


I hope this helps! Please keep in touch and let us know how we can assist you further. We apologize for any inconvenience.


Kindly,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

addin_error_0x80070643_solution_1, addin addin_broken development installation
Addin::Errors:: N/A, N/A, N/A, 0x80070643 (Solution #2)

Hi {{ticket.requester.name}},


Thank you for your message! We suggest that you follow these steps to resolve the issue:


1. If you have Grammarly for Microsoft Office Suite in the Control Panel > Programs and Features, please uninstall it.


2. Navigate to services.msc and make sure that the Windows Installer service is set to the "manual" startup type. If it's running, you will need to stop it. Here's how to do this:


2.1. Press Win + R


2.2. Paste the line services.msc into the text box and click OK


2.3. In the Services window that opens right after that, double-click the Windows Installer to view its Properties


2.4. If the Startup type isn't Manual, please set it to Manual


2.5. If Service status isn't Stopped, please click the Stop button


2.6. Click OK


3. Install Grammarly for Microsoft Office from https://www.grammarly.com/office-addin



If this doesn't help, please send us a screenshot of the Windows Installer window that you see when you perform step 2.2.


Thank you for your time and patience! We apologize for the inconvenience.


Kindly,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

Afterward, please configure proxy settings in the add-in: click About in the Grammarly tab, then select Proxy settings.

addin_error_proxy_authentication_required, addin addin_broken development
Addin::Errors::"The Grammarly Add-in was unable to start"

Hi {{ticket.requester.name}},


Thank you for your message. We are sorry that you're experiencing this issue.


To resolve this, first ensure that your copy of Microsoft Office is activated, then reinstall Grammarly for Microsoft Office as an administrator:


  1. Uninstall Grammarly for Microsoft Office (navigate to Control Panel > Programs and Features > right-click on Grammarly for Microsoft® Office Suite > select Uninstall).

  2. Download the latest version from http://www.grammarly.com/office-addin/

  3. Right-click on the GrammarlyAddInSetup.exe file that has been downloaded to your machine and choose "Run as administrator". If you don't have this option, log in to Windows using the administrator account and install the add-in.


If reinstalling Grammarly for Microsoft Office as an administrator doesn't help, please try reinstalling it for "all users":


  1. Download Grammarly for Microsoft Office at https://grammarly.com/office-addin
  2. Double-click the GrammarlyAddInSetup.exe file
  3. Hold Shift and Ctrl keys on your keyboard and then select Get Started on your screen
  4. Check the Install for all users option and click Next:


​



Please let us know if this doesn't help, or if you need any further assistance.


Best regards,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}


addin_broken addin_error_addin_was_unable_to_start, addin development
Addin::Errors::"We weren't able to find a supported Microsoft Office program on your computer" - (Step 1)

Replace [VERSION] with the last installed version from Gnar (e.g. 6.7.169)




Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for contacting Grammarly. I'm sorry to hear that you're experiencing this issue.


Please follow these steps to troubleshoot the issue:

1. Please continue the installation, even if you see that error message.

2. Then, open MS Word/Outlook as an administrator. To do that, please right-click the MS Word/Outlook icon, and select Run as administrator from the dropdown menu.


3. Go to File > Options > Add-ins. In the Manage section, click Go...

4. In the COM Add-ins menu, click Add. In the address bar, open %LocalAppData%\Grammarly\Grammarly for Microsoft Office Suite\, and open the [VERSION] folder. Look for a folder with a name similar to 5496693E32. Inside this folder, select the GrammarlyShim32.dll file, and click OK.


Note: If you see an error message afterward, please try adding the GrammarlyShim64.dll file instead.

5. See if Grammarly appears in MS Word/Outlook toolbar.


I hope this helps, but please let me know if you need any further assistance. We apologize for the inconvenience.

Regards,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

addin_broken addin_error_we_werent_able_to_find_a_supported_ms_office_program_on_your_computer_step1, addin development
Addin::Errors::"We weren't able to find a supported Microsoft Office program on your computer" - (Step 2)

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for getting back to us. I am sorry to hear that the issue persists.


To resolve this, please do the following:

  1. Temporarily disable your antivirus software to follow the steps listed below
  2. Right-click on the GrammarlyAddInSetup.exe file downloaded from https://grammarly.com/office-addin and select "Run as administrator". If you don't have this option, log in to Windows using the administrator account and try again.
  3. If Step 2 doesn't help, double-click the GrammarlyAddInSetup.exe file and, when you see the “Welcome to Grammarly” window, press and hold Shift and Ctrl keys on your keyboard, then click Get Started

  4. Check the Install for all users option and click Next:


    ​


    * If you don't see the option to install for "all users", please download and run this file: https://gram.ly/HSJT

  5. If the issue persists, repair MS Office as described here https://gram.ly/HSLv and try installing the add-in again
  6. If none of the above helped, reinstall Microsoft Office


If there is anything else I can do for you, please let me know.


Regards,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

addin_broken addin_error_we_werent_able_to_find_a_supported_ms_office_program_on_your_computer_step2, addin development
Addin::Errors::"Word experienced a serious problem with the Grammarly add-in"

Hey {{ticket.requester.name}},


Thank you for writing in today! My name is {{ticket.assignee.first_name}}, and I'm happy to assist you.


We recommend that you reinstall Grammarly for Microsoft Office by following the steps below:

1. Uninstall your current version of the Grammarly add-in via the Control Panel > Programs and Features > right-click Grammarly for Microsoft® Office Suite > select Uninstall.

If you use Windows 10, go to the Windows search in the start menu, search for Control Panel desktop app and click Programs > Programs and Features > right-click Grammarly for Microsoft® Office Suite > select Uninstall.

2. Download the latest version from http://www.grammarly.com/office-addin/ and follow the instructions on that page to install it.

3. Open any text document in Word, find the Grammarly tab in the toolbar, then click Open Grammarly.

4. Log in using your Grammarly credentials if prompted.

5. You should see the Grammarly sidebar on the right. It should say Checking... and then start displaying suggestions.

If any of these steps doesn't work, please let us know exactly which step that is and send us a screenshot of the problem that you see.


Thank you and many apologies for the inconvenience,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

addin_error_word_experienced_a_serious_problem_with_g_addin, addin addin_broken development
Addin::Errors::"Word is running into problems with the Grammarly add-in"Hey {{ticket.requester.name}}, Thank you for writing in today! My name is {{ticket.assignee.first_name}}, and I'm happy to assist you. This problem may have occurred because you updated or reinstalled either your MS Word, Outlook, or Windows. If so, please try reinstalling the Grammarly add-in. If the issue persists, but the Grammarly add-in works at least sometimes, could you please provide us with the diagnostics information by following the instructions described here: https://support.grammarly.com/hc/en-us/articles/115000090612-How-to-send-advanced-user-diagnostic-information-to-Grammarly ? Our technical team will need this information to investigate the issue. You can leave the diagnostics mode on for a couple of days until you experience the issue again. After you have reproduced the issue, please send the diagnostics result to us by clicking "Send user activity data to Grammarly" link. Please make sure you also send the troubleshooting request ID to support@grammarly.com Thank you and many apologies for the inconvenience, {{ticket.assignee.name}}addin_error_word_is_running_into_problems_when_word_updated, addin addin_broken development
Addin::Errors::0x518, N/A, N/A, 0x80070643 (TS-4224)

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for contacting Grammarly Support. I’m sorry that you are experiencing this issue.


To troubleshoot this, please do the following:


1. Uninstall Grammarly for Microsoft Office via the Control Panel > Programs and Features > right-click Grammarly for Microsoft® Office Suite > select Uninstall.


If you use Windows 10, go to Windows search in the start menu, search for Control Panel desktop app > Programs > Programs and Features > right-click Grammarly for Microsoft® Office Suite > select Uninstall.


2. Remove the Grammarly folder where the DiffMatchPatch.dll file exists (you can find it in the error message): C:\Users\\AppData\Local\Grammarly


3. Download the latest version of Grammarly for Microsoft Office from https://www.grammarly.com/office-addin


I hope this helps, but please do not hesitate to contact us should you need any further assistance.


Kind regards,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

addin_error_0x518_0x80070643, addin addin_broken development installation
Addin::Errors::0x51f, N/A, N/A, 0x80070643 (TS-4225)

Hey {{ticket.requester.name}},


Thank you for contacting Grammarly! I'm happy to assist you today.


It appears that the antivirus software on your computer might be blocking our services. To troubleshoot this, please do the following:


1. Disable the antivirus software on your computer


2. Install Grammarly for Microsoft Office from https://grammarly.com/office-addin


3. Enable your antivirus


If this doesn't help, please install the Grammarly add-in for "all users":


  1. Double-click the GrammarlyAddInSetup.exe file
  2. Hold Shift and Ctrl keys on your keyboard and then select Get Started on your screen
  3. Check the Install for all users option and click Next:


​


I hope this helps, but please let me know if you need any further assistance. We apologize for any inconvenience caused.


Kind regards,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

addin_error_0x51f_0x80070643, addin addin_broken development installation
Addin::Errors::0x532, N/A, N/A, 0x80070643 (Suggest to Install Windows Updates) - (TS-4048)Hi {{ticket.requester.name}}, Thank you for contacting Grammarly Support. The message you receive means that you need to install Windows updates. Depending on your Windows version, please follow the instructions in the corresponding article: Windows 7: http://windows.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-vista/install-windows-updates Windows 8: https://support.rockstargames.com/hc/en-us/articles/200148796-How-to-find-and-download-important-Windows-8-updates Windows 10: http://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/4807-windows-update-check-install-windows-10-a.html Please let us know if this doesn't help, or if you have any further questions. Best wishes, {{ticket.assignee.name}}addin_error_0x532_0x80070643_suggest_to_install_windows_updates, addin addin_broken development installation
Addin::Errors::0x6b2, N/A, N/A, 0x80070643 (TS-4058)

Hi {{ticket.requester.name}},


Thank you for contacting Grammarly Customer Support! We're sorry that you're experiencing this issue.


To troubleshoot this, please do the following:


1. Install the Grammarly add-in _______ (attached to this email).

2. Then, uninstall the Grammarly add-in _______ by going to the Control Panel > Programs and Features > right-clicking Grammarly for Microsoft Office > selecting Uninstall.

3. Download the latest version from http://www.grammarly.com/office-addin/ and follow the instructions of that page to install it.


If you still get the same error message (0x6b2, N/A, N/A, 0x80070643) while installing/uninstalling _______, it means that Grammarly is trying to find one of these files:


GrammarlyAddinFiles.cab, GrammarlyInstaller_x86.msi, GrammarlyInstaller_x64.msi, or GrammarlyInstaller.msi. (attached)


To resolve the persisting issue, we suggest you try the following:


1. Create a new folder named "Grammarly" on your desktop.


2. Save GrammarlyAddinFiles.cab, GrammarlyInstaller_x86.msi, GrammarlyInstaller_x64.msi and GrammarlyInstaller.msi to that folder (the files are attached to this email).


3. Uninstall the Grammarly add-in _______. (go to the Control Panel > Programs and Features > right-click Grammarly for Microsoft Office > select Uninstall).


4. When Grammarly says it can't find one of the files (GrammarlyAddinFiles.cab, GrammarlyInstaller_x86.msi, GrammarlyInstaller_x64.msi, GrammarlyInstaller.msi), select that file from the "Grammarly" folder on your desktop.


Please do not hesitate to contact us should you need any further assistance. Thank you for your patience and many apologies for the inconvenience.


Sincerely,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

addin_error_0x6b2_0x80070643_ts4058, addin addin_broken development installation
Addin::Errors::0x6b7, N/A, N/A, 0x80070643 (TS-4066)

Hi {{ticket.requester.name}},


Thank you for writing in today! I'm sorry to hear that you're experiencing this issue.


We suggest that you try following these steps to resolve the issue:

  1. Close all programs that are running
  2. Click Start and enter Command Prompt in the search box
  3. In the search results, right-click Command Prompt (Desktop app) and select Run as administrator
  4. Enter DISM.exe /Online /Cleanup-image /Restorehealth (note the spaces before each "/"), press Enter and wait until the tool finishes running
  5. Enter sfc /scannow (note the space after "sfc") and wait until the process is completed, then press Enter and wait until the tool finishes running
  6. Restart the PC and see if the issue persists


I hope this helps, but please let me know if you need any further assistance. We apologize for the inconvenience this issue caused.


Best regards,

{{ticket.assignee.name}}

addin_error_0x6b7_0x80070643, addin addin_broken development installation
Addin::Errors::0x9c6, N/A, N/A, 0x80070643 (Step 1) (TS-4319)

Hey {{ticket.requester.name}},


Thank you for writing in today! I'm sorry to hear that you're experiencing this issue.


To troubleshoot this, please do the following:


1. Click Windows Key + R on the keyboard


2. Type %temp% and hit Enter


3. At the top of the Explorer window, in the address bar, click the folder to the left of Temp in the folder path (Local by default)


4. In the folder list, right-click the Temp folder and then click Properties. Then click the Security tab


5. Click the Edit button and on the next screen click Add


7. On the next screen, in the large text window type Everyone and then click Check Names. (Now Everyone should be underlined)


8. Check the box for Full control under the Allow column, and then click OK. Then click OK and OK again to close all the windows


9. Install the Grammarly add-in from https://grammarly.com/office-addin


I hope this helps, but please let me know if you need any further assistance. We apologize for the inconvenience this issue caused.


Best regards,

{{ticket.assignee.name}}

addin_error_0x9xc6_0x80070643, addin addin_broken development installation
Addin::Errors::0x9c6, N/A, N/A, 0x80070643 (Step 2) (TS-4319)

Hi {{ticket.requester.name}},


Thanks for your message! I'm sorry to hear the previous instructions didn't help.


To resolve the issue, please run the System File Checker (SFC) tool scan by following these steps:

  1. Click Start > All Programs > Accessories, right-click Command Prompt, and then select Run as administrator. If you are prompted for an administrator password or confirmation, type in your password or click Allow (detailed instructions are available at https://gram.ly/HSM7)
  2. Type the following command, then press Enter:
    sfc /scannow

    (The sfc /scannow command scans all protected system files and replaces incorrect versions with correct Microsoft versions.)

  3. After the scan is completed, close the Command Prompt window, restart the computer and see if the issue persists.

For further guidance on the SFC Scan, please visit http://support.microsoft.com/kb/929833


I hope this helps! Please don't hesitate to reach out should you need any further assistance. We apologize for the inconvenience.


Best regards,

{{ticket.assignee.name}}

addin_error_0x9xc6_0x80070643_step_2, addin addin_broken development installation
Addin::Errors::Blank Installation Window (TS-4057)

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for contacting Grammarly. I'm sorry to hear that you're experiencing this issue.

To troubleshoot this, please do the following:

For Windows 7:

Update your video card drivers by right-clicking on the desktop > Display settings > Advanced display settings > Display adapter properties > Properties > open the Driver tab > click Update Driver and choose Search automatically for updated driver software.


If this doesn't help, please try repairing .NET Framework by using this tool from the official Microsoft site: https://gram.ly/HQF4


For Windows 10:

  1. Download the Microsoft .NET Framework Repair Tool at https://gram.ly/HQF4

  2. Right-click the downloaded file and select Run as administrator.


I hope this helps, but please let me know if you need any further assistance. We apologize for the inconvenience.

Regards,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

Kindly, {{ticket.assignee.name}}addin_error_0x80070002, addin addin_broken development installation
Addin::Errors::N/A, N/A, N/A, 0x80070005 (Suggest to Install for All Users) (TS-4321)

Hey {{ticket.requester.name}},


Thank you for your message! I’m happy to assist you with this.


To resolve the issue, please install the Grammarly add-in for "all users":


  1. Download Grammarly for Microsoft Office at https://grammarly.com/office-addin
  2. Double-click the GrammarlyAddInSetup.exe file
  3. When you see “Welcome to Grammarly” window, click Get Started while pressing Shift and Ctrl keys on your keyboard.
  4. Check the Install for all users option and click Next:


​


If it doesn't help, please temporarily disable antivirus and anti-spyware software and install the Grammarly add-in following the instructions provided above. Once you've finished the installation, please enable your antivirus and anti-spyware software.


Please feel free to contact us with any additional questions you may have.


Sincerely,

{{ticket.assignee.name}}

Addin::Errors::N/A, N/A, N/A, 0x80070643 (Solution #3)

Hi {{ticket.requester.name}},


Thank you for contacting Grammarly Support. I'm sorry that you've experienced this issue.


To troubleshoot this, we suggest you install the Grammarly add-in for "all users":


  1. Download Grammarly for Microsoft Office at https://grammarly.com/office-addin
  2. Double-click the GrammarlyAddInSetup.exe file
  3. Hold Shift and Ctrl keys on your keyboard and then select Get Started on your screen
  4. Check the Install for all users option and click Next:


​


If installing the add-in for "all users" doesn't help, please follow these steps:


1. Open the Windows task manager (http://www.howtogeek.com/66622/stupid-geek-tricks-6-ways-to-open-windows-task-manager/)

2. Click the Processes tab (or Details tab, depending on your Windows version)

3. End any remaining msiexec.exe process running: select the process and click End Process (or End Process Tree or End Task)

4. Install the Grammarly add-in from https://grammarly.com/office-addin


I hope this helps, but please do not hesitate to contact us should you need any further assistance. We apologize for any inconvenience.


Kindly,

{{ticket.assignee.first_name}}

addin_error_0x80070643_solution_3, addin addin_broken development installation
Addin::Errors::N/A, N/A, N/A, 0x80070643 (Solution #4)

Hi {{ticket.requester.name}},


Thanks for waiting this out!


We suggest that you disable your antivirus software and firewall, then run the installer as an administrator to resolve the issue.


If the issue persists, please follow these steps:


(Delete the above unless otherwise instructed by Tech Support).


To troubleshoot this, use the system file checker by following the instructions below:


  1. Click Start (or press the Windows key), then enter Command Prompt in the search box.
  2. Right-click Command Prompt (Desktop app) from the search results and select Run as administrator.
  3. Enter DISM.exe /Online /Cleanup-image /Restorehealth (note the spaces before each “/”). Wait until the process is finished.
  4. Enter sfc /scannow (note the space between “sfc” and “/”).


After the process is completed, please restart your computer, download the latest version of Grammarly for Microsoft Office from http://www.grammarly.com/office-addin/, and follow the instructions on that page to install it.


I hope this helps! Should you require any further assistance, please let us know. We apologize for the inconvenience.


Best regards,

If you don't have this option, log in to Windows using the administrator account and install the add-in.


If this doesn't help, please install the Grammarly add-in for "all users":


  1. Download Grammarly for Microsoft Office at https://grammarly.com/office-addin
  2. Double-click the GrammarlyAddInSetup.exe file
  3. Hold Shift and Ctrl keys on your keyboard and then select Get Started on your screen
  4. Check the Install for all users option and click Next:

addin_error_80070652_solution1, addin addin_broken development installation
Addin::Errors::N/A, N/A, N/A, 0x80070652 (Solution #2) (TS-4069)

Hi {{ticket.requester.name}},


Thank you for your message. I'm sorry to hear the previous instructions didn't help.


To resolve the issue, please follow the steps below:


1. Open the Windows task manager (http://www.howtogeek.com/66622/stupid-geek-tricks-6-ways-to-open-windows-task-manager/)


2. Click the Processes tab (or the Details tab, depending on your Windows version). Then, end any remaining msiexec.exe process that is still running: select the process and click End Process (or End Process Tree or End Task)


3. Install the Grammarly add-in from https://grammarly.com/office-addin


If this doesn't help, please send us the error details as described here: https://support.grammarly.com/hc/en-us/articles/115000090592

addin_error_80070652_solution2, addin addin_broken development installation
Addin::Errors::N/A, N/A, N/A, 0x80070659 (Ask to Run as Administrator) (TS-4190)Hey {{ticket.requester.name}}, Thank you for writing in today. I'm sorry that you're experiencing this issue. The error "N/A, N/A, N/A, 0x80070659" usually means that you don't have enough administrative privileges to perform the installation. To resolve this, you need to install Grammarly for Microsoft Office as administrator: 1. Download the latest version from http://www.grammarly.com/office-addin/ 2. Right-click the GrammarlyAddInSetup.exe file that has been downloaded to your machine and choose "Run as administrator". If you don't have this option, log in to Windows using the administrator account and install the add-in. If this doesn't help, please take a moment to review this article and send us the error details: https://support.grammarly.com/hc/en-us/articles/115000090592 Thank you and many apologies for the inconvenience, {{ticket.assignee.first_name}}addin_error_0x80070659_ask_to_run_as_administrator, addin addin_broken development installation
Addin::Errors::Outlook detected a COM add-in problem (TS-4237)

Hi {{ticket.requester.name}},


Thanks for contacting Grammarly! I'm sorry that you're experiencing this issue.


We recommend that you reinstall Grammarly for Microsoft Office by following the steps below:


1. Uninstall your current version of the Grammarly add-in (go to the Control Panel > Programs and Features > right-click Grammarly for Microsoft® Office Suite > select Uninstall.


If you use Windows 10: go to Windows search in the start menu, search for Control Panel desktop app and click Programs > Programs and Features > right-click Grammarly for Microsoft® Office Suite > select Uninstall.


2. Download the latest version from http://www.grammarly.com/office-addin/ and follow the instructions on that page to install it.


3. Open any text document in Word, find the Grammarly tab on the toolbar, then press Open Grammarly.


4. Log in with your Grammarly credentials if prompted.


5. You should see the Grammarly sidebar on the right. It should say Checking... and then start displaying suggestions.


If this doesn’t help, please try these workarounds one by one until Grammarly starts working as expected:


  • Click Always enable this add-in.
  • Disable your antivirus and try installing the add-in again.
  • Try disabling all other add-ins and then reinstall Grammarly.
  • If you're using the 64-bit version of MS Outlook, please install the 32-bit version and try installing Grammarly for MS Office again. Please refer to this article if you're not sure how to check your MS Office version: https://support.office.com/en-us/article/What-version-of-Office-am-I-using-932788b8-a3ce-44bf-bb09-e334518b8b19


Please do not hesitate to contact us with any questions or concerns you might have. We apologize for the inconvenience.


Sincerely,

{{ticket.assignee.name}}

addin_error_outlook_detected_an_addin_problem, addin addin_broken development

Thanks for your message. We're sorry that you're experiencing this issue.


To troubleshoot this, please restart MS Word. If restarting it doesn't help, please reinstall Grammarly for Microsoft Office by following these steps:


1. Uninstall your current version of the Grammarly add-in via Control Panel > Programs and Features > right-click Grammarly for Microsoft® Office Suite > select Uninstall


If you use Windows 10: go to Windows search in the start menu, search for Control Panel desktop app and click > Programs > Programs and Features > right-click Grammarly for Microsoft® Office Suite > select Uninstall


2. Download the latest version from http://www.grammarly.com/office-addin/ and follow the instructions on that page to install it


3. Open any text document in Word, find the Grammarly tab in the toolbar, then press Open Grammarly


4. Log in using your Grammarly credentials if prompted


5. You should see the Grammarly sidebar on the right. It should say Checking... and then start displaying suggestions


If any one of these steps fails, please let us know which step didn’t work and send us a screenshot of the problem that you see.


Please do not hesitate to contact us with any questions or concerns you might have. We apologize for the inconvenience.

I'm sorry that you are experiencing this issue. To resolve this, please restart MS Word/Outlook. If this doesn't help, we recommend that you use the tools supplied by your PC vendor to update your video card driver (like https://support.lenovo.com/us/en/documents/ht003029). You may also update the video card driver manually by following the instructions at http://www.howtogeek.com/135976/how-to-update-your-graphics-drivers-for-maximum-gaming-performance/. In the meantime, we suggest you use our online Grammarly Editor at https://app.grammarly.com. Also at your disposal: the native (desktop) app and the Grammarly extension for your preferred browser. Please feel free to contact us with any questions or concerns you may have. We apologize for any inconvenience. Best regards, {{ticket.assignee.name}}addin_error_system.outofmemoryexception_suggest_to_update_video_card_drivers_ms900, addin addin_broken development
Addin::Errors::“Connecting to the Grammarly server" / "Logging in” (TS-3949)

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for contacting Grammarly! I'm happy to answer this for you.


To work reliably, Grammarly needs a stable Internet connection. A “Connecting to the Grammarly server…” message, a “Not connected” notification, or a never-ending "Logging in" message can indicate a problem with your local network, your Internet service provider, or your computer settings.


Here are a few suggestions that may help:


1. Your system administrator or Internet network administrator must ensure that your antivirus and firewall software allows access to the following Internet addresses:


capi.grammarly.com (ports 80 and 443)

data.grammarly.com (ports 80 and 443)

auth.grammarly.com (ports 80 and 443)


The network administrator may need to add exception rules for the above addresses to your firewall and antivirus software.


2. If you use a proxy server, please check whether it supports the WebSocket protocol.


You may need to check with your network administrator or ISP about that. Your system administrator can read more on WebSocket support in this article: https://support.grammarly.com/hc/en-us/articles/115000090731


This article can help you check whether you are using a proxy: https://support.grammarly.com/hc/en-us/articles/115000090431


I hope this helps, but please let me know if you need any further assistance.


Best wishes,

{{ticket.assignee.name}}

addin_error_connecting_to_the_g_server_or_logging_in, addin addin_broken development

If you don't have this option, log in to Windows using the administrator account and install the add-in. Please let us know if this doesn't help, or if you have any further questions. It seems that some other system process is preventing you from performing the uninstallation.

1. Press the Start button (Windows Key) and type “update”
2. From the results, select Check for Updates
3. In the window that opens, click Check for updates
4. After installing all the updates, restart the PC and try uninstalling the add-in then

addin addin_broken development installation, addin_failed_to_uninstall_step1
Addin::Failed to Uninstall - Step 2 (TS-4159)

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for your message. I am sorry to hear that the issue persists.


To troubleshoot this, please run Control Panel as administrator by following these steps:

1. Right-click anywhere on your desktop, click New, and select Shortcut. In the window that opens, paste C:\Windows\System32\control.exe to the "Location" field and click Next. Type a name for your shortcut and click Finish.

​​

2. Right-click the shortcut you created and select Run as administrator
3. Find Programs > Uninstall a Program
4. In the list of the installed programs, find and click on Grammarly For Microsoft Office Suite, select Uninstall.


I hope this helps! Please let me know if I can be of any further assistance.


Sincerely,

{{ticket.assignee.name}}

addin addin_broken development installation, addin_failed_to_uninstall_step2
Addin::G Tab Doesn't Appear in Outlook 2013 or olderHi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thank you for contacting Grammarly! I'm happy to assist you today. Please note that the Grammarly tab appears in Outlook only after you have clicked "New E-mail" to compose a message. Additionally, the following system requirements must be met to operate Grammarly for Microsoft Office on your computer: - Compatible operating systems: Windows 7, Windows 8, Windows 8.1, Windows 10. - Microsoft® Office: 2007, 2010, 2013, or 2016. If you don't see the Grammarly tab after you've installed Grammarly for Microsoft Office, please follow the steps described in this article: https://support.grammarly.com/hc/en-us/articles/115000090511 Please feel free to contact us with any questions or concerns you may have. We suggest that you update Malwarebytes to the latest version to resolve the issue. Please visit this page https://support.malwarebytes.com/docs/DOC-1125 to learn how to update Malwarebytes. I hope this helps, but please let me know if you need any further assistance. We apologize for any inconvenience. Sincerely, {{ticket.assignee.name}}addin_harm_message_malwarebytes, addin development
Addin::Harm Message - Norton AntivirusHi {{ticket.requester.name}}, Thanks for contacting Grammarly. Unfortunately, Norton AntiVirus falsely flags the Grammarly installer as harmful or untrustworthy. To lift the flag, we are required to register each new version with Symantec. We do not currently do that because we don't think it's a fair way to vet the safety of software. Please disregard the threat warning and proceed with the installation. To give yourself peace of mind, you can submit the GrammarlyAddInSetup.exe file to https://www.virustotal.com/ for online analysis, where you should see that Norton AntiVirus is the only one that flags our program as harmful. Please don't hesitate to contact us with any questions or concerns you might have. We are committed to making your experience with Grammarly pleasant and rewarding. Best regards, {{ticket.assignee.name}}addin_harm_message_norton, addin development

You can change your document type by clicking General in the Grammarly toolbar and selecting your preferred one:


​​


Note: This feature comes with Grammarly Premium.


I hope this helps, but feel free to reach out for any further assistance.

Addin::How To::Change Language Preference (TS-2167)

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for contacting Grammarly!


To change your language preference in Grammarly for Microsoft Office, please open Word or Outlook, then click to open the Grammarly tab. Click Settings > Language preference, then select your preferred dialect in the Online Editor window that will open next.


After that, close MS Word/Outlook and reopen it for the change to take effect.


I hope this helps! Please feel free to contact us with any questions or comments you may have.


Best regards,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

You can tweak your settings to make Grammarly work only when you enable it. Simply go to Settings in the Grammarly tab, then uncheck the box next to "Open Grammarly by default when Word/Outlook is opened." I hope this helps! Hey {{ticket.requester.name}},


Thanks for contacting Grammarly Support! I'm happy to clarify this for you.


Unfortunately, the Download PDF Report feature is not available in the interface of Grammarly for Microsoft Office at this time.


If you'd like to download a PDF report of your document statistics, go to the Grammarly Editor either at https://app.grammarly.com or via the native (desktop) app, open any document and click Correct with Assistant, then go to Performance and select Download PDF Report in the pop-up menu that will open:




I hope this helps, but please do not hesitate to contact me with any further questions.

Addin::How To::Install for "All Users"

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for contacting Grammarly Support!


To resolve the issue, we suggest that you install the Grammarly add-in for "all users":


  1. Download Grammarly for Microsoft Office at https://grammarly.com/office-addin
  2. Double-click the GrammarlyAddInSetup.exe file
  3. When you see “Welcome to Grammarly” window, click Get Started while pressing Shift and Ctrl keys on your keyboard.
  4. Check the Install for all users option and click Next:


​


If you don't see the option to install for "all users", please download and run this file: https://gram.ly/HSJT


I hope this helps! Please feel free to contact us with any additional questions you may have.


Sincerely,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}


addin_install_for_all_users, addin development
Addin::How To::Install on ParallelsHi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thank you for your message. I’m happy to answer this for you! If you are running Parallels on your Mac, you can install Grammarly for Microsoft Office inside Parallels in the same way you would do it on any PC. First, launch Parallels on your Mac. Open your preferred browser inside Parallels, download the latest version of Grammarly for Microsoft Office at http://www.grammarly.com/office-addin/, then follow the instructions of that page to install it. Please note that your Parallels should mirror Windows 7, Windows 8, Windows 8.1, or Windows 10 operating systems. I hope you enjoy using our product, and please do let me know if you have any further questions. Sincerely, {{ticket.assignee.name}}addin_how_to_install_on_parallels, addin information development
Addin::How To::Install on Terminal Server/Silent Installation

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for reaching out!


I'm pleased to confirm that Grammarly for Microsoft Office can be installed on a terminal server. Simply run the installation for "all users":


  1. Download Grammarly for Microsoft Office at https://grammarly.com/office-addin
  2. Double-click the GrammarlyAddInSetup.exe file
  3. When you see “Welcome to Grammarly” window, press and hold Shift and Ctrl keys on your keyboard and then click Get Started
  4. Check the Install for all users option and click Next:


​


If you need to perform a quiet background install manually, please run this command in the command line:

GrammarlyAddInSetup.exe /fastforallmode /silent


You can use this command for uninstallation:

GrammarlyAddInSetup.exe /fastforallmode /silent /uninstall


Please feel free to contact us with any questions or concerns you may have. We are committed to making your experience at Grammarly pleasant and rewarding.


Sincerely,

{{ticket.assignee.name}}

addin_how_to_install_on_terminal_server, addin information development
Addin::How To::Manually Turn On Add-in in Outlook

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for contacting Grammarly Support! I'm happy to assist you with this.


When you finish writing your email, simply click Open Grammarly, sign in if prompted, and Grammarly for Microsoft Outlook will start checking your message.

If you'd like to open Grammarly when you start replying to someone's message, select that email in your current inbox and click Reply with Grammarly.


I hope this helps, but please let us know if we can assist you further.


Hope you have a great day!


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

addin development, addin_how_to_manually_turn_on_addin_in_outlook
Addin::How To::Prevent Automatic Update

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for contacting Grammarly! I'm happy to assist you today.


To stop Grammarly for Microsoft Office from updating automatically, block the "download-office.grammarly.com" domain in your Windows Firewall.


To block the download-office.grammarly.com domain in the Windows Firewall, please follow these instructions:


  1. Click the Windows button and start typing "Notepad". Then, right-click Notepad and choose Run as administrator
  2. In Notepad, click File > Open. In the address bar, paste or type this text: %systemroot%\system32\drivers\etc\
  3. Select All files in the Type of file section:

    ​

  4. Double-click the hosts file
  5. In the file, type 0.0.0.0 download-office.grammarly.com

    Note: You need to press the Tab button twice after typing 0.0.0.0

  6. Exit the Notepad and click Save to save the changes.


I hope this helps! Please do not hesitate to contact us with any questions or concerns you might have.


Kindly,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

addin development, addin_how_to_prevent_automatic_update
Addin::How To::Reinstall (DEEP Uninstall+Install)

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for your message. I'm sorry to hear that you're experiencing this issue.


We recommend that you follow these steps to resolve the issue with Grammarly for Microsoft Office:


  1. Open MS Word > File. Then, please go to Options > Add-ins. In the Manage section, click Go..., select Grammarly in the menu that opens next, then click Remove and close MS Word

  2. Open MS Outlook > File. Then, please go to Options > Add-ins. In the Manage section, click Go..., and select Grammarly in the menu that opens next, then click Remove and close MS Outlook

  3. Uninstall the Grammarly add-in at Control Panel > Programs and Features > right-click on Grammarly for Microsoft® Office Suite> select Uninstall.

    If you use Windows 10:
    Right-click the Start button, and select Apps and Features on the pop-up menu. Click on Grammarly for Microsoft® Office Suite > select Uninstall.

  4. Open the following directory in This PC: %LocalAppData%/ and delete the Grammarly folder

  5. Download and install the latest add-in from http://www.grammarly.com/office-addin/

  6. Open MS Word/Outlook and see if the issue persists.


I hope this helps! Please do not hesitate to contact us with any questions or concerns you might have.


Sincerely,

{{ticket.assignee.name}}


addin development, addin_how_to_reinstall_deep_uninstall_install
Addin::How To::Reinstall (Uninstall+Install)

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for your message.


We recommend that you reinstall Grammarly for Microsoft Office by following the steps below:


1. Uninstall your current version of the Grammarly add-in via Control Panel > Programs and Features > right-click on Grammarly for Microsoft® Office Suite > select Uninstall.

If you use Windows 10:
Right-click the Start button in the lower left corner of the screen, and select Apps and Features on the pop-up menu. Click on Grammarly for Microsoft® Office Suite > select Uninstall.


2. Download the latest version from http://www.grammarly.com/office-addin/ and follow the instructions on that page to install it.


3. Open any text document in Word, find the Grammarly tab in the toolbar, then click Open Grammarly.


4. Log in using your Grammarly credentials if prompted.


5. You should see the Grammarly sidebar on the right. It should say Checking... and then start displaying suggestions.


If any of these steps doesn't work, please let us know exactly which step that is and send us a screenshot of the problem that you see.


Please do not hesitate to contact us with any questions or concerns you might have.


Sincerely,

{{ticket.assignee.name}}


addin development, addin_how_to_reinstall_or_uninstall_and_install

To troubleshoot this, please do the following: 1. Uninstall .NET Framework: go to Control Panel > Programs > select Microsoft .NET Framework and uninstall it 2. Download and install the latest version from https://www.microsoft.com/net/download/dotnet-framework-runtime I hope this helps, but please let me know if you need any further assistance. We apologize for any inconvenience. Regards, {{ticket.assignee.first_name}}development, addin, addin_reinstall_.net_framework
Addin::How To::Reinstall as Administrator

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for contacting Grammarly! I'm happy to assist you today.


I suggest that you follow these steps to resolve the issue:


1. Uninstall your current version of the Grammarly add-in via Control Panel > Programs and Features > right-click on Grammarly for Microsoft® Office Suite > select Uninstall.

If you use Windows 10:
Right-click the Start button in the lower left corner of the screen, and select Apps and Features on the pop-up menu. Click on Grammarly for Microsoft® Office Suite > select Uninstall.


2. Download the latest version from http://www.grammarly.com/office-addin


3. Right-click on the GrammarlyAddInSetup.exe file that has been downloaded to your machine and choose "Run as administrator". If you don't have this option, log in to Windows using the administrator account and install the add-in


Please let us know if this doesn't help, or if you have any further questions.

Addin::How To::Repair MS Office

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for contacting Grammarly Support!


I'm sorry you are experiencing this issue. To troubleshoot this, please repair Microsoft Office as described here:


1. Right-click the Start button in the lower left corner of the screen, and select Apps and Features in the pop-up menu.

2. Select the Microsoft Office product you want to repair, and click Modify.

3. In the window How would you like to repair your Office Programs, select Online Repair > Repair.


I hope this helps, but please let me know if you need any further assistance. We apologize for any inconvenience.


Regards,

{{ticket.assignee.first_name}}

development addin, addin_how_to_repair_ms_office
Addin::How To::See Track Changes (Unavailable error message too)Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thanks for contacting Grammarly! I'm happy to answer this for you. When you correct your text in Word and the Track Changes mode is on, any changes you make with Grammarly are tracked as inserted or deleted. However, all of the comments are hidden while Grammarly is enabled. You can view your tracked changes after you click Disable Grammarly, navigate to the Review tab, and set Track Changes mode to All Markup (for Word 2016 and 2013) or to Final: Show Markup (Word 2010 and 2007). Please do not hesitate to contact us with any questions or concerns you might have. Sincerely, {{ticket.assignee.name}}addin development, addin_how_to_see_track_changes_unavailable_error_message_too
Addin::How To::Send Error Details/Logs (KB Link)Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thank you for your message! Please take a moment to review this article and send us the error details: https://support.grammarly.com/hc/en-us/articles/115000090592 This information will help our engineers investigate this issue and provide you with an effective solution to it as soon as possible. Thank you and many apologies for the inconvenience, {{ticket.assignee.name}}addin development, addin_how_to_send_error_details_kb_link
Addin::How To::Uninstall

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for contacting Grammarly Support! We apologize that Grammarly did not perform for you as expected.


You can uninstall your current version of Grammarly for Microsoft Office via the Control Panel > Programs and Features > right-click Grammarly for Microsoft® Office Suite > select Uninstall.


If you use Windows 10, go to the Windows search in the start menu, search for Control Panel desktop app and click Programs > Programs and Features > right-click Grammarly for Microsoft® Office Suite > select Uninstall.


Please do not hesitate to contact us with any questions or concerns you might have. We hope to serve you again in the future.

Addin::How To::Uninstall from Outlook but Keep in WordHey {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thanks for contacting Grammarly! If you'd like to keep Grammarly in Word but not in Outlook, please follow the steps below. If you use Outlook 2007, please use this article: http://office.microsoft.com/en-001/help/enable-or-disable-add-ins-in-office-programs-HA010034127.aspx#BM17 If you use Outlook 2010 or newer, follow these steps: 1. Click the File tab, choose Options, then click Add-Ins. 2. Select the type of add-ins you want to disable from the Manage dropdown box at the bottom of the window. Click Go to open a dialog box. 3. In the dialog box, you can uncheck any add-in you'd like to disable. 4. Click OK to save the setting. Please do not hesitate to contact us with any questions or concerns you might have. Sincerely, {{ticket.assignee.name}}addin information development, addin_how_to_uninstall_from_outlook_but_keep_in_word
Addin::How To::Use Add-in

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for contacting Grammarly. I'm happy to assist you today!


Follow these steps to use Grammarly in a Word document:


  • Open a Word document that you would like to review.


  • Find the Grammarly tab on the toolbar and press "Open Grammarly."


  • You should see the Grammarly sidebar on the right. It should say "Checking..." and then start displaying suggestions.


If you have a subscription to Grammarly Premium, you can select the type of document you’re working on to help Grammarly provide more specific corrections.


You can toggle individual Grammarly checks (grammar, punctuation, and style) on and off by clicking their corresponding buttons in the Grammarly toolbar. Grammarly Premium users can also enable vocabulary suggestions and our plagiarism checker. Please note that these options are turned off by default.


Suggestions will pop up on the right side of your document. You can apply each one to your text with a simple click.


For a more detailed explanation of a particular correction, click the downward-pointing arrow.


Additionally, we suggest that you check out our step-by-step guide with screenshots at https://support.grammarly.com/hc/en-us/articles/115000091672


I hope this helps! Please don't hesitate to contact us with any questions or concerns you might have.


Sincerely,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

addin_how_to, addin information
Addin::Ignored Suggestions Reappear (MS-1691 - Workaround)

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for contacting Grammarly! My name is {{ticket.assignee.first_name}}, and I'm happy to assist you today.


At this time, if you ignore a suggestion, it will reappear if you open the document again. Our development team is currently working on fixing the issue with reappearing suggestions that were ignored before. Please rest assured we are doing everything possible to resolve this.


However, you can take advantage of our Add to dictionary feature. Whenever your word is marked as a mistake, you will see a card with a little book icon. Clicking on it will add this word to your dictionary and prevent it from being marked as a mistake in the future.


Also, we offer a feature called Personal Dictionary that allows you to manage the words you've added at any time. To access this feature, go to the Account section in the Grammarly Editor, and then select Customize:


​


Additionally, we suggest that you regularly save your document during the editing process to prevent this issue from occurring.


I hope this helps! Please don't hesitate to contact me with any additional questions or requests.


Sincerely,


{{ticket.assignee.first_name}}

addin addin_broken development, addin_ignored_suggestions_reappear_workaround_ms1691, system_bug development_sent_to_development

I know that it's definitely not an ideal workaround, but breaking your XXX-page document into 50-page sections, naming each section to keep them in order (e.g., part 01, part 02, etc.) and working on each document one by one should resolve this issue. We suggest that you follow these steps to resolve the issue:


1. Log out of all Grammarly products you're using


2. Log in to your Grammarly account at grammarly.com and navigate to https://account.grammarly.com/customize


3. Switch your language preference to any other one and then back again


4. In Word/Outlook, click Log out:


​​

Addin::Leaves Underlines in Outlook (Workaround) - MS-1265Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thank you for reporting the issue. The technical team is aware of the problem and they are currently working on it. Please rest assured we are doing everything possible to resolve this. We appreciate your patience. In the interim, we recommend that you disable Grammarly before sending e-mails: - click the G button in the ribbon, or - close the sidebar with the "x" If this doesn't help, please highlight the text in your e-mail before sending it (Ctrl+A), then add underlines (Ctrl+U) and remove all underlines (Ctrl+U). Please feel free to contact us with any questions or concerns you may have. We apologize for the inconvenience. Sincerely, {{ticket.assignee.name}}development development_sent_to_development, addin_bug_leaves_underlines_in_outlook_suggest_workaround_sent_to_devs_ms1265, system_bug, addin addin_broken
Addin::More Information (Crashdump Request) - Word/Outlook Crashes{DELETE THIS and reply in a public mode Don't forget to download and attach grammarly_crashdump_tools.zip from https://grammarly.atlassian.net/wiki/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=162369102 DELETE THIS^^} Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thank you for your message. To help our engineers troubleshoot this for you, please provide us with the Word/Outlook crash dump files by following these instructions: Install Automated Dump Collection Utility 1. Download the grammarly_crashdump_tools.zip file attached to this message. 2. Extract it to the C:\grammarly_crashdump_tools folder. 3. Double-click to run install_crashdump.reg and click Yes in each prompt window that opens. Use Automated Dump Collection Utility When you run Word or Outlook after installing the utility, a black console window will appear. Please don't close it — it will close automatically after the Outlook or Word window closes. It monitors Outlook and Word for crashes and saves crash dumps to the C:\grammarly_crashdump_tools\CrashDumps folder. After Word or Outlook crashes, the pop-up "Windows is checking for a solution to the problem" will appear. It is important that you don't click Cancel to close the pop-up. Wait until the Close program button appears and click on it. Note: Saving crash dump files may take several minutes, so you'll need to be patient. Sending Crash Dump Files Send the three crash dump files from the C:\grammarly_crashdump_tools\CrashDumps folder to Grammarly support along with the version of the Office Add-in you use. (If you used the utility more than once, make sure to send us the latest three files.) To check the version of your Grammarly add-in for Microsoft Office, please click on the Grammarly tab in the Word panel, then click About. Because the crash dump files are big (more than 600Mb), you will need to share them via cloud storage (e.g., Google Drive, Dropbox, OneDrive, etc.) Google Drive: https://support.google.com/drive/answer/2424368?hl=en&co=GENIE.Platform=Desktop https://support.google.com/drive/answer/2494822?hl=en&co=GENIE.Platform=Desktop OneDrive: https://support.office.com/en-us/article/Upload-photos-and-files-to-OneDrive-b00ad3fe-6643-4b16-9212-de00ef02b586 https://support.office.com/en-US/article/Share-OneDrive-files-and-folders-9fcc2f7d-de0c-4cec-93b0-a82024800c07 Dropbox: https://www.dropbox.com/help/4455 https://www.dropbox.com/help/274 Once you have uploaded the files to cloud storage, please remove C:\grammarly_crashdump_tools\CrashDumps before each run of Outlook and Word because it takes a lot of disk space. Uninstall Automated Dump Collection Utility 1. Double-click to run uninstall_crashdump.reg and click Yes in each prompt window that opens. 2. Remove the C:\grammarly_crashdump_tools folder. Thank you and many apologies for the inconvenience, {{ticket.assignee.name}}addin_request_more_information_crashdump_because_outlook_or_word_crashes, development, addin addin_broken
Addin::More Information (Request) - Add-in DiagnosticsHi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thank you for writing in today! I'm sorry that you're experiencing this issue. To help us troubleshoot this for you, please provide the diagnostics information by following the instructions provided here: https://support.grammarly.com/hc/en-us/articles/115000090612 Our development team will need this information to investigate the issue. You can leave the diagnostics mode on for a couple of days until you experience the issue. After you have reproduced the issue, please send the diagnostics result to us by clicking "Send user activity data to Grammarly" link. Please make sure you also send the troubleshooting request ID to support@grammarly.com Thank you and many apologies for the inconvenience, {{ticket.assignee.name}}development_request_more_information development, addin addin_request_more_information_addin_diagnostics

Thank you, {{ticket.assignee.first_name}}addin_request_more_information_ask_to_check_addin_version, development, addin
Addin::More Information (Request) - Outlook/Addin Crashes (TS-4166) - Step 2

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for letting us know about this issue. I'd really like to find out more about the problem that you mentioned so we can help you.


Would you mind answering the questions below to help us understand the issue better?


1. Under which circumstances does MS Outlook/add-in crash:


- At any time

- When you close the email

- When you perform specific actions. If so, what are they?


2. How often does this happen?


3. Do you see an error message when MS Outlook/add-in crashes? If so, could you send us a screenshot?


4. Does the issue occur when you check short emails?


Thank you for your time and help,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for letting us know about this issue. I'd really like to find out more about the problem that you mentioned so we can help you.


Would you mind answering the questions below to help us understand the issue better?


1. Under which circumstances does MS Word/add-in crash:


- At any time

- When you close the document

- When you perform specific actions. If so, what are they?


2. How often does this happen?


3. Do you see an error message when MS Word/add-in crashes? If so, could you send us a screenshot?


4. How many documents do you have open when the problem occurs?


5. What was the size of the document you were working on when MS Word/add-in crashed?


6. Does the problem still occur if you check documents that are 15 pages or fewer?


7. Do you use any antivirus software?


Thank you!

The new Grammarly add-in is simply better in every way. All you need to do is to update your Office add-in from within a Word document while being logged in at www.grammarly.com. Addin::No Suggestions Shown (Monitor/Resolution Issue) (TS-4112)

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for writing in today! I'm sorry that you're experiencing this issue.


To troubleshoot this, please do the following:


For ultra-wide monitors: Move your MS Word/Outlook window to the left side of the monitor.


For dual monitors: Move your MS Word/Outlook window to the left (main) monitor.


If the issue persists, would you mind answering the questions below to help us understand the root cause better?


  1. Are your "Scale & Layout" and "Resolution" options set to recommended? To check this, please right-click on the desktop and click "Display settings".
  2. What is the size and resolution of your display?
  3. Does your text contain any symbols other than letters (for example, < >)?


Thank you for your time and help,


Kindly,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

development, addin_no_suggestions_shown_in_word_monitor_resolution_issue, addin addin_broken
Addin::No Suggestions Shown (No Sidebar - Windows Update Issue) (TS-4112)

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for your message.


According to our analysis, the recent Windows update might be causing some compatibility issues with Grammarly for Microsoft Office. Let’s try to troubleshoot this issue together.


To resolve this, you’ll need to follow the instructions provided below. I know they might seem terrifying, but we’re confident that following them should help you troubleshoot the issue.


  • Delete Grammarly's records from the registry:

  1. Open Regedit: click the Windows button, type regedit, then click Enter

  2. In Regedit, open the following directory: Computer\HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Grammarly\6.0\Settings

  3. Delete all records from the Word and Outlook folders.


  • Repair .NET Framework using this tool https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=30135 and restart your PC.


  • Disable the video card driver:

  1. Right-click on the desktop > Display settings > Advanced display settings > Display adapter properties > Properties > Driver > Disable Device.
  2. Try using the Grammarly add-in and see if the issue persists.

  • If disabling the video card driver helps, please reinstall it:

  1. Click Uninstall Device at Display settings > Advanced display settings > Display adapter properties > Properties > Driver.
  2. Restart your PC and go to Display settings > Advanced display settings > Display adapter properties > Properties > Driver and click Update driver.


  • Download and install DirectX from this page https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=35 , restart PC and see if the issue persists.


If none of the above helps, we recommend that you reinstall MS Office on your computer.

Please let me know if there’s anything else I can do to help. We apologize for any inconvenience.

Kindly,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

development, addin_no_suggestions_shown_no_sidebar_windows_update_issue, addin addin_broken sidebar

In the meantime, we suggest you check your text and documents by uploading them to the online Grammarly Editor at https://app.grammarly.com. Also at your disposal: Grammarly's browser extension, and the native (desktop) app.


I’m going to close this case, but if you have more information regarding this issue, please reply to this email and the case will be re-opened for further investigation. We apologize for the inconvenience.

Addin::Quick Parts Deleted in Outlook (TS-4247)

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for contacting us today! I appreciate the opportunity to assist you.

Please rest assured that our technical team is already aware of the problem you reported, but unfortunately, we don’t have a solution to it yet. I'm sorry to say that this will not be a quick fix and I cannot provide you with an estimated timeframe, as the developers will need some time to analyze the cause of this issue.

In the meantime, our engineers suggest to try the following workaround:

  1. Close Grammarly when you are adding Quick Parts
  2. Ensure Grammarly is disabled when you close MS Outlook so that your content is saved


We apologize for the inconvenience and appreciate your patience as our engineers work on fixing this issue in the future. If there's anything else we can assist you with, please let us know.


Kind regards,


{{ticket.assignee.first_name}}

addin_quick_parts_deleted_in_ms_outlook_ts4247, addin addin_broken development
Addin::Recover Deleted Document (Deny)

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for writing in today!


Unfortunately, we cannot recover Word or Outlook documents checked with Grammarly for Microsoft Office. Grammarly only tracks, edits, and stores the document online as long as the editing session is active (i.e., while Grammarly is enabled in the document).


As a workaround, you can search for the backup file of your Word document (.wbk) if you have backups enabled in Word.


If this doesn’t help, you can search for AutoRecover files manually: open Microsoft Word > click the File tab and select Recent > at the bottom of the menu, select Recover Unsaved Documents. You can search for your file there.


Please let me know if I can be of further assistance.


Kind regards,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}


addin donotsurvey, addin_docs_not_recoverable

In the meantime, we suggest you use our online Grammarly Editor at https://app.grammarly.com. Also at your disposal: the native (desktop) app and the Grammarly extension for your preferred browser.


Please accept our apologies for the inconvenience. Should you have any additional questions or comments, please let us know.

Addin::Sidebar Issues in Outlook (Update Outlook/Windows) - Step 1

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for contacting Grammarly! I'm sorry to hear that you're experiencing this issue.


To resolve this, please do the following:


Update MS Outlook


Open Outlook, go to File > Office Account, click the Update Options button and select Update now, as indicated in this screenshot:


​

Update Windows


Click the Start button (the Windows key), then click Settings > Update & security > Windows Update and select Check for updates (even if you see the "You're up to date" note). If any updates are available, install them.


If this doesn't help, please let me know and we'll investigate this further. Many apologies for the inconvenience!

Kind regards,

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},

In order to run Grammarly for Microsoft Office, your computer must have:


— A compatible operating system: Windows 7, Windows 8 and 8.1, Windows 10


— A compatible version of Microsoft® Office: 2007, 2010, 2013, 2016, or 2019


Also, Grammarly for Microsoft Office can be used with an Office 365 subscription as long as your plan provides one of the supported Microsoft® Office versions.

Addin::System Slow or Word/Outlook Crashes - Step 1 (Suggest to Disable Antivirus and Other Add-ins)

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Please accept our apologies for this issue. Our development team has looked into this case, and they suggest you do the following:


1. Disable all other add-ins in Word/Outlook: go to File > Options > Add-ins > Manage select COM Add-ins > Go and disable all add-ins except Grammarly in that window


2. Temporarily disable your antivirus/firewall software and see if the issue persists then


If temporarily disabling your antivirus/firewall software helps, we suggest that you add Grammarly to that software's whitelist to resolve the issue.


Please let us know if this doesn't help, or if you have any further questions.


Sincerely,

{{ticket.assignee.first_name}}
