To cancel your Grammarly Business subscription and prevent all future scheduled payments, please follow these instructions:

1. Go to https://admin-panel.grammarly.com/administration
2. Navigate to the Subscription tab
3. Click cancel your subscription at the bottom of the page
4. Click Complete cancellation.

Business::How To::Change Email (Admin Asked)

* Check for social sign-in and/or misspelled email address



Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for contacting Grammarly! I'm happy to assist you today.

To update the email address associated with your admin account, please sign in to the Grammarly website, navigate to the Admin panel, click on Administration, and update your email address. Here is the direct link: https://admin-panel.grammarly.com/administration

You should receive a confirmation email from Grammarly shortly after you update your address. If you’re not receiving the email, try the following:

  1. Check your spam or junk folder and any tabs you may have in your inbox.
  2. Open your email settings and check for typos in the email address. If the address is incorrect, you can change it by following the steps above.
  3. Try adding info@send.grammarly.com, info@em.grammarly.com, and donotreply@grammarly.com to your address book and then update your email address again.


I hope this helps, but please feel free to contact me with any further questions or comments.


Best wishes,


{{ticket.assignee.first_name}}

  4. Submit your preferred billing details and click the Update button to save the changes.

Business::How To::Delete and Resend Invitation

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for contacting Grammarly!


To void an invitation and send it to another team member, please follow these steps:

  • Go to the Members tab in the Admin Panel: https://admin-panel.grammarly.com/members
  • Select Invited in the top bar
  • Click the Remove (trash can) button next to an invited member's email address
  • Select Members and Click Invite members
  • Enter the email address along with the first and last name of the person you’d like to invite, and finish by clicking Invite and Add.


Please feel free to contact us with any questions or concerns you may have. We are committed to making your experience with Grammarly pleasant and rewarding.


Regards,


{{ticket.assignee.first_name}}

Business::How To::Transfer Admin Permissions

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for contacting Grammarly!

If you'd like to transfer your admin rights to your colleague, please sign in to the Grammarly website, navigate to the Admin panel, click on Administration, and choose Transfer admin permissions. Here is the direct link: https://admin-panel.grammarly.com/administration

You will be required to enter your password to confirm the transfer of admin permissions.

You should receive a confirmation email from Grammarly shortly after the update. If you’re not receiving the email, try the following:

  1. Check your spam or junk folder and any tabs you may have in your inbox.
  2. Open your email settings and check for typos in the email address. If the address is incorrect, you can change it by following the steps above.
  3. Try adding info@em.grammarly.com to your address book and then update your email address again.


Note: the email address should belong to an existing member of your team. If it's someone who is not on your team, please invite this member to your team first by following the instructions here: https://support.grammarly.com/hc/en-us/articles/115000931852-How-do-I-add-team-members-

I hope this helps, but please feel free to contact me with any further questions or comments.


Best wishes,


{{ticket.assignee.first_name}}

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},

Note: This option will become available to you if we switch your account to the email address and password type of registration. If you’d like me to proceed with that, please let me know and I'll update your account. Afterward, you'll be asked to set a new password for your account, and then you’ll be able to transfer admin permissions.

business_how_to_transfer_admin_permissions_social_signin_offer, business social_signin subscription
Business::Invitation not received (Admin Asked)Hey {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thanks for reaching out! If you sent an invitation email, but your team member cannot find it after checking their spam folder, suggest adding info@em.grammarly.com to their contact list. Afterward, we recommend sending the invitation email again. If this doesn't help, it must be your team member's firewall/email server or filter that is blocking Grammarly's emails. Please instruct your team member to contact their email service provider's Customer Support to whitelist the following IPs and email address to ensure that all Grammarly emails get through: IPs: 199.122.124.187 13.111.6.89 Emails: info@em.grammarly.com info@send.grammarly.com donotreply@grammarly.com Once your team member follows these steps, please resend the invitation. I hope this helps, but please let us know if you require any further assistance. Kind regards, {{ticket.assignee.first_name}}business_invitation_not_received, business
Business::Invitations/Confirmation Emails Not Received (Ask to Whitelist)

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for contacting Grammarly. I'm sorry that you're experiencing this issue.


To locate the invitation/confirmation email, we recommend following these steps:

1. Check your spam folder (and any email filters you've set up) to make sure the message isn't being directed away from your email inbox.
2. If you cannot find the confirmation/invitation email after checking your spam folder, try adding info@em.grammarly.com to your contact list. Afterward, we recommend sending yourself the confirmation email/asking the team admin to send the invitation again.

If these instructions don't work, we suggest that your IT department whitelist the following IPs and email addresses to ensure the delivery of all Grammarly emails:

IPs:
199.122.124.187
13.111.6.89

Email addresses:
info@em.grammarly.com

info@send.grammarly.com
donotreply@grammarly.com

Afterward, please send yourself the confirmation email again, or ask your team admin to resend the invitation.

I hope this helps, but feel free to contact us for any further assistance.


Regards,


{{ticket.assignee.first_name}}


business_invitations_confirmation_emails_not_received_ask_to_whitelist, business
Business::Mention Grammarly Business (Upsell - Advanced)


If you’d like to get Grammarly for your workplace, please visit https://www.grammarly.com/business.


Grammarly Business is designed to help every member of your team produce polished, high-quality writing that reflects well on your organization.


Plans start at just $15 per user/month and include:


  • Sophisticated corrections for complex spelling, grammar, and punctuation errors

  • Advanced suggestions for making writing more concise, engaging, polite, and inclusive

  • Smooth integration with existing workflows

  • Individual accounts for three to 99 team members

  • Centralized billing and admin dashboard

  • Priority email support

  • 256-bit AES and SSL/TLS encryption

  • GDPR and Privacy Shield compliance


To learn more about how Grammarly can give your team an edge, you can also contact our Sales team at sales@grammarly.com. Companies big and small do their best work using Grammarly.


Kind regards,


{{ticket.assignee.first_name}}

business information, business_mention_and_try_upselling_advanced

If you’d like to get Grammarly for your workplace, please visit https://www.grammarly.com/business. Plans start at just $15 per user/month, and include individual accounts for your team members, enterprise-ready controls and monitoring, priority email support, and centralized billing. Companies big and small do their best work using Grammarly.

Business::Request to Add an Additional Admin

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for contacting Grammarly! I'm happy to assist you today.


At this time, there is no option to add an additional admin to your account, but thank you for letting us know that it’s something you’d like to see. I’ve forwarded your request to our product team so that they can take it into account when making development plans.

As a workaround, you can transfer your admin rights to your colleague, please sign in to the Grammarly website, navigate to the Admin panel, click on Administration, and choose Transfer admin permissions. Here is the direct link: https://admin-panel.grammarly.com/administration

You will be required to enter your password to confirm the transfer of admin permissions.

You should receive a confirmation email from Grammarly shortly after the update. If you’re not receiving the email, try the following:

  1. Check your spam or junk folder and any tabs you may have in your inbox.
  2. Open your email settings and check for typos in the email address. If the address is incorrect, you can change it by following the steps above.
  3. Try adding info@em.grammarly.com to your address book and then update your email address again.


Note: The email address should belong to an existing member of your team. If it's someone who is not on your team, please invite this member to your team first by following the instructions here: https://support.grammarly.com/hc/en-us/articles/115000931852-How-do-I-add-team-members-

I hope this helps, but please feel free to contact me with any further questions or comments.


Kind regards,


{{ticket.assignee.first_name}}

Hi {{ticket.requester.name}},

We offer monthly and annual subscriptions to Grammarly Business (https://grammarly.com/business). The current rates are as follows:

Monthly Subscription — $25 USD per user/month
Annual Subscription — $15 USD per user/month*


*billed yearly as one payment of $180 USD


Grammarly accepts the following payment methods: credit card, PayPal, and debit card (with the exception of Visa Electron debit cards, Mastercard Maestro, and Interac).

business_team_name_change_confirm, business
Business::Team Name Change (More Information)

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for contacting Grammarly!


At this time, there's no option to edit a team name in the admin's account. This feature is on our roadmap, but, unfortunately, we do not have any timeline for delivering this yet. Many apologies for the inconvenience.


However, I will be happy to assist you with changing your team name. To enable us to proceed with your request, please provide your preferred team name and confirm that you authorize us to set it as the default name for your Grammarly Business account.


Also, I need some additional information from you to confirm that you are the owner of the business account.


Please provide the following information:

- the reference number on your statement, if you see one (it should look similar to CO5DXT-8GCH, CO*5DXT-8GCH, 5DXT-8GCH, or qWe23zA)

OR

- last four digits of the credit card number you used for Grammarly
- card network type (e.g., VISA)
- card expiration date (month/year)
- the charge date
- the charge amount
- if you are seeing “PAYPAL” next to the charge on your credit card statement, we will need to know your PayPal email and Transaction ID


I know this process is a hassle, but this security procedure allows us to protect your account from unauthorized access.


Thank you,


{{ticket.assignee.first_name}}

Business::Unable to Invite New Members (Payment Difficulties)

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for contacting Grammarly! I'm sorry to hear that you're experiencing this issue.


It appears that all ____ seats in your Business team have already been allotted. Adding a new member will require an additional payment. Unfortunately, we were unable to process the payment for the new member(s) due to an issue with the payment method on file.


[FOR SOFT DECLINE]

Here are a few of the most common reasons why the payment may be declined:

Incorrect credit card number or expiration date
Insufficient funds
Some banks will reject charges based on location
Some banks will reject charges based on their own fraud rules

We suggest you try again and contact your credit card issuer to resolve the issue if it persists.

[FOR HARD DECLINE]

The issue can be resolved if you update your payment method and/or contact your bank to investigate the matter. To change your billing information, please follow the steps below:

  1. Go to the Admin Panel

  2. Click the Administration tab to the left, then choose the Subscription tab on top

  3. Click the Update button next to the Payment Method section on that page

  4. Submit your preferred billing details and click the Update button to save the changes.



Please do not hesitate to contact us with any questions or concerns you might have. We are committed to making your experience at Grammarly pleasant and rewarding.


Best wishes,


{{ticket.assignee.first_name}}

Business::Why More Expensive Than Premium? (Explain)

Hi {{ticket.requester.name}},


Thanks for reaching out. I'm happy to clarify this for you!

There is a price difference because of some additional features that come with Grammarly Business.

Grammarly Business includes:

  • All Premium features
  • Centralized billing
  • Team usage statistics
  • User management tools (an Admin Panel)
  • Ability to pay for a business account via an Invoice (through the sales team)


I hope this clarifies the matter, but please let me know if you have any further questions or comments.


Kind regards,

{{ticket.assignee.name}}

Our goal is to respond to your email support issues within 8 hours of receipt. If you could describe your question or request, I would be happy to assist you promptly. We focus on providing fast and high-quality responses by email, so you’re always talking to a human who can help solve your problem. Thank you for your understanding, and please feel free to contact us with any questions or concerns you might have. Sincerely, {{ticket.assignee.name}}contact, contact_no_live_chat

Desktop::"Grammarly Editor is loading" (TS-1898)

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for your message! I'm sorry that you're experiencing this issue.


Could you please temporarily disable your antivirus and firewall software and let us know whether the issue persists then?


If you cannot disable your antivirus and firewall software, please ask your IT administrator to add Grammarly to the antivirus software whitelist.


Also, if you're using a VPN or a proxy, please try disabling them as well and let us know if that doesn't help. If you are not sure whether you use a proxy, this article may help: https://support.grammarly.com/hc/en-us/articles/115000090431


Note: The desktop app doesn’t currently support proxy. This feature is on our roadmap, but unfortunately, we don’t have any timeline for delivering this yet.

Thank you and many apologies for the inconvenience,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

desktop_grammarly_editor_is_loading_ts1898, development desktop
Desktop::About Native App

Hi {{ticket.requester.name}},


Thanks for contacting Grammarly Support!


I’m happy to let you know that we offer a native app for Windows and macOS. The Grammarly native app will allow you to conveniently access the Grammarly Editor directly from your desktop.


The native app offers the same types of writing feedback as the online Grammarly Editor at grammarly.com.


Please feel free to check this guide on using the Grammarly Editor:


https://support.grammarly.com/hc/en-us/articles/360003474732


I hope this helps, but please do not hesitate to contact me if you have any questions or requests.


Kind regards,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

desktop information, desktop_about_native_app
Desktop::Any Issues on macOS (Magic Macro)

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for your message! I'm sorry that you're experiencing this issue.


Please follow these steps to troubleshoot this:


1. Close the native (desktop) app by pressing CMD+Q

2. Open the Terminal:


  • Click the Finder icon in the Dock
  • Click Go
  • Select Utilities
  • Double-click Terminal


3. Paste the following command into the Terminal window, then press Enter:


rm -r ~/Library/Application\ Support/Grammarly/


4. Open the native (desktop) app.


I hope this helps! Please let me know if there’s anything else I can do to help. We apologize for any inconvenience.


Best regards,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

desktop macOS, development desktop_development_blank_window_desktop_freezes_misplaced_underlines_login_issues_on_macos
Desktop::App Broken - Working to Resolve It Later + Close (Sent to Devs)

Hi {{ticket.requester.name}},


Thanks for contacting Grammarly!


Our technical team is already aware of the problem you reported, but unfortunately, we don’t currently have a quick fix. I can’t provide you with an estimated timeframe right now because the developers need some time to analyze the cause of the issue, but please rest assured that we won’t forget about it.


In the meantime, we suggest you use our online Grammarly Editor at https://app.grammarly.com. Also at your disposal: the Grammarly extension for your preferred browser and Grammarly for Microsoft Office (available to Windows OS users).


I’m going to close this case, but if you have more information regarding this issue, please reply to this email and the case will be re-opened for further investigation. We apologize for any inconvenience.


Best regards,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

desktop development, desktop_app_broken_sent_to_devs development_sent_to_development

Desktop::How To::Copy-Paste Text

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for contacting Grammarly Support! I'm happy to assist you with this.


The copy/paste by right-clicking is currently disabled in the Grammarly native app.


If you use Grammarly for Windows or macOS, you can copy and paste your text using the Copy to clipboard feature indicated in this screenshot:


​

Alternatively, you can use the Command+C and Command+V combination on macOS, or the Ctrl+C and Ctrl+V combination on Windows.


You can also upload .doc or .docx files to Grammarly and then download the edited document back to its source. Use the “Import” button on the dashboard and the “Export” button on the toolbar. Alternatively, you can simply drag and drop your document onto the “My Grammarly” directory.


I hope this helps, but please let us know if we can assist you further.


Hope you have a great day!


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

desktop information, desktop_how_to_copy_paste_text
Desktop::How To::Disable "Open at Login" on macOS

Hi {{ticket.requester.name}},


Thanks for contacting Grammarly Support! I'm happy to assist you with this.


You can tweak your settings to make Grammarly's native app work only when you launch it. Simply right-click on the Grammarly icon in the Dock, then hover over "Options" and unselect "Open at Login."


I hope this helps! If there's anything else we can do for you, just let me know.


Best regards,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

desktop development macOS, desktop_how_to_disable_open_at_login_macos
Desktop::How To::Import-Export

Hi {{ticket.requester.name}},


I’m glad you reached out. Here is a quick guide to importing and exporting your documents using Grammarly's native app:


You can simply drag a file you would like to proofread into the Grammarly app. Alternatively, you can use the Import document button to import your file:



The Grammarly Editor will automatically save your document to your Grammarly dashboard, but you can download the text anytime using the Export button. Here's a screenshot of what the Export option looks like:



Alternatively, you can use the Copy to clipboard feature to copy-paste your text into your preferred text editor.


I hope this helps! Please let us know if we can assist you further.

Desktop::How To::Pin to Dock (Mac)

Hi {{ticket.requester.name}},


Thanks for contacting Grammarly Support! I'm happy to assist you with this.


If the program is already running, right-click the Grammarly icon on the taskbar, select Options, and then click Keep in Dock.


If the program isn't running, click Launchpad, type in Grammarly in the search tab, right-click the Grammarly icon, select Options, and then click Keep in Dock.


I hope this helps! Please feel free to contact me with any further questions or comments.


Kindly,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

desktop information, desktop_how_to_pin_to_dock_mac
Desktop::How To::Pin to Taskbar (PC)Hi {{ticket.requester.name}}, Thanks for contacting Grammarly Support! I'm happy to assist you with this. If the program is already running, right-click the Grammarly icon on the taskbar and then click Pin this program to taskbar. If the program isn't running, click Start, find the Grammarly icon, right-click the icon, and then click Pin to Taskbar. Please feel free to contact me with any further questions or comments. Kindly, {{ticket.assignee.name}}desktop information windows, desktop_how_to_pin_to_taskbar_pc
Desktop::How To::Reinstall

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for contacting Grammarly! I'm happy to assist you today.


I recommend that you reinstall the Grammarly desktop app to resolve the issue.


For your Windows computer:


1. Click the Start button

2. Go to Control Panel -> Programs and Features

3. Right click on Grammarly and select Uninstall

4. Follow this link https://www.grammarly.com/native to install the app again


For your Mac computer:


1. Click on Finder

2. Select Applications in the Finder sidebar

3. Drag the Grammarly app from the Applications folder to the Trash (located at the end of the Dock)

4. Follow this link https://www.grammarly.com/native to install the app again


I hope this helps, but please do not hesitate to contact us with any questions or concerns.


Kindly,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

desktop development, desktop_information_how_to_reinstall
Desktop::How To::Reinstall as Administrator (Windows)

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for contacting Grammarly! I'm happy to assist you today.


I recommend that you reinstall the Grammarly desktop app as an administrator to resolve the issue.


  1. Uninstall the desktop app: navigate to the Control Panel > Programs and Features > right-click on Grammarly for Windows > select Uninstall
  2. Download the latest desktop app version from https://www.grammarly.com/native
  3. Right-click the GrammarlySetup.exe file that has been downloaded to your machine and select Run as administrator. If you don't have this option, log in to Windows using the administrator account and try installing the app again.


I hope this helps, but please do not hesitate to contact us with any questions or concerns.


Kindly,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

desktop development windows, desktop_how_to_reinstall_as_administrator_windows
Desktop::How To::UninstallHi {{ticket.requester.name}}, Thanks for contacting Grammarly Support! We apologize that Grammarly did not perform for you as expected. To uninstall Grammarly's native app, please do the following: For your Windows computer: 1. Click the Start button. 2. Go to Control Panel -> Programs and Features. 3. Right click on Grammarly and select Uninstall. For your Mac computer: 1. Click on Finder. 2. Select Applications in the Finder sidebar. 3. Drag the Grammarly app from the Applications folder to the Trash (located at the end of the Dock). You can install the native app anytime later at https://www.grammarly.com/native. Please do not hesitate to contact us with any questions or concerns you might have. Best regards, {{ticket.assignee.name}}desktop, desktop_how_to_uninstall

Development::"Error/Text Checking is Temporarily Unavailable" (Editor) (TS-2046)

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for your message! I'm sorry that you're experiencing this issue.


If you see either the "Text Checking Is Temporarily Unavailable" notification or the "Error Checking Is Temporarily Unavailable" message when checking a document, please follow the instructions below:


  1. Make sure that you successfully pass the WebSockets test here. If any section of your test results says Failed, take a look at this article.
  2. Re-login to the Grammarly Editor:

    1) Use this link to log out of the Editor: https://auth.grammarly.com/logout_redirect
    2) Sign in again at https://grammarly.com/signin using your login credentials

  3. Check whether you can reproduce the issue with your antivirus software and firewall disabled. If not, make sure that your antivirus and firewall software allows web socket connection to capi.grammarly.com. Typically, restrictions can be configured in the "whitelist" or "bypass" section of the antivirus software settings.

If the issue persists, please send us the web editor's console log as described in the second part of the article below:


https://support.grammarly.com/hc/en-us/articles/115000090251


Thank you and many apologies for any inconvenience,


{{ticket.assignee.first_name}}

development_error_checking_is_temporarily_unavailable_editor, development online_editor desktop
Development::"Your Internet connection is unstable" - Ask to Disable VPN, Proxy, Antivirus

Hello {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for your message.


Could you please temporarily disable your VPN, proxy, antivirus and firewall software, and let us know if the issue persists then?

If you are not sure you're using a proxy, this article may help:

https://support.grammarly.com/hc/en-us/articles/115000090431


Note: If temporarily disabling your antivirus/firewall software helps, we suggest that you add Grammarly to that software's whitelist to resolve the issue.


Thank you,

Development::Bug::Ignored Suggestions Reappear (Online Editor/Desktop) (TS-2841)

Hey {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for contacting Grammarly! I appreciate the opportunity to assist you with your questions.


At this time, dismissed errors reappear only if you make significant changes in a sentence where an error has been dismissed — Grammarly treats this sentence as a new one and hence rechecks it.


However, I'm happy to inform you that our development and product teams are currently working on improving the logic of how dismissed errors work.


We appreciate your patience and apologize for any inconveniences the issue has caused. If you have any further questions or comments, just let us know -- we are here to help!


Best wishes,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

Development::Bug::Language Preference Isn't Saved (TS-3715)

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for reaching out! I'm sorry to hear that you're experiencing this issue.


To resolve this, please make sure that your language preference is set to ______ English in all Grammarly products by following these steps:


1. Launch the Grammarly app on your Android or iOS device, tap the "Enable in Settings" button, and choose the language preferences

2. Click the Grammarly icon in your browser's toolbar and select your preferred setting in the dropdown menu next to “I write in”

3. Open Word or Outlook, then click to open the Grammarly tab. Click Settings > Language preference, and then select your preferred dialect

4. Go to https://account.grammarly.com/customize and select your preferred setting in the Language preference section


I hope this helps! Please feel free to contact us anytime you need assistance. We apologize for the inconvenience.


Kindly,


{{ticket.assignee.first_name}}

Development::Bug::Social Sign-in Leads to Blank Page (Step 1) - TS-3977

Hey {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for contacting Grammarly! I'm sorry that you're experiencing this issue.


It looks like the cookies in your browser are disabled. To sign in successfully, please enable cookies by following the instructions below:


To enable cookies in Chrome:


1. Copy/paste this line into your address field in Chrome: chrome:settings/content/cookies

2. Check Allow site to save and read cookies data on the page that will open next

3. Uncheck Block third-party cookies


To enable cookies in Safari:


1. Go to Preferences

2. Select Privacy

3. Uncheck Block all cookies


To enable cookies in Firefox:


1. Copy/paste this line into your browser's address field: about:preferences#privacy

2. Locate the History section

3. Check Accept cookies from websites


To enable cookies in Edge:


  1. Open Microsoft Edge.
  2. Click the More actions button in the toolbar, then select Settings
  3. Find the View advanced settings option and click on it
  4. Under the Cookies section, select either Don't block cookies (default) or Block only third-party cookies
  5. Restart Edge for the changes to take effect


I hope this helps! Let me know if you require any further assistance.


Best wishes,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

development_bug_social_signin_leads_to_blank_page_step_1, development system_bug social_signin
Development::Bug::Social Sign-in Leads to Blank Page (Step 2) - TS-3977

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for your updated message! I'm sorry to hear the issue persists.


To resolve this, we suggest that you sign in to Grammarly in your browser's incognito mode.

To open an incognito window in Chrome:


1. Open Chrome.
2. Select New Incognito Window.

To open a private window in Safari:


1. Choose File
2. Select New Private Window


To start private browsing in Internet Explorer:


1. Use the Ctrl+Shift+P shortcut key
or
2. Click on Safety and select Private Browsing

To open a private window in Firefox:

1. Go to Firefox Menu.
2. Select New Private Window

If it doesn't help, please clear your browser's cache and cookies as described in the article below:

https://support.grammarly.com/hc/en-us/articles/115000090272

Note: Be sure to back up your saved passwords first!

Thank you and many apologies for the inconvenience,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

development_bug_social_signin_leads_to_blank_page_step_2, development system_bug social_signin
Development::Bug::Unable to Reset Password on Mobile (Redirect Issue) - AT-6488

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for writing in today! I'm sorry to hear that you've encountered this issue.


To reset your password on a mobile device, please do the following:


1. Copy-paste this link into the browser where you're trying to reset the password:


https://auth.grammarly.com/logout_redirect

2. Send yourself a password reset email at https://www.grammarly.com/resetpassword

Alternatively, you may use your computer to reset the password by sending yourself a password reset email at https://www.grammarly.com/resetpassword. The email should arrive within about a minute and contain a link that will bring you to a page where you'll be asked to create a new password. The link in the email expires after 72 hours. If the link in the email has expired, you can send yourself another password reset email.

If the link in the email isn't working for you:

  1. Delete any Grammarly password reset emails that you might have sent to yourself
  2. Once you've deleted the emails, clear your browser's cookies (click https://auth.grammarly.com/logout_redirect. This will sign you out and take you back to the home page
  3. Now go to https://www.grammarly.com/resetpassword
  4. Type in your email, then select "Send me reset instructions"
  5. Go back to your email and follow the steps in the new Grammarly password reset email


I hope this helps! If there's anything else we can do for you, please let us know. We apologize for the inconvenience.


Kindly,


{{ticket.assignee.first_name}}

development_bug_unable_to_reset_password_on_mobile_redirect_issue_at6488, development system_bug
Development::Can't Upload a Document (Instruct to Accept All Track Changes/Revisions)

Hello {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for contacting Grammarly! I'm happy to help you resolve this.


Please follow these steps:


  1. Open the document in MS Word
  2. Go to the Review tab
  3. Click Show comments
  4. Select Accept all changes
  5. Click Hide comments
  6. Save the document and close it
  7. Try uploading the document to Grammarly Editor


You may also refer to this article for more details on how to accept the track changes/revisions:


https://support.office.com/en-us/article/Accept-tracked-changes-4838d24c-d5d1-4c6c-8e39-78b44bd2b4cc


If you see the "Your document is corrupt" error, please open the document, save it as a new file, then try to upload that file.


Note: Currently, you can upload up to 60 pages (or 100,000 characters including spaces) to the Grammarly Editor at a time. If you use Grammarly for MS Word on Windows, there is no page limitation.


I hope this helps! Please let me know if you have any further questions or comments. We apologize for any inconvenience.


Best regards,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

development_upload_issue_accept_revisions development online_editor desktop
Development::Can't Upload or Download a Document (Request More Information)

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for contacting Grammarly! I'm sorry to hear that you are experiencing this issue.


Would you mind providing us with some additional information to help our investigation? Here's the information we need:


Could you send us the document in question as an attachment?

What is the document format (.doc, .docx, .rtf, others)?

What is the size of the text in terms of characters?


Note: Grammarly employees may need to view your document in order to solve this problem for you.


Currently, you can upload documents of up to 100,000 characters including spaces to the Grammarly Editor at a time.


Looking forward to hearing from you,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

development_cant_upload_or_download_document_request_more_information online_editor desktop, development development_request_more_information
Development::Can’t Upload a Document - Too Large (Suggest to Check Number of Characters)

Hello {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for writing in! Currently, you can upload up to 60 pages (or 100,000 characters including spaces) to the Grammarly Editor at a time. If you use Grammarly for MS Word on Windows, there is no page limitation.


If you're not sure how many characters your document contains, there is an easy way to check that:


If you use Microsoft Word:


1. Open the document in MS Word

2. Click the Review tab, then select Word Count in the toolbar

3. In the Word Count window, check the Include footnotes and endnotes box and ensure the total amount of characters with spaces is below 100,000


Note: If the word count shows that the number of characters including spaces is below 100,000, but the document still cannot be uploaded to Grammarly, please send us your document as an attachment so we can investigate the issue.


We hope this helps, but please feel free to contact us with any questions or concerns you might have.


Best regards,

{{ticket.assignee.name}}

development_cant_upload_document_too_large_suggest_to_check_number_of_characters development online_editor desktop

Development::Clear Cache (Chrome)

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for contacting Grammarly! I'm sorry to hear that you are experiencing this issue.


I recommend that you clear your browser's cache as described below:


  1. Copy-paste the following text into your browser's address bar: chrome://settings/clearBrowserData
  2. Set Time range to All time
  3. Select Cached images and files
  4. Click Clear Data


Thank you and many apologies for the inconvenience,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

development_clear_cache_chrome, development
Development::Clear Cache (Edge)

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for contacting Grammarly! I'm sorry to hear that you are experiencing this issue.


I recommend that you clear your browser's cache as described below:


  1. Open Microsoft Edge
  2. Click More options (the … symbol) in the top right corner of your browser
  3. Select Settings from the dropdown menu
  4. Click Choose what to clear under Clear browsing data
  5. Select Cached data and files and click Clear


Thank you and many apologies for the inconvenience,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

development_clear_cache_edge, development
Development::Clear Cache (Firefox)

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for contacting Grammarly! I'm sorry to hear that you are experiencing this issue.


I recommend that you clear your browser's cache as described below:


  • Copy-paste the following text into your browser's address bar: about:preferences#privacy
  • Locate Cookies and Site Data section and click Clear Data...
  • Select Cached Web Content
  • Click Clear


Thank you and many apologies for the inconvenience,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

development_clear_cache_firefox, development
Development::Clear Cache (Internet Explorer)

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for contacting Grammarly! I'm sorry to hear that you are experiencing this issue.


I recommend that you clear your browser's cache as described below:


  1. Open the Internet Explorer
  2. Click Tools > Internet options
  3. Click Delete... in the Browsing history section
  4. Select Temporary Internet files and website files
  5. Click Delete


Thank you and many apologies for the inconvenience,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

Development::Clear Cache and Cookies (Safari)

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for contacting Grammarly! I'm sorry to hear that you are experiencing this issue.


I recommend that you clear your browser's cache and cookies as described below:


  1. Open Safari
  2. Choose Safari > Preferences
  3. Click Privacy
  4. Select Manage Website Data...
  5. Click Remove All.


Note: Be sure to back up your saved passwords first!

Development::Clear Cookies (Chrome)

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for contacting Grammarly! I'm sorry to hear that you are experiencing this issue.


I recommend that you clear your browser's cookies as described below:


  1. Copy-paste the following text into your browser's address bar: chrome://settings/siteData
  2. Type grammarly in the Search cookies field
  3. Click Remove all Shown


Let me know if there's anything else we can do for you!

{{ticket.assignee.name}}

development_clear_cookies_chrome, development
Development::Clear Cookies (Edge)

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for contacting Grammarly! I'm sorry to hear that you are experiencing this issue.


I recommend that you clear your browser's cookies as described below:


  1. Open Edge and press Alt + X
  2. Select Settings from the dropdown menu
  3. Click Privacy & Security
  4. Select Choose what to clear under Clear browsing data
  5. Check Cookies and saved website data (and any other data you might want to delete), then click Clear

Let me know if there's anything else we can do for you!


Kindly,

{{ticket.assignee.name}}

development_clear_cookies_edge, development
Development::Clear Cookies (Firefox)

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for contacting Grammarly! I'm sorry to hear that you are experiencing this issue.


I recommend that you clear your browser's cookies as described below:


  1. Copy-paste this line into the Firefox address bar: about:preferences#privacy
  2. Locate the Cookies and Site Data section and click Manage Data
  3. In the Search websites field, type grammarly, and press Enter (Return)
  4. Click Remove All Shown, then click Save Changes and OK if prompted


Let me know if there's anything else we can do for you!


Kindly,

{{ticket.assignee.name}}

development_clear_cookies_firefox, development
Development::Corrupted File (Unable to Open/Upload)

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for contacting Grammarly! I'm happy to assist you today.


It looks like the file was corrupted because the document you sent was not saved correctly in your previous session. MS Word found unreadable content in the document file and was unable to open the document. For the same reason, it cannot be uploaded to the Grammarly Editor.


Please click here to learn more about corrupted files and how to repair them.


If you have any further questions or comments, please let us know.

Development::Editor Merges Words/Deletes Spaces After Applying a Suggestion (TS-3838)

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for contacting Grammarly Customer Support!


Our technical team is already aware of the problem you reported, but unfortunately, we don’t currently have a quick fix. I can’t provide you with an estimated timeframe right now because the developers need some time to analyze the cause of the issue, but please rest assured that we won’t forget about it.


As a workaround, our technical team suggests that you try uploading and downloading your document again. If you experience the same issue, please consider splitting the document into smaller parts. If this doesn't help, you can paste the text into a new document in the Grammarly Editor instead of uploading a file.


I’m going to close this case, but if you have more information regarding this issue, please reply to this email and the case will be re-opened for further investigation. We apologize for any inconvenience.


Best wishes,

{{ticket.assignee.name}}

Development::Enable Cookies in Chrome

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for contacting Grammarly! I'm sorry to hear that you are experiencing this issue.


It sounds like the cookies in your browser are disabled. To sign in successfully, please enable cookies by following the instructions below:


  1. Copy/paste this line into your address field in Chrome chrome:settings/content/cookies and press Enter
  2. Enable Allow sites to save and read cookies data (recommended)
  3. Disable Block third-party cookies


If you'd prefer not to enable cookies in Chrome, you can add [*.]grammarly.com to the list of exceptions in the Allow section.


**SOCIAL SIGN-IN (GOOGLE):


If you'd prefer not to enable cookies in Chrome, you can add [*.]grammarly.com and accounts.google.com to the list of exceptions in the Allow section.


I hope this helps, but please don't hesitate to reach out for any further assistance.


Kindly,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

development_enable_cookies_in_chrome, development
Development::Enable Cookies in Edge

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for contacting Grammarly! I'm sorry to hear that you are experiencing this issue.


It sounds like the cookies in your browser are disabled. To sign in successfully, please enable cookies by following the instructions below:


  1. Open Microsoft Edge
  2. Press Alt + X keys to open the side menu, click Settings, and then select Privacy & security
  3. Under the Cookies section, select Don't block cookies (default)
  4. Restart Edge for the changes to take effect


I hope this helps, but please don't hesitate to reach out for any further assistance.


Kindly,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

development_enable_cookies_in_edge, development
Development::Enable Cookies in Firefox

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for contacting Grammarly! I'm sorry to hear that you are experiencing this issue.


It sounds like the cookies in your browser are disabled. To sign in successfully, please enable cookies by following the instructions below:


  1. Copy-paste this line into your browser's address field: about:preferences#privacy
  2. In the Content Blocking section, select Custom, and make sure Cookies is not checked.
  3. In the Cookies and Site Data section, unselect Delete cookies and site data when Firefox is closed.


Alternatively, you can add https://grammarly.com to exceptions by clicking the Manage Permissions... button in the Cookies and Site Data section.


**SOCIAL SIGN-IN


Alternatively, you can add https://grammarly.com and https://google.com to exceptions by clicking the Manage Permissions... button in the Cookies and Site Data section.

I hope this helps, but please don't hesitate to reach out for any further assistance.


Kindly,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

development_enable_cookies_in_firefox, development
Development::Enable Cookies in Safari

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for contacting Grammarly! I'm sorry to hear that you are experiencing this issue.


It sounds like the cookies in your browser are disabled. To sign in successfully, please enable cookies by following the instructions below:


If you're using Safari 11 or newer:


  1. Go to Preferences
  2. Select Privacy
  3. Untick Block all cookies and Prevent cross-site tracking:

    ​​


If you're using Safari 10 or older:


  1. Go to Preferences
  2. Select Privacy
  3. Tick Allow from websites I visit in the Cookies and website data section:



I hope this helps, but please don't hesitate to reach out for any further assistance.


Kindly,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

development_enable_cookies_in_safari, development
Development::Explain Why Enable Cookies

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for getting back to us.


I've double-checked the information with the technical team, and they confirm that cookie access is required for login status. Without it, you won’t be able to stay logged in to your account. Moreover, using cookies is the most secure way to authenticate a user in a browser.


I hope this clarifies the matter, but please don't hesitate to reach out for any further assistance. We apologize for any inconvenience.


Kindly,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

development_explain_why_enable_cookies, development

Development::How To::Open Console (Blank Page, Loading Error)

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for your message!


I'd like to get some additional information from you to help the development team investigate this case.


Could you please go to the page where the problem occurs and send us a screenshot of the console output? You can also copy and paste it in your reply.


To open the console in Chrome:

1. Go to Chrome Menu at the top right of your browser window

2. Select More tools > Developer Tools

3. Click on the “Console” tab


To open the console in Internet Explorer:

1. Press F12

2. Press Ctrl+2



To open the console in Safari:

1. Go to Safari preferences

2. Select “Advanced” tab

3. Enable "Show Develop menu in menu bar"

4. Press Alt+Cmd+C



To open the console in Firefox:


1. Go to Firefox Menu.

2. Select Developer.

3. Browser Console.



To open the console in Microsoft Edge:

1. Press F12.

2. In F12 Developer Tools, navigate to the Console tab.


Thank you for your time and help.


Sincerely,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

development_how_to_open_console_blank_page_or_loading_error, development development_request_more_information
Development::How To::Update Chrome to the Latest Version

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for contacting Grammarly! I'm sorry that you are experiencing this issue.


It appears you are using an outdated version of Chrome. We recommend that you update your browser to the latest version by following these steps:


  1. Open Chrome
  2. Copy-paste the following line into your browser's address bar and press Enter: chrome:settings/help
  3. Click Update Google Chrome
  4. Click Relaunch


Note: If you don't see the option to update Google Chrome, you're already using the latest version.


I’m going to set this case as solved, but please feel free to reply to this email should you need any further assistance.


Best wishes,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

development_how_to_upgrade_to_latest_version_chrome, development
Development::How To::Update Firefox to the Latest Version

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for contacting Grammarly! I'm sorry that you are experiencing this issue.


It appears you are using an outdated version of Firefox. We recommend that you update your browser to the latest version by following these steps:

For macOS:

  1. Open Firefox and click Firefox at the top left corner
  2. Select About Firefox and check whether any updates are available
  3. Restart the browser to apply the changes


For Windows and Linux:

  1. Open Firefox and click Menu at the top right corner
  2. Click Help, select About Firefox and check whether any updates are available
  3. Restart the browser to apply the changes


Note: If you don't see the option to update Firefox, you're already using the latest version.

I’m going to set this case as solved, but please feel free to reply to this email should you need any further assistance.

Best wishes,

{{ticket.assignee.name}}

Development::Network Configuration - WebSockets Test: Success

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for sending us this information.


We suggest you try the following to resolve the issue:


1. Try a different browser.


At the moment, Grammarly supports the following browsers:


- Safari 9 and higher

- Firefox higher than 39

- Google Chrome 38 and higher

- Internet Explorer 11 and higher

- Microsoft Edge 12


2. Try to log in to Grammarly from another location (office, home, etc.), where the Internet Service Provider is different.


3. Clear your browser's cache and cookies.


You can go to http://www.wikihow.com/Clear-Your-Browser's-Cache to learn how to clear your browser's cache.


Please let us know if this doesn't help. I am setting this ticket to solved for now, but please feel free to reply to this e-mail at any time to receive additional support on this issue - your reply will automatically reopen the ticket.


Sincerely,

{{ticket.assignee.name}}

development_network_configuration_websockets_test_success, development
Development::Network Configuration Blocks G - WebSockets Test: FailedHello {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thank you for sending us this information. The test results show that your network configuration prevents the Grammarly services from working on your computer. If the WebSockets test failed and the other tests returned "success" results, please reach out to your ISP or network administrator to make sure that: The IP addresses mapped to these domains are allowed by your firewall/proxy: - capi.grammarly.com - dox.grammarly.com We also suggest you temporarily disable your proxy, antivirus software, and firewall to see if that helps resolve the issue. If that doesn't work for you, please try to login to Grammarly from another location (office, home, Internet café, or using a 3G/4G modem), where the Internet Provider is different. For more information about this issue, please refer to this article: https://support.grammarly.com/hc/en-us/articles/360000921692-WebSockets-Configuration-Troubleshooting Many apologies for the inconvenience, {{ticket.assignee.name}}development_network_configuration_blocks_grammarly_websockets_test_failed, development
Development::Online Editor Logs Out (Cookies Settings)

Hello {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for contacting Grammarly! We are happy to answer your questions.


Grammarly keeps you logged in to your account until you click the "Log out" link or clear your browser's cache and cookies. It appears the setting that erases all cookie data every time you quit your browser is enabled in your browser.


If you use Firefox, you can read more about this setting here: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/delete-browsing-search-download-history-firefox#w_how-do-i-make-firefox-clear-my-history-automatically


If you use Chrome, you can find more information here: https://support.google.com/chrome/answer/95647?co=GENIE.Platform%3DDesktop&hl=en


If you use Edge, more information is available at https://privacy.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-10-microsoft-edge-and-privacy


For more details about managing cookies in Safari, please check https://support.apple.com/kb/PH21411?locale=en_US&viewlocale=en_US


I hope this helps!


Please feel free to contact us with any questions or concerns you may have.


Sincerely,

{{ticket.assignee.name}}

development_online_editor_logs_out_cookies_settings, development online_editor

Development::Run System File Checker on Windows

Hello {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for your message!


We suggest that you try following these steps to resolve the issue:


  1. Close all programs that are running
  2. Click Start and enter Command Prompt in the search box
  3. In the search results, right-click Command Prompt (Desktop app) and select Run as administrator
  4. Enter DISM.exe /Online /Cleanup-image /Restorehealth (note the spaces before each "/"), press Enter and wait until the tool finishes running
  5. Enter sfc /scannow (note the space after "sfc") and wait until the process is completed, then press Enter and wait until the tool finishes running
  6. Restart the PC and see if the issue persists


I hope this helps, but please don't hesitate to reach out for any further assistance. We apologize for any inconvenience.


Kindly,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

development_run_system_file_checker_on_windows, development

Development::Suggest to Log In in Incognito Mode

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for your message! I am sorry that you are experiencing this issue.


We suggest that you try to log in using your browser's incognito mode:


To open an incognito window in Chrome:

1. Open Chrome.

2. Select New Incognito Window.


To start private browsing in Internet Explorer:


1. Use the Ctrl+Shift+P shortcut key

or

2. Click on Safety and select Private Browsing


To open a private window in Safari:

1. Choose File

2. Select New Private Window


To open a private window in Firefox:


1. Go to Firefox Menu.

2. Select New Private Window


I hope this helps! Please let me know if there is anything else I can do for you today.


Sincerely,

{{ticket.assignee.name}}

Development::System Down (Outage) - Request to Notify Once Over (Deny)Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thank you for your message. Currently, we don't have a system for notifying customers when the system is up again. Usually, Grammarly will be running if you check 10 minutes after an outage. We do our best to provide uninterrupted service, so it doesn’t take long to resolve these problems. Additionally, a network configuration problem may produce an error message that is not the result of an outage. Changing the networking configuration should resolve the issue. If you have any further questions or comments, just let us know -- we are here to help! Sincerely, {{ticket.assignee.name}}system_down development_system_down_outage_request_to_notify_once_over_deny, development

Usually, Grammarly will be running if you check 10 minutes after an outage. We do our best to provide uninterrupted service, so it doesn’t take long to resolve these problems. Additionally, a network configuration problem may produce an error message that is not the result of an outage. Changing the networking configuration should resolve the issue. If you have any further questions or comments, just let us know -- we are here to help! Sincerely, {{ticket.assignee.name}}development_tech_support_comment, development
Development::TLS Certificate Issue (AES256 Not Supported)

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for contacting Grammarly! I'm sorry to hear that you are experiencing this issue.


Unfortunately, it appears that your network settings are not compatible with our service.


For your reference, our cloud service currently prefers to negotiate a connection using AES128, while your network appears to be using AES256. Our preference to use AES128 may change in the future, but we can't provide a timeline for delivering a solution at the moment.


We hope this information helps, although we understand that it's probably not what you were hoping to hear. Please feel free to contact us with any further questions or comments you may have.


Kindly,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

EDU::Account Confirmation Failed (Ask to Delete Account)

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for getting back to us.


If you're unable to confirm your account per our previous instructions, we suggest that you delete your account and sign up again at the correct web page. Please follow these steps:


1) Log in to Grammarly


2) Visit the Profile page and click on the "Account" at https://app.grammarly.com/profile/account


3) Click the "Delete account" button


Note:

  • If you used Facebook to sign up with Grammarly, you'll need to enter your Facebook password to confirm the deletion.
  • The option to manage your account isn't available on mobile devices at this time. Please use a laptop or a desktop computer to proceed with deleting your account.


4) Go to https://www.grammarly.com/edu/signup. Enter your email, preferred password, and access code (if required) to sign up for a Grammarly account.


5) If an access code was not used, check your email (Inbox and spam folder) for an activation email.


6) Log in to your account at https://www.grammarly.com/edu.


If you require any further assistance, please let me know.


Kindly,

{{ticket.assignee.name}}

edu_account_confirmation_failed_asked_delete, subscription edu
EDU::Account Confirmation Instructions

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for contacting Grammarly!


It appears that your account hasn't been activated.


To verify your account, first sign out of your account by using this link: https://auth.grammarly.com/logout_redirect. Then, go to https://www.grammarly.com/edu, click "Log in", and enter your login credentials. If required, enter your institution's access code on the next page.


After you've entered your login details, you should see the "Re-send Email" button. You should receive a confirmation email and will be able to follow the link to verify your account.


If you sent yourself the email but never received it:


1. Check your spam folder (and any email filters you've set up) to make sure the message isn't being directed away from your email inbox.

2. If you cannot find the confirmation email after checking your spam folder, try adding info@em.grammarly.com, info@send.grammarly.com, and donotreply@grammarly.com to your contact list, then send yourself a confirmation email again.


I hope this helps! Please let me know if you have additional questions.


Sincerely,

{{ticket.assignee.name}}

edu subscription, edu_account_confirmation_instructions
EDU::Account Confirmation Instructions (Social Sign-in)

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for contacting Grammarly!


To activate your account, please follow the instructions described below:

1) Log out of your Grammarly account https://auth.grammarly.com/logout_redirect

2) Go to https://www.grammarly.com/edu/signin, select "Continue with Google"/"Continue with Facebook", choose your registered email address and log in to your Grammarly account.

3) If required, apply the access code provided by your institution

4) Enjoy using Grammarly!



If you sent yourself the confirmation email but never received it:


1. Check your spam folder (and any email filters you've set up) to make sure the message isn't being directed away from your email inbox.

2. If you cannot find the confirmation email after checking your spam folder, try adding info@em.grammarly.com, info@send.grammarly.com, and donotreply@grammarly.com to your contact list, then send yourself a confirmation email again.


If you need any further assistance, please let me know.


Kindly,

{{ticket.assignee.name}}

If you believe you have been paying for Grammarly, I'll need to know either the email address associated with your paid account or the following information:

  • the charge amount

EDU::Edu Registration - How Do I Apply Access CodeHi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, I'm happy to assist you with this! To add the access code provided by your institution, please follow these steps: 1. Sign out of your Grammarly account by following this link: https://auth.grammarly.com/logout_redirect 2. Log in to your existing account at https://www.grammarly.com/edu/signin 3. Check your email inbox for the email "ACTION REQUIRED: Confirm your email" and click Verify email. If you don't see the confirmation email, please check your spam folder. 4. Once your account has been verified, you'll be redirected to the page where you'll need to apply the access code. 5. Enter your access code and click “Apply”. Please make sure that the account registration process is not interrupted by opening other web pages. If you require any further assistance, please let me know. Sincerely, {{ticket.assignee.name}}edu_registration_how_to_apply_access_code, subscription edu

EDU::Invite/Remove EDU Accounts | Stacey Only

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for your message.


To invite your preferred users, go to the Admin Panel, click Members, then choose Invite members in Bulk or Invite one-by-one. Here is a quick tutorial on how to use the Admin Panel: https://youtu.be/TOl12Z7CIjA.

To remove any users from your subscription, please follow these instructions:

1. Log in to your admin account and go to the Admin Panel
2. Select Bulk removal and click download a template
3. Add the email addresses you'd like to remove to the CSV template using just the Email column
4. Once your CSV file is ready, select Bulk removal again and upload the file
5. Follow the directions that'll show next.

Alternatively, you can follow these instructions:

2. Go to the Members section
3. Select the users you'd like to remove
4. Click Remove button that will appear at the bottom of the page once you select any users.


If you require any further assistance, please let me know.


Best wishes,

{{ticket.assignee.name}}

edu edu_invite_or_remove_accounts_stacey_only

4. Apply the access code if required

Feature Requests::Autocorrect

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for reaching out!


Unfortunately, Grammarly doesn't offer an autocorrect option at this time. However, Grammarly will automatically review your text as you write. Grammarly will suggest corrections for spelling and grammar, citations to help you avoid accidental plagiarism, and alternate vocabulary choices to make your writing more dynamic.


Additionally, you can install the Grammarly Keyboard for iOS or Android, where autocorrect is offered as a feature.


I hope this helps, but please let us know how we can assist you further.

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for contacting Grammarly! I'm happy to assist you today.


Unfortunately, the Grammarly Editor is not available on mobile devices at this time. On mobile devices, Grammarly is available as a keyboard rather than a standalone editor. Please rest assured that it provides the same writing suggestions as all other Grammarly products.


If you're using an iOS device, installing the Grammarly Keyboard is as easy as described here.


If you're an Android user, this article will help you install the Grammarly Keyboard on your device.


We hope you enjoy it, and please let us know if you require any further assistance.

Feature Requests::Grammarly Offline | StandaloneHi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thanks for contacting Grammarly Support! Grammarly is cloud-based software and cannot be used offline. You need a stable Internet connection in order to access the powerful algorithms that Grammarly uses to analyze your text. These algorithms can't be stored on any single device—it’s simply too much data—but this approach is what allows Grammarly to offer writing checks that are far superior to those of computer-based word processors. I hope this answers your question, but please do not hesitate to contact us with any questions or concerns you might have. Kindly, {{ticket.assignee.name}}feature_request, feature_request_use_grammarly_offline_or_standalone

The good news is that you can upload and check your texts in the online Grammarly Editor at https://app.grammarly.com/. Also at your disposal: Grammarly for Microsoft Office (available for Windows OS), the Grammarly extension for your preferred browser (Chrome, Safari, Firefox, or Edge), and the native (desktop) app.


I hope this helps! Please feel free to contact us with any questions or concerns you may have.


Sincerely,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

feature_request, feature_request_hootsuite

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},

It appears that Hubspot uses iFrame for its text areas. Unfortunately, iFrame is not supported by Grammarly at this time.


The good news is that you can check your texts in the Grammarly Editor at https://app.grammarly.com/, as well as in the native (desktop) app. Also, if you're a Windows user, you can download Grammarly for Microsoft Office to check your texts from within MS Word and Outlook.

I'm pleased to inform you that the latest version of the Grammarly extension for Chrome supports Medium.com. Simply follow these steps to ensure you're using the latest version:

Go to chrome:extensions

Click Remove in the Grammarly for Chrome section

Download the latest version at https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/grammarly-spell-checker-g/kbfnbcaeplbcioakkpcpgfkobkghlhen

Feature Requests::Oxford Comma

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for contacting Grammarly!


At this time, the Oxford comma check is enabled for the American English setting only. This check is disabled in other dialects. To update your language preferences, please follow these instructions: https://gram.ly/cbbHS_9


Unfortunately, Grammarly does not provide the option to turn individual checks on and off, but thank you for letting us know that it’s something you’d like to see. I’ve forwarded your request to our product team so that they can take it into account when making development plans.


To learn more about the Oxford Comma, please visit https://www.grammarly.com/blog/what-is-the-oxford-comma-and-why-do-people-care-so-much-about-it/


If you have any other questions, just let me know and I’ll be happy to help.

Feature Requests::Pages Support

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for contacting Grammarly!


Unfortunately, Grammarly does not support integration with Pages at this time.


The good news is that you can upload and check your documents in our Online Editor at https://app.grammarly.com/. Also at your disposal: the Grammarly extension for your preferred browser, and the native (desktop) app.


Please note that you can save your documents in .docx or .doc format using Pages, which would enable you to upload them to the Grammarly Editor. Simply follow the steps below:


  1. Open the file you want to convert into a .docx/.doc document
  2. From the menu bar, click on File → Export To, and select Word: http://take.ms/6yGXg
  3. Next, click on Advanced Options. You should see a dropdown menu titled Format
  4. Now, choose the appropriate extension – ".docx" or ".doc"
  5. Click Next
  6. Type your preferred title for that Word document, select a destination, and click Export


I hope this helps, but please feel free to contact us with any questions or concerns you may have.


Kind regards,

{{ticket.assignee.name}}

feature_request, feature_request_pages
Feature Requests::PDF File Format (Suggest Workaround)Hello, Thanks for writing in today! Grammarly does not support .pdf files at this time. Supported file types are MS Word (.doc, .docx), OpenOffice (.odt), .txt and .rtf. As a workaround, you can use one of the free online converters to convert PDF files into one of the supported formats. Please feel free to contact us with any questions or concerns you may have. Feature Requests::Portable Version / Can I install Grammarly on USB?Hello {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, That's a great question, but, unfortunately, Grammarly does not offer a portable version. Grammarly is an online application, which means your computer must be connected to the Internet. Grammarly requires a stable Internet connection to analyze your text and provide suggestions. This article lists the Grammarly products that can be downloaded to your device: https://support.grammarly.com/hc/en-us/articles/115000090851-What-products-does-Grammarly-offer- I hope this helps, but please keep in touch and let us know how we can assist you further. Sincerely, {{ticket.assignee.name}}feature_request, feature_request_portable_version_or_install_g_on_usb

feature_request browser_plugin, feature_request_proofread_websites
Feature Requests::Replacements for Passive Voice

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for contacting Grammarly!


Grammarly Premium offers rewrites for passive voice sentences when it’s clear who or what is performing the action in the sentence. (For example, if you write “The warning was ignored by everyone,” Grammarly suggests “Everyone ignored the warning.”) In cases where it’s not clear who is performing the action, Grammarly can’t currently offer a rewrite, but it will identify the passive voice for you. You can also click on the alert to see guidance on how you can rewrite the sentence in the active voice.


I hope this helps! If there's anything else we can do for you, please let me know.


Kind regards,

{{ticket.assignee.name}}

feature_request, feature_request_replacements_for_passive_voice

If you have any further questions, please let us know.


Best wishes,


{{ticket.assignee.first_name}}

Feature Requests::Slack Support

CHECK WHAT BROWSER YOUR CUSTOMER IS USING BEFORE SENDING AND DELETE THE REDUNDANT CHUNK OF TEXT.



Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for contacting Grammarly. I'm happy to assist you today!


Unfortunately, Grammarly does not support integration with the Slack app at this time, but thank you for letting us know that it’s something you’d like to see. I’ve forwarded your request to our product team so that they can take it into account when making development plans.


However, I'm pleased to inform you that the latest version of the Grammarly extension for Chrome supports Slack. Simply follow these steps to ensure you're using the latest version:


Open your Chrome browser

Go to chrome:extensions

Click Remove in the Grammarly for Chrome section

Download the latest version at https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/grammarly-spell-checker-g/kbfnbcaeplbcioakkpcpgfkobkghlhen



OR, IF THE USER'S NOT ON CHROME:


The good news is that you can check your texts in the online Grammarly Editor at https://app.grammarly.com/, as well as using our native (desktop) app.



If you have any other questions, just let me know and I’ll be happy to help.


Sincerely,


{{ticket.assignee.first_name}}

Feature Requests::Text-to-speech

Hello {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for writing in today!


Unfortunately, Grammarly doesn't support the text-to-speech feature at the moment. However, I’ve forwarded your request to our product team so they can take it into consideration when making development plans.


The good news is that Grammarly is compatible with the in-built text-to-speech feature on Windows and macOS.

To learn how to activate this feature on Windows OS, please review the articles below:


1) https://support.microsoft.com/en-ph/help/17173/windows-10-hear-text-read-aloud
2) https://support.microsoft.com/en-hk/help/14234/windows-hear-text-read-aloud-with-narrator

If you're using macOS, please do the following:

1. Open System Preferences
2. Select Accessibility
3. Click on Speech and check the Speak selected text when a key is pressed box



After that, Grammarly will read your text back to you if you press the key combination that activates the text-to-speech feature on your computer.

Note: The in-built text-to-speech feature doesn't recognize the suggestions offered by Grammarly.


Should you have any further questions, please let me know.


Kind regards,

{{ticket.assignee.name}}

feature_request, feature_request_text_to_speech

Feature Requests::Use Multiple LoginsHi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thanks for contacting Grammarly! At this time, your Grammarly account can be linked to only one email address. To access your account, please use {{ticket.requester.email}} as your login. If you would like to update the email address associated with your Grammarly account, please sign in to the Grammarly website, navigate to the Profile tab, click on Account, and update your email. Here is the direct link: https://app.grammarly.com/profile/account Alternatively, you can try out Grammarly Business, which allows you to purchase a group plan for three or more members and includes an admin panel to manage the whole license. You are welcome to check it out at https://grammarly.com/business Should you need any further assistance, please let me know. Feature Requests::WaterfoxHi, Thank you for contacting Grammarly! Unfortunately, Grammarly doesn't support integration with Waterfox at this time, but thank you for letting us know that it’s something you’d like to see. I’ve forwarded your request to our product team so that they can take it into account when making development plans. The good news is that you can install the Grammarly extension for Firefox at https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/grammarly-1/ Once you have downloaded and installed the Grammarly extension for Firefox, you should be able to use it as you write online. Simply click on the "G" button in the bottom right-hand corner of a text field, and Grammarly will show mistakes in the Editor window that opens automatically. Also, you can hover over a highlighted mistake and apply a correction suggested by Grammarly on the card that will appear. I hope this helps! Should you have any further questions or comments, please let me know. Best wishes, {{ticket.assignee.first_name}}feature_request browser_plugin, feature_request_waterfox

Feature Requests::When Adding New Feature - No Exact Date (Detailed)Hello {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, That's a great question! Our goal is to provide users with the best experience, and we try to constantly improve our product, so we release new features to incorporate the changes. At this time, I can't release any information about when and what that might be. It's not that we like keeping you in the dark—we just don't think it's right to set expectations that may not be met due to shifting schedules. Once new features are released, you will be the first to know! We encourage you to stay tuned and keep an eye out for our emails. Kind regards, {{ticket.assignee.name}}feature_request, feature_request_when_adding_new_feature_detailed

Feature Requests::Why Doesn't Add-in Check Text in MS Word's Text Boxes?

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for contacting Grammarly!


Grammarly for Microsoft Office does not check text in the text boxes at this time, but thank you for letting us know that it’s something you’d like to see. I’ve forwarded your request to our product team so that they can take it into account when making development plans.


As a workaround, you can import the document containing the text boxes into the online Grammarly Editor or the desktop app. Both of these Grammarly products will check the text in the text boxes.


Once you're finished editing your text, click the Download or Export button to download the edited text to your computer. You can rest assured that the original formatting of your document will be preserved if you follow these steps.


If there's anything else we can do for you, please let me know.


Kindly,

{{ticket.assignee.name}}

feature_request addin, feature_request_addin_doesnt_check_text_boxes

general_article_request, general, donotsurvey
General::Bug Bounty Request

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for contacting Grammarly! We take security reports very seriously.

We suggest you apply to our bug bounty program directly https://hackerone.com/grammarly and a senior engineer will review it. We will treat the information that you send as confidential. Once we verify the vulnerability, we will get back to you.

If you're not on HackerOne, we encourage you to register and use this platform to report potential vulnerabilities.

Alternatively, you can email security@grammarly.com and describe the details in the following format:

- steps to reproduce the issue
- how the vulnerability can be exploited with malicious intent
- recommendations for the fix

Thank you,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

donotsurvey general_bug_bounty_request, general

General::Recover Deleted Document (Provide Link)

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for contacting Grammarly!


You can view and recover any of your recently deleted documents and document versions by going to https://app.grammarly.com/documentVersionHistory while logged in to your Grammarly account. Please note these documents are stored only temporarily so you can recover them if you need to before they are permanently deleted from our servers.


I hope this helps! Please don’t hesitate to contact us with any questions or concerns you may have.


Kind regards,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

general_recover_deleted_document_provide_link, general online_editor desktop donotsurvey

General::Recover Deleted Document - Deny (Link Didn't Help)

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for your message.


Unfortunately, if the document you need isn’t available at https://app.grammarly.com/documentVersionHistory, we're unable to recover it because it is no longer stored on our servers.


If you can think of any other email address that you could have used to create a Grammarly account, I would suggest checking to see if the document in question is stored on that account. You can search every email account you use for the word "Grammarly" to find any emails we've sent you.


OR


I would suggest checking to see if the document in question is stored on your Grammarly account under ______. Also, you can search every email account you use for the word "Grammarly" to find any emails we've sent you and locate any other account you might have created with us.


Thank you for understanding, and I’m sorry it’s not what you were hoping to hear. If there's anything else we can do for you, please let me know.


Kind regards,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

general_recover_deleted_document_deny_link_didnt_help, general online_editor desktop donotsurvey
