Information::"For Free" Used in Our Emails/CommercialsHi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thanks for writing in and bringing this up! According to our grammarian staff, "for free" is a common and accepted idiom. We suggest you check Merriam-Webster's Dictionary of English Usage for a thorough explanation. Please feel free to contact us with any questions or concerns you may have. We are committed to making your experience with Grammarly pleasant and rewarding. Sincerely, {{ticket.assignee.name}} information_for_free_used_in_our_emails_commercials information marketing
Information::About:: Value-Added Tax (VAT)Hello {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thank you for contacting Grammarly. I'm happy to answer this for you! Please note that we do not charge VAT on our electronic services at this time. More specifically, Grammarly, Inc. is a US company, and Grammarly, Inc. is not a VAT payer. I hope this answers your question, but please let me know if I can assist you further. Kindly, {{ticket.assignee.name}}information_tax information_VAT
Information::About::About GrammarlyHi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thanks for contacting Grammarly! I’m happy to provide you with some information about what we have to offer. Grammarly’s AI-powered products help people communicate more effectively. Millions of users rely on Grammarly every day to make their messages, documents, and social media posts clear, mistake-free, and impactful. Grammarly is an Inc. 500 company with offices in San Francisco, New York, and Kyiv. As you type, Grammarly checks your text for more than 400 common and advanced writing improvements. The checks include common grammatical errors, such as subject-verb agreement, article use, and modifier placement, in addition to contextual spelling mistakes, phonetic spelling mistakes, and irregular verb conjugations. Plus, Grammarly’s spell check takes the context of your sentence into account. Grammarly also provides synonym suggestions to make your writing more readable and precise. With Grammarly, you can write online with confidence. You can read more about Grammarly here: https://gram.ly/HSJQ Please feel free to contact us with any additional questions or concerns you may have. Sincerely, {{ticket.assignee.name}}information_about_grammarly, information

Without limitation, Grammarly may deny you access to the Services, or terminate this Agreement and your account, if your use of the Services exceeds the 30-day and 24-hour use limitations set forth under the section titled “License.”

Information::About::Can I Use Grammarly Being Under 18 Years Old?

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


My name is {{ticket.assignee.name}}, and I'm happy to answer this for you.


As a general matter, we only permit users who are able to enter into contracts such as our Terms of Service to use the Grammarly service. However, if you are at least 13 years old but not yet 18 years old, our policy is to permit you to use our service only with the approval of your parent or guardian.


Please do not hesitate to contact us with any additional questions or concerns. We are here to help!

Information::About::Chromebook CompatibilityHey {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thank you for contacting Grammarly Support. I'm happy to answer this for you! If you have a Chromebook, you can check your documents using Grammarly for Chrome and the online Grammarly Editor. Unfortunately, Grammarly's other apps won't work on this device. To add Grammarly's free browser extension to your Chrome browser, please visit this page: https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/grammarly-spell-checker-g/kbfnbcaeplbcioakkpcpgfkobkghlhen Once you have downloaded and installed the Grammarly extension for Chrome, you should be able to use it as you write online. Simply click on the "G" button in the bottom right-hand corner of a text field and Grammarly will show mistakes in a window that opens automatically. Also, you can hover over a highlighted mistake and see Grammarly's suggestions on a small card that will appear next to the mistake. Finally, you can log in to your account {{ticket.requester.email}} at https://app.grammarly.com/ and proofread your writing by copying or uploading it to the online Grammarly Editor. I hope this helps, but please don't hesitate to contact us if you need any further assistance. Best regards, {{ticket.assignee.name}}information, information_about_chromebook_compatibility
Information::About::Citation & Grammar Style Guides (All)Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thank you for contacting Grammarly. I'm happy to answer this for you! Information::About::Define ClipboardHi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thanks for contacting Grammarly. I'm happy to answer this for you! Clipboard is a temporary storage area where material cut or copied from a file is kept for pasting into another file. You may paste the copied material by using the Ctrl + V (on Windows OS) or Cmd + V (on macOS) key combination. If you choose to copy your text to the clipboard, you can then open any other program and paste your edited text there. I hope this helps! Please feel free to contact us with any further questions or comments you may have. Kind regards, {{ticket.assignee.name}}information information_about_define_clipboard online_editor desktop

However, it’s possible that there are specific restrictions that your ISP or government may be imposing on using services such as Grammarly that we are not aware of. Information::About::Free vs PremiumHi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thanks for contacting Grammarly! I’m happy to help get you oriented to what we have to offer. Currently, you are using the free version of Grammarly. This gives you access to critical grammar and spelling checks as well as weekly writing reports via email, so you can track how your writing improves over time. You can view everything that’s available to you here: https://www.grammarly.com/faq#toc2 If you want to supercharge your writing performance and leave no errors unchecked, you’ll want to consider Grammarly Premium. It will grant you access to specialized checking (for different types of documents) and stellar tools like the plagiarism detector and vocabulary enhancement. You can find out more about Grammarly’s Premium service here: https://www.grammarly.com/premium Please feel free to contact me with any additional questions or comments. Information::About::Free vs Premium - Paid User AskedHi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, First of all, thank you for your message! The free version of Grammarly allows you to use some of Grammarly’s functionality on some of the most popular websites. You can view everything that’s available to our free users here: https://www.grammarly.com/faq#toc2 Your Premium subscription, on the other hand, grants you access to specialized checking (for different types of documents) and stellar tools like the plagiarism detector and vocabulary enhancement: – 150 critical grammar and spelling checks – 400+ additional advanced grammar and spelling checks – Vocabulary enhancement suggestions – Genre-specific writing style checks (academic, technical, creative, and other styles of writing) – Plagiarism detector that checks more than 8 billion web pages and all major proprietary databases More information is available at https://www.grammarly.com/premium I hope this clarifies the value of our Premium service for you, but please feel free to contact us with any additional questions or comments. Information::About::Free vs Premium - Why Do You Prompt to Upgrade? (Suspicious)Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, First of all, thank you for your message! In addition to the Grammarly Editor, Grammarly offers a free browser extension for Chrome, Safari, Firefox, and Edge, which corrects over 150 types of errors. Grammarly browser extension brings Grammarly’s powerful algorithms straight to you practically wherever you are writing online. However, we also offer a paid product: Grammarly Premium is a paid upgrade that checks for over 400 types of grammatical errors, provides vocabulary enhancement suggestions, detects plagiarism, and provides citation suggestions. For more information about Grammarly Premium, visit: https://www.grammarly.com/premium. Please keep in touch and let us know how we can assist you further. Information::About::Free vs Premium - Why Is It Free? (False Ad)Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thank you for contacting Grammarly Support. Thank you for raising your concern regarding the use of the term "free" in connection with certain of its offerings. Grammarly does indeed offer a free and fully functional grammar and spell-checker application that users can download and utilize free of charge. Separately, Grammarly offers a Premium version which has additional functionality that users can take advantage of for a cost. We hope that this clears up any confusion you might have regarding Grammarly's offerings. Please rest assured that we are familiar with the rules and regulations related to the use of the term "free" in connection with advertising and that we take our obligations to ensure compliance with those rules and regulations very seriously. For more information about Grammarly Premium, visit: https://www.grammarly.com/premium. Please keep in touch and let us know how we can assist you further. Sincerely, {{ticket.assignee.name}}information_free_vs_paid_freemium information information_free_vs_paid_freemium_why_is_it_free_false_ad_concern

Currently, we don’t offer gift subscriptions, but you can purchase a standard subscription and then cancel the service after payment to prevent any further billing. To buy the subscription for someone else, use that person’s email address (create a temporary password for the account, which can be changed later), and enter your own billing information. Information::About::How's it different from cheating? Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thanks for contacting Grammarly! I'm happy to answer this for you. Grammarly is a self-teaching tool; using it is no different from using a writing guide, spelling checker, textbook, or tutor. In fact, many schools and reputable institutions offer Grammarly to their students as part of the learning experience. I hope this addresses your concern, but please feel free to contact us with any additional questions or concerns you may have. Sincerely, {{ticket.assignee.name}}information_about_grammarly_how_is_it_different_from_cheating, information
Information::About::Is It Automatic or Human?Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thanks for contacting Grammarly! Since Grammarly is a self-teaching automated service, all our suggestions are generated based on algorithms. Our service suggests corrections for grammar, spelling, punctuation, and writing style. This process does not involve human proofreaders; it’s based on the sophisticated algorithms that power our products. Please note that we do not claim that our service is 100% accurate because there are limitations to what a program can do (versus what a highly trained English or writing expert can do). However, we do offer human proofreading services to Premium for an additional price. If you use our professional proofreading services, our proofreaders will review your document and correct spelling, grammar, and punctuation errors. However, editing is confined to clear errors; our professionals do not rewrite or reorganize your paper to make it more accurate or convincing, and they attempt to keep the original meaning of the sentence and document fully intact. I hope this clarifies the matter! Please feel free to contact us with any additional questions or concerns you may have. Sincerely, {{ticket.assignee.name}}information_about_is_it_automatic_or_human, information
Information::About::Limitations - # of Computers/DevicesHi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thanks for your message. I can answer that for you! Your membership allows you to access Grammarly on up to five different devices. This limitation applies to the number of devices used simultaneously or within a short period of time. If you'd like to access our service on another device, please follow the instructions in the post below: https://support.grammarly.com/hc/en-us/articles/115000091571 Please feel free to contact us with any questions or concerns you might have. We are happy to help! Have a great day, {{ticket.assignee.name}}information, information_computers_limit
Information::About::Mac CompatibilityHey {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thank you for contacting Grammarly! I'm happy to answer this for you. I'm pleased to inform you that Grammarly is perfectly compatible with Mac. You can take advantage of our Online Editor at https://app.grammarly.com/, the Grammarly extension for your preferred browser, as well as the Desktop App specifically designed for Mac (you can download it at https://grammarly.com/native). The only product that is not available for Mac at this time is Grammarly for Microsoft Office. However, if you are running Parallels or Windows on a Mac, you can download Grammarly for Microsoft Office on Windows. I hope this helps! Information::About::No Difference Between PlansHi {{ticket.requester.name}}, Thank you for contacting Grammarly. I'm happy to answer this for you! Please rest assured that all of our subscription plans grant the same level of access to Grammarly Premium. The only difference between our plans is the length of time for which they allow you to access the paid service. Thus, the monthly plan grants access to Premium for a month, the quarterly plan - for three months, and the annual plan allows to take advantage of our paid features for a year. I hope this clarifies the matter for you, but please let me know if you have any further questions or comments. Kind regards, {{ticket.assignee.name}}information, information_plans_no_different
Information::About::Option to Share Account with Someone (Deny)Hello {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thank you for contacting Grammarly! I’m happy to answer this for you. For your reference, here is an excerpt from our Terms of Service and License Agreement (https://grammarly.com/terms): "You shall be solely responsible for the security and proper use of all user IDs, passwords or other security devices used in connection with the Site and/or the Services, and shall take all reasonable steps to ensure that they are kept confidential and secure, are used properly and are not disclosed to or used by any other person or entity.” As an alternative, you can purchase Grammarly Business. Please refer to https://www.grammarly.com/business. I hope this answers your question, but please let me know if I can assist you further. Information::About::Option to Share Account with Someone (Deny) - Family Plans

Hello {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for contacting Grammarly! I'm happy to answer this for you.


Please note that you should not share your authorization information (login and password) with any third party. You may use Grammarly services solely for your own personal purposes. For your reference, here is an excerpt from our Terms of Service and License Agreement (https://grammarly.com/terms):


"You shall be solely responsible for the security and proper use of all user IDs, passwords or other security devices used in connection with the Site and/or the Services, and shall take all reasonable steps to ensure that they are kept confidential and secure, are used properly and are not disclosed to or used by any other person or entity.”


We understand that several Premium subscriptions may seem unaffordable, so, as an exception, you can share your account with your family members. However, keep in mind that only one email address will be used as your Grammarly login, and the weekly reports will summarize the account's total activity, not each user's writing progress.


Alternatively, you can try out Grammarly Business, which allows you to buy a group subscription for three or more members and includes an admin panel to manage the whole license. You are welcome to check it out at https://grammarly.com/business.


I hope this answers your question, but please let me know if I can assist you further.


Kind regards,


{{ticket.assignee.first_name}}

information feature_request business_mention_and_try_upselling, information_about_option_to_share_account_with_someone_deny_family_plans feature_request_family_plans
Information::About::Premium Checks (Examples)

Hello {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for contacting Grammarly! I'm happy to answer this for you.


When we say that Grammarly Premium offers 400+ checks, we mean that Grammarly checks your text for over 400 types of writing issues.


Currently, we don’t have a detailed public list of all the checks available to our users. We prefer to keep it private for strategic reasons. However, I can provide you with a sample of the types of writing suggestions Grammarly Premium offers. See below for a list of examples from several different categories:


Conciseness


Redundancy


Redundant: I asked him not to make predictions about the future because no one knows what is going to happen.
Concise: I asked him not to make predictions because no one knows what is going to happen.

Wordy sentences


Wordy: It is important to get everybody’s attention.
Concise: Getting everybody’s attention is important.


Confidence


Hedging language


Less confident: I think I would prefer to get the full plan, if possible.
More confident: I would prefer to get the full plan, if possible.


Less confident: I'm no expert, but I think the evidence supports the opposite conclusion.
More confident: I think the evidence supports the opposite conclusion.


Grammar


Wrong word


Incorrect: I want to say you that you did a great job!
Correct: I want to tell you that you did a great job!

Incorrect: Yesterday I met a professor which was your master’s thesis supervisor.
Correct: Yesterday I met a professor who was your master’s thesis supervisor.

Wrong part of speech


Incorrect: The trip ignited my passion to study and preserve history.
Correct: The trip ignited my passion for studying and preserving history.

Wrong verb form


Incorrect: If you would have invited me, I would have brought cupcakes.
Correct: If you had invited me, I would have brought cupcakes.

Incorrect: We were knowing all about this.
Correct: We knew all about this.

Wrong verb tense


Incorrect: She has just finished setting up the romantic dinner before Jack came home.
Correct: She had just finished setting up the romantic dinner before Jack came home.

Incorrect: Debra faces her fears and kept on going.
Correct: Debra faced her fears and kept on going.

Incorrect: Walter earned a lot by the time the project was completed.
Correct: Walter had earned a lot by the time the project was completed.


Punctuation


Comma splice


Incorrect: I'd like to go camping with my friends, I need to get a tent somewhere.
Correct: I'd like to go camping with my friends. I need to get a tent somewhere.

Missing comma


Missing comma: Although the weather wasn’t sunny we had the best time ever.
Correct: Although the weather wasn’t sunny, we had the best time ever.

Missing comma: The more money they make the better for them.
Correct: The more money they make, the better for them.


Missing punctuation


Incorrect: He said, "I don't think we can reach an agreement on this issue"
Correct: He said, "I don't think we can reach an agreement on this issue."

Run-on sentences


Incorrect: I didn't want you to worry I also left you a note.
Correct: I didn't want you to worry. I also left you a note.

Unnecessary ellipsis


Unnecessary: Let's get ice cream... I haven't eaten it for ages.
Better: Let's get ice cream. I haven't eaten it for ages.


Sentence Structure


Faulty parallelism


Not parallel: Mary likes hiking and to ride a bicycle.
Parallel: Mary likes hiking and riding a bicycle.


Missing verb


Incomplete sentence: We should together.
Complete sentence: We should go together.

Wrong word order


Incorrect: This dress isn’t enough small to fit me.
Correct: This dress isn’t small enough to fit me.


Incorrect: My father bought a wooden big table.
Correct: My father bought a big wooden table.


Incorrect: I closed very quietly the door.
Correct: I closed the door very quietly.


Style and Tone


Informal word choice in formal writing


Informal: Researching this issue was a good idea, though.
Formal: Researching this issue was a good idea, however.


Informal: I want you to go check the gauges.
Formal: I want you to check the gauges.


Passive voice


Passive voice: The uncertainty principle was formulated by Heisenberg in 1927.
Active voice: Heisenberg formulated the uncertainty principle in 1927.


Potentially impolite phrasing


Potentially impolite: Also, I want you to write another draft.
Polite: Please write another draft.


Potentially insensitive language


Potentially insensitive: There is a ramp available for guests who are wheelchair bound.
Better: There is a ramp available for guests who use wheelchairs.


Slang in formal writing

Informal: I'm not gonna help you if you don't ask me to.
Formal: I'm not going to help you if you don't ask me to.


Vocabulary and Word Choice


Bland word choice


Acceptable: Marie was very happy to be a part of the team.
Better: Marie was delighted to be a part of the team.

Dated word choice


Dated: Greg oftentimes visits his brother.
Better: Greg frequently visits his brother.

Inflated phrases


Acceptable: We have discovered a number of errors.
Better: We have discovered many errors.

Over-repeated phrases


Repetitive: Technology is an essential part of our lives. It is an essential part of the economy and an essential medium of communication.
Lively: Technology is an essential part of our lives. It is an integral part of the economy and a necessary medium of communication.


Overused and cliche phrasing


Acceptable: Broadly speaking, mid-19th-century doctors did not accept the germ theory of disease.
Better: Mid-19th-century doctors did not accept the germ theory of disease."

Unnatural-sounding word choice


Less natural: Everyone's dream is to find big happiness.
Natural: Everyone's dream is to find great happiness.


I hope this answers your question, but please let me know if you have any further comments.


Kind regards,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

information_about_grammarly_premium_checks, information

You are welcome to review our enterprise solutions at: https://www.grammarly.com/edu/plans-and-pricing/get-quote For individual licenses, we offer monthly, quarterly, and annual subscriptions to Grammarly Premium. The current rates (grammarly.com/premium) are as follows: Monthly Subscription — $29.95 USD/month Quarterly Subscription — $59.95 USD/three months* Annual Subscription — $139.95 USD/one year* *billed as one payment Please see our billing policy for more details at grammarly.com/terms#billing. Grammarly accepts the following payment methods: Credit card, PayPal, and debit card (with the exception of Visa Electron debit cards, Mastercard Maestro, and Interac). I hope this helps! Please let me know if you have any further questions. Regards, {{ticket.assignee.name}}information_quote_or_purchase_order_for_individual_license, information billing

Information::About::Turnitin - Will My Text Show Plagiarism if I use Grammarly?Hello {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thanks for contacting Grammarly! I appreciate the opportunity to assist you with your questions. Please rest assured that checking your texts with Grammarly will not result in these texts showing as plagiarized on Turnitin or any other plagiarism checkers. Similar to files you may have stored on your computer, your documents stored on Grammarly servers are private and not publicly accessible (for example, within another plagiarism checker). We are here to help, so please feel free to contact us with any additional questions or concerns you may have. Sincerely, {{ticket.assignee.name}}information_concern_about_using_gramamarly_resulting_in_plagiarism_on_turnitin, information
Information::About::URLs and IPs to WhitelistHi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thank you for contacting Grammarly! Please whitelist the IPs listed at https://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/aws-ip-ranges.html, as well as the following URLs: capi.grammarly.com (ports 80 and 443) data.grammarly.com (ports 80 and 443) auth.grammarly.com (ports 80 and 443) I hope this information helps! Please do not hesitate to contact us with any additional questions or concerns. Regards, {{ticket.assignee.name}}information development, information_about_urls_and_ips_to_whitelist
Information::About::Using for Business Purposes (ToS Concern)

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for writing in today!


Please rest assured that you can use Grammarly for business purposes. As long as you aren't sharing your account credentials with your colleagues and/or clients, there's no prohibition on an agency (or any other business) using Grammarly to improve its products.


If you’re using Grammarly within your workplace, you may also be interested in our Grammarly Business product. Grammarly Business provides additional benefits like administrative tools to manage user accounts, centralized billing, 24/7 support, and much more. You can learn more at https://www.grammarly.com/business


Please feel free to contact us should you need any further assistance.


Regards,


{{ticket.assignee.first_name}}

information_about_using_for_business_purposes_tos_concern, business_mention_and_try_upselling information
Information::About::We Don't Do ThatHi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thanks for your message! Please note that Grammarly Support is the team responsible for answering questions about Grammarly accounts and resolving technical issues with the website. Grammarly’s customer support team doesn’t provide proofreading or text editing services. We encourage you to check your writing using the online Grammarly Editor at grammarly.com or the Grammarly browser extension. You can also save precious writing time by submitting your text to our proofreaders. They’ll review the entire document for errors and will apply corrections automatically. Our professional proofreading service is only accessible to Premium users. Keep in mind that proofreading costs extra; it is not included in the price of the subscription. Please let me know if you have additional questions or concerns. And have a great day! Sincerely, {{ticket.assignee.name}}information donotsurvey, information_about_we_dont_do_that
Information::About::We Don't Do Tutoring/TranslationHi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, I’m {{ticket.assignee.name}}, and I’m happy to answer your questions. Our goal is to ensure that your document is grammatically accurate. Grammarly reviews each submission for errors in grammar, spelling, punctuation, and form. Unfortunately, we do not provide tutoring/translation services at this time. Grammarly performs three main functions: 1. Text proofreading (grammar, punctuation, and sentence structure): All potential errors in your writing are highlighted for your review. Writers have full control over the correction process; you can choose a correction option from the list provided. 2. Plagiarism assessment: Your text is compared to major proprietary databases along with over 8 billion web pages so that you can be sure your work is original. 3. Text enhancement: Suggestions for improved vocabulary use (including synonyms) are available. We encourage you to check your writing using the online Grammarly Editor at grammarly.com or the Grammarly browser extension. I hope this answers your question, but please do not hesitate to contact us with any additional questions or concerns. We are here to help. Sincerely, {{ticket.assignee.name}}information, information_about_we_don't_do_tutoring_or_translation
Information::About::What does "Grammarly" mean?Hello {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thanks for contacting Grammarly! It may not have been a real word when we founded our company nine years ago, but we'd like to think Grammarly today means "AI-powered writing assistant on a mission to improve lives by improving communication." At least that's what we're striving for every day! Please don’t hesitate to contact us with any additional questions or concerns you may have. We are here to help! Sincerely, {{ticket.assignee.name}}information_about_what_does_grammarly_mean, information
Information::About::What Grammarly Does

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


My name is {{ticket.assignee.name}}, and I'm happy to provide you with some detailed information about what Grammarly can do for you.


Grammarly helps improve your writing mechanics, like grammar and spelling, as well as more complex aspects of communication, such as style and tone. Instead of heavily rewriting what you’re trying to say or dictating how you should say it, we focus on making specific suggestions that enhance your voice and make your intended meaning as clear as possible.


After all, there's much more to great writing than perfect grammar and spelling. Grammarly offers detailed suggestions to help you improve clarity, conciseness, word choice, and more. It can even flag sentences that may sound impolite, insensitive, or unconfident to your reader. We also offer a plagiarism checker, so you can identify passages that need citations.


Grammarly's writing tools are designed to work where you do—on your phone and your computer, in your web browser or your word processor. If you'd like to know more about how Grammarly works, please check out our blog post on the subject: https://www.grammarly.com/blog/how-does-grammarly-work/


Please do not hesitate to contact us with any additional questions or concerns. We are here to help!


Sincerely,

{{ticket.assignee.name}}

information, information_about_grammarly_main_actions
Information::About::What is CC?Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Regarding your question about CC: CC means “carbon copy,” i.e., a secondary recipient, as in a recipient on this helpdesk request. You will receive notifications for all updates on the thread. Please feel free to contact us with any questions or concerns you may have. We are committed to making your experience at Grammarly pleasant and rewarding.information_about_what_is_cc, information

Information::Features::About Genres or DomainHi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thanks for contacting Grammarly. You’ve asked a great question! Each style of writing that you can choose from is associated with a specific set of spelling and grammar checks that enable the Grammarly Editor to most accurately review your work. It’s a good thing! Please select the style that best corresponds to the type of writing you are checking. “General” is a good one to start with if you are unsure which style to pick. Please do not hesitate to contact us with any questions or concerns you might have. Sincerely, {{ticket.assignee.name}}information, information_features_styles
Information::Features::About Genres or Domain (Detailed)Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thanks for contacting Grammarly! I'm happy to answer this for you. Grammarly’s main focus is on spelling, grammar, and punctuation. Hence, these checks are present in almost all genres and document types. The main distinctions among Grammarly genres are stylistic. Please select the style that best corresponds to the type of writing you are checking. “General” is a good one to start with if you are unsure which style to pick. General This genre is our default. It suggests changes to make your writing polite and professional, but not overly formal. It should be used when the type of writing does not fall under any group described below. General includes almost all our checks, except for the checks that are best suited to very formal writing: the who-vs-whom dilemma, conjunctions at the beginning of the sentence (e.g., starting a sentence with And), and some others. This setting also won’t flag any colloquialisms (a lot of, a great amount of) or contractions (wasn’t, can’t). The genres below are ordered from most to least formal: Academic This genre is technically the strictest among Grammarly genres. It's suitable for essays, theses, dissertations, and legal documents. On top of finding grammar and punctuation mistakes, it detects usage of passive voice and contractions (I’m, don’t), first- and second-person pronouns (I, you), and mistakes with who and whom; it also locates cases that should use the subjunctive mood and takes care of casual punctuation (changes !!! to ! and puts periods in some abbreviations). Business The business genre was developed for business communication (emails, presentations). It also checks the text against formal writing criteria. However, it allows the use of some informal expressions, first- and second-person pronouns, numerals instead of spelled-out numbers, and some colloquialisms (e.g., in spite of). Medical and Technical These two settings work similarly in terms of checks allowed or restricted. Since these genres are used in technical and scientific writing (manuals, instructions, research results, etc.), the checks here are aimed at removing ambiguities. The genres detect subjunctive mood and expressions like etc. and and/or. The settings also allow the usage of numerals. Also, the Technical setting flags any future tense usage. Casual The Casual genre is designed for personal communication (chatting, informal emails). It ignores most style issues. It doesn’t flag contractions, double negatives, passive voice, subjective pronouns, or split infinitives (to really like). Creative The Creative genre is similar to Casual. It is the least strict genre, so it’s suitable for writing novels or short stories. Like all other genres, it catches grammar, punctuation, and spelling mistakes. However, it provides a more creative setting for those who are experts in the English grammar and want to bend the rules in order to use a stylistic device or narrative technique. The Creative genre doesn’t detect sentence fragments (missing subject or verb), wordy sentences, colloquialisms, slang (wanna, gotta), squinting modifiers, or incomplete comparisons. Please do not hesitate to contact us with any questions or concerns you might have. Kind regards, {{ticket.assignee.name}}information, information_features_styles_detailed
Information::Features::About Plagiarism CheckerHello {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thanks for your question. I'm happy to answer it for you! We teamed up with ProQuest to provide even more accurate plagiarism checks: from now on, Grammarly’s plagiarism checker searches major proprietary databases along with over 16 billion web pages. We mark any text that matches text published on the Internet as potential plagiarism and suggest citation data to create a reference in accordance with three different formats: APA, MLA, and The Chicago Manual of Style. Please note that the plagiarism checker option is available to Premium users only. I hope this answers your question, but please feel free to contact me if you need help with anything else. Sincerely, {{ticket.assignee.name}}information_about_plagiarism_checker, information information_features_plagiarism
Information::Features::Advanced and Critical Issues ExplanationHi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thanks for contacting us here today. That’s a great question! As a Premium user, you have access to both critical and advanced issues. We use different colors to highlight the potential mistakes in your text. The alerts with the red underlining are critical. The errors underlined in yellow are advanced. Critical issues are the ones essential for credibility and correctness, while advanced ones help you polish up an important document or a letter. To name a few examples, advanced checks include vocabulary enhancements, stylistic issues, sentence structure, and advanced grammar issues. Critical issues are the most basic errors, such as missing articles. I hope this answers your question, but please give me a shout if you have any other questions! Best regards, {{ticket.assignee.name}}information, information_features_advanced_vs_critical_alerts
Information::Features::Catch Repetitive Words?Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thanks for your message! I'm happy to assist you today. Currently, Grammarly catches repetition (when words occur next to each other: 'the the'). Also, we flag 'overused' words (words that repeat within a 20-30 word window) and suggest a replacement. I hope this answers your question, but please feel free to contact us with any questions or concerns you may have. Kindly, {{ticket.assignee.name}}information, information_features_repetitive_words_caught
Information::Features::Compare to Competitor - DeclineHi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thank you for your question! Unfortunately, we are not closely familiar with _____ software, so we feel it would be inappropriate to compare our products. Here is what Grammarly Premium offers: – 150 critical grammar and spelling checks – 100+ additional advanced grammar and spelling checks – Vocabulary enhancement suggestions – Genre-specific writing style checks (academic, technical, creative, and other styles of writing) – Plagiarism detector that checks more than 8 billion web pages More information is available at https://www.grammarly.com/premium Please feel free to contact us with any additional questions or comments. Kind regards, {{ticket.assignee.name}}information, information_features_compare_to_competitor_decline
Information::Features::Comparison - Grammarly vs WordHi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thanks for contacting Grammarly! My name is {{ticket.assignee.name}} and I’m happy to answer your questions. Microsoft Word’s spell-check feature does not identify the following writing errors, which Grammarly does: Contextual spelling: E.g., using effect vs. affect, principal vs. principle, compliment vs. complement. These words may sound the same, but the right one to use depends on context. Punctuation: E.g., a missing comma after “thing” in: “I never miss a thing” says spell-check. Prepositions: Non-native English speakers are especially prone to preposition mistakes, such as writing “you’re mixing me” instead of “you’re mixing me up.” Or “the man is out the house” instead of “the man is out of the house” (or “outside the house” – yet another meaning). Quantifiers: Pairing the wrong type of quantifier with a noun is a very common mistake. For example, you can have less rain or fewer storms, but you can’t have fewer rain or less storms. Modifiers: Squinting, dangling, or misplaced modifiers confuse readers, yet spell-check does not correct them. For example: “After writing a brilliant essay, spell-check did not catch my mistake.” Spell-check didn’t write your essay, did it? But your modifying phrase suggests otherwise! Please do not hesitate to contact us with any additional questions or concerns you might have. Sincerely, {{ticket.assignee.name}}information, information_features_grammarly_vs_word
Information::Features::Concern About Number of Words Checked (Weekly Report)Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thank you for contacting Grammarly! I'm happy to assist you today. Please note that the statistics captured in your weekly Grammarly Insights reports reflect words checked by all Grammarly products. For more information on how productivity is calculated, feel free to check out some FAQs here: https://www.grammarly.com/blog/new-grammarly-insights/ We also understand that our word limitations may not sound very high, but we've found that most of our users don't have problems with their usage volume. If you do run into issues with these limitations, feel free to let us know so we can work together to address them! I hope this addresses your concern, but please do not hesitate to reach out anytime. Sincerely, {{ticket.assignee.name}}information marketing information_features_weekly_progress_report_how_compiled, information_features_concern_about_number_of_words_checked_weekly_report

There is no difference between the Premium and @edu accounts unless an institution requested to disable the plagiarism checker. Also, only paying individual users have access to the professional (human) proofreading services at an additional cost, which is an optional service embedded in the Grammarly Editor. Information::Features::Explain How Weekly Report Stats WorkHi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thank you for your question! Let me try to shed some light on how we get the stats that we share with you in the Grammarly Insights reports. While you’re writing with Grammarly, Grammarly analyzes your text in real time to provide suggestions and corrections. Grammarly also calculates the statistics you see in your Weekly Writing Update email. These calculations (such as number of words written) remain linked to your account and are updated continuously throughout the week as you write more text with Grammarly. Grammarly analyzes three main components of your writing: productivity, mastery, and vocabulary. You can find more information in this article: https://gram.ly/Ds9z I hope this answers your question, but please do not hesitate to reach out at any time. Sincerely, {{ticket.assignee.name}}information marketing, information_features_weekly_progress_report_how_compiled
Information::Features::Explain How Weekly Report Stats Work (Non-English Text Counts)Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thank you for your question! What I can tell you is that because Grammarly is an automated service, it may occasionally highlight some non-English text. Therefore, this text might be included in your weekly Grammarly Insights stats. However, we try to constantly improve our quality to provide users with the best experience. In the meantime, I suggest that you disable Grammarly manually when needed. To disable the Grammarly extension for certain websites, please click the green G icon on your browser's toolbar and disable "Check for Grammar and Spelling." Please keep in touch and let us know how we can assist you further. Best regards, {{ticket.assignee.name}}information marketing, information_features_weekly_progress_report_how_compiled information+features_weekly_report_non_english_counts

Oftentimes, this is the reason we couldn’t track your statistics.

Information::Features::Explain Why No Activity Despite Usage (Weekly Report) - Multiple Accounts Issue

! Ensure that the user has a paid account with us OR delete "free" from this sentence if they don't: "Please note that deleting the free account under _____ ....".



Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for contacting Grammarly! I'm happy to look into this for you.

This issue typically occurs if you have created two or more accounts with Grammarly and receive your weekly Grammarly Insights report to the email address associated with the account that's not being used.

According to our analysis, the account associated with ______ shows no recent usage, which is why you received the corresponding notification.

Please note that deleting the free account under _____ would help you avoid this confusion in the future. Here is how to do that: https://gram.ly/HCVF

Please let me know if there’s anything else I can do to help.


Sincerely,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

Information::Features::Footnote Formatting is Lost (Online Editor, Native App)Hey {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thanks for writing in today! I'm happy to assist you with this. Please note that Grammarly is not capable of checking the formatting of your entire document. In order to review your work, the Grammarly Editor converts your document into plain text formatting, which is why the footnotes in any document uploaded into the Grammarly Editor are visualized as regular text. The good news is that your exported (downloaded) document should contain footnotes. When you are finished, simply download your edited piece using the Download button. The original formatting of your document will be preserved in its downloaded/exported version. I hope this helps! Please let me know if you have any further questions. Kindly, {{ticket.assignee.first_name}}information online_editor desktop, information_features_footnote_formatting_lost
Information::Features::Formatting is LostHi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thanks for contacting Grammarly! I'm happy to answer this for you. Grammarly – when you copy and paste into it – converts your document to plain text. All the formatting in your original document will be lost. To preserve the formatting of your text while using the Grammarly Editor, use the Upload (Import) and Download (Export) buttons to check documents that have been written in other text editors like MS Word, TextEdit, or OpenOffice. Once you're finished editing your text, click the Download or Export button to download the edited text to your computer. Open the new document and you’ll find your original text formatting intact. Supported file types are MS Word (.doc, .docx), OpenOffice (.odt), .txt and .rtf. This method is also true for Grammarly's native desktop app for Macs or PCs: www.grammarly.com/native Please do not hesitate to contact us with any questions or concerns you might have. Sincerely, {{ticket.assignee.name}}information online_editor desktop, information_features_formatting_lost
Information::Features::Free Plagiarism Check (False Ad Complaint)Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thank you for raising your concern regarding the use of the word "free" in connection with our plagiarism check. Like other plagiarism detection sites, Grammarly provides a free check that allows you to see whether or not plagiarism has been detected in your text. But, you'd need to upgrade to our Premium product to see which part of the text was flagged. Sorry for any confusion! For more information about Grammarly's Plagiarism Checker, visit: https://www.grammarly.com/plagiarism Please keep in touch and let us know how we can assist you further. Kind regards, {{ticket.assignee.name}} information information_features_plagiarism marketing, information_features_free_plagiarism_check_false_ad_complaint
Information::Features::How Is Plagiarism Limit Enforced?Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thank you for contacting Grammarly! I'm happy to answer this for you. Please note that this is a limit of 300 typical documents, so you may be able to check more than 300 documents if they are shorter than average in length. This limit is in place to prevent abuse of our services, and it can be adjusted for educational or enterprise subscribers with a legitimate need for higher use allowance. If you ever run into this limit, please contact your organization's Grammarly account administrator or our customer support directly. I hope this addresses your concern, but please don't hesitate to reach out with any further questions. Best wishes, {{ticket.assignee.first_name}}information information_features_plagiarism, information_features_how_is_plagiarism_limit_enforced
Information::Features::How Weekly Report Stats Work - Ignored Suggestions Not CountedHi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thank you for your question! Grammarly calculates mistakes only if the suggested correction is accepted. If you ignore suggestions that are flagged, then they are not counted. To ignore a suggestion, ​click the "Incorrect suggestion" button that's visualized as a flag. I hope this answers your question, but please do not hesitate to reach out anytime. Sincerely, {{ticket.assignee.name}}information marketing, information_features_weekly_progress_report_how_compiled information_features_weekly_report_ignored_not_counted
Information::Features::Limitations - # of CharactersHi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thanks for reaching out! Currently, you can check up to 100,000 characters including spaces at a time using the Grammarly Editor. Analysis for this much text can take several minutes, after which you can make corrections to your text. Please save the corrected text to your source document before checking the next block of text. If you work on a PC, we suggest that you use Grammarly for Microsoft Office to check documents that exceed this limitation. This product will allow you to check your texts directly from within Word or Outlook. Please feel free to contact us with any additional questions you might have. Sincerely, {{ticket.assignee.name}}information online_editor desktop Information_features_limitations_of_checks_characters

Note: If your document contains images, we suggest that you save a copy of that document and remove the images before uploading the file into the Grammarly Editor.


If you work on a PC, we suggest that you use Grammarly for Microsoft Office to check documents that exceed this limitation. This product will allow you to check your texts directly from within Word or Outlook.


Please feel free to contact us with any additional questions you might have.

Information::Features::Limitations - # of Programs

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for your message. I can answer that for you!


Your membership allows you to use all Grammarly products on up to five different devices: the browser extension (for Safari, Chrome, Firefox, Edge), Grammarly for Microsoft Office on Windows OS, the Grammarly Editor (app.grammarly.com), the desktop app for PC and Mac, and the Grammarly Keyboard for iOS and Android.


If you wish to install Grammarly's desktop app for PC and Mac, simply follow this link: https://www.grammarly.com/native


If you'd like to use our service in MS Word and Outlook for Windows, simply go to http://www.grammarly.com/office-addin/ and follow the instructions on that page to install Grammarly for Microsoft Office.


To add the Grammarly extension to your browser, please follow the instructions in the relevant section here: http://gram.ly/CJrt


If you'd like to install the Grammarly Keyboard for iOS, please follow the steps described here.


To learn how to install the Grammarly Keyboard for Android, please refer to this article.


You can also access Grammarly online without having to download the program or extension. To do that, simply log in to the Grammarly Online Editor at www.grammarly.com using your email address and password.


Please feel free to contact us with any questions or concerns you might have. We are happy to help!


Have a great day,

{{ticket.assignee.name}}

information, information_features_limitations_of_programs_on_devices
Information::Features::Limitations - Title LengthHi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thanks for writing in! I'm happy to answer this for you. Unfortunately, the title field is limited to 50 characters including spaces, and anything that exceeds this limit will be truncated. As a workaround, we suggest that you type your full title in the text field. Please feel free to contact us with any questions or concerns you may have. We sincerely apologize for the inconvenience. Sincerely, {{ticket.assignee.name}}information desktop online_editor, information_title_limit
Information::Features::Native/Desktop App vs Office Add-in Please note that the native (desktop) app and the Grammarly add-in for MS Word and Outlook on Windows are different products. While the desktop app offers the same functionality as the Online Editor at https://app.grammarly.com/ and can be accessed right from your desktop, the Grammarly add-in will check your writing from within MS Word and Outlook. information desktop addin, information_desktop_vs_addin
Information::Features::Performance/ScoreHi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thanks for contacting Grammarly! I'm happy to answer your questions. Your Performance score tells you how accurate your document is compared to documents written by other Grammarly users who set the same goals you did. For example, imagine you open a document in the Grammarly Editor and choose the goals "Tell a Story" and "Informal." Grammarly calculates the accuracy level of your document based on the total word count and the number and types of writing issues detected. Then, Grammarly compares the accuracy level of your document to the accuracy levels of all other documents where users chose the goals "Tell a Story" and "Informal." The Performance score you see tells you how your document compares to these other documents. A score of 90, for example, means that the writing in your document is more accurate than the writing in 90 percent of other documents with similar goals. Please note that the score provided by Grammarly is generated for your consideration only; it should not be used to determine an official academic grade or other benchmark that necessitates human input. Additionally, all product users will receive a weekly email with personal stats, insights, tips, and rankings. Some users enjoy these features as a way to self-monitor progress, or see where they want the most improvement. Please don’t hesitate to contact us with any questions or concerns you might have. Sincerely, {{ticket.assignee.name}}information online_editor desktop, information_feature_performance_about
Information::Features::Plagiarism - Citation Audit Formats We Have (APA, MLA, Chicago)

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for contacting Grammarly! I appreciate the opportunity to assist you with your questions.


Unfortunately, Grammarly is not capable of checking the formatting of your entire document. In order to review your work, the Grammarly Editor converts your document into plain text formatting. When you are finished, simply download your edited piece using the Download button. The formatting will return to your document.


When Grammarly checks your text for plagiarism, it offers citation data to create a reference in accordance with three different formats:


Modern Language Association (MLA)

American Psychological Association (APA)

Chicago Manual of Style (Turabian)


Please click the corresponding link that you see in the message displayed at the top of the page under "Plagiarism", and it will automatically redirect you to an online resource with several common citation formats.

Please do not hesitate to contact us with any questions or concerns you might have.


Kind regards,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

We mark any text that matches any sources in our database as potential plagiarism and suggest citation data to create a reference in accordance with three different formats: APA, MLA, and The Chicago Manual of Style. Please click the corresponding link on a suggestion card and we will automatically redirect you to the online resource that will provide general models for citing your text. Information::Features::Plagiarism - Exclude/Whitelist Source RequestHi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thank you for contacting Grammarly! Unfortunately, we are unable to exclude a certain source when checking for plagiarism at this time. We apologize for any inconvenience this might be causing. If you were shown the plagiarism warning, it simply means that part of the text in your document matches some text that Grammarly found online or in a major proprietary database. It may even be your own blog. If that’s the case, please consider the plagiarism warning as a simple notification that some of your text may have been used in another source. You may wish to edit this text or provide a citation. Our plagiarism checker is meant to help you take a second look at your writing to ensure that all the ideas expressed within the text are in fact original. Please do not hesitate to contact us with any additional questions or concerns. Information::Features::Plagiarism - Grammarly vs TurnitinHi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thanks for contacting us here at Grammarly! I can definitely provide some insight into the value of our plagiarism feature. Our team is focused on providing a more thorough review of your text than any other writing tool available on the market. With more than 400 grammar points analyzed, Grammarly offers the most precise feedback and provides detailed explanations of potential writing errors. In this way, you learn to be a better writer while improving the text at hand! The text enhancement feature suggests context-optimized synonyms that animate your sentences and improve the readability of your documents. The plagiarism detection function helps prevent plagiarism by automatically generating citations for any unoriginal text. Currently, Grammarly’s plagiarism checker searches major proprietary databases along with over 16 billion web pages, while Turnitin compares text against both published materials and websites. For that reason, plagiarism checks by Turnitin oftentimes find different sources than Grammarly and vice versa. Neither Grammarly nor Turnitin index your text on the web, so it won’t show up as plagiarized. We are here to help, so please feel free to contact us with any additional questions or concerns you may have. Sincerely, {{ticket.assignee.name}}information_features_plagiarism information_features_plagiarism_grammarly_vs_turnitin, information
Information::Features::Plagiarism - Inaccurate Plagiarism Score Complaint (Turnitin)

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for contacting us here at Grammarly! I'm sorry to hear about this.


It appears that your school might be using TurnItin as their plagiarism checker, which is why your document returned different plagiarism scores.


Our team is focused on providing a more thorough review of your text than any other writing tool available on the market. With more than 400 grammar points analyzed, Grammarly offers the most precise feedback and provides detailed explanations of potential writing errors. In this way, you learn to be a better writer while improving the text at hand!


The text enhancement feature suggests context-optimized synonyms that animate your sentences and improve the readability of your documents.


The plagiarism detection function helps prevent plagiarism by automatically generating citations for any unoriginal text. Grammarly compares your text to more than 16 billion websites along with several major proprietary databases, while Turnitin compares text against websites and published materials that may exist in different databases. For that reason, plagiarism checks by Turnitin oftentimes find different sources than Grammarly and vice versa.


I hope this answers your question, but please let me know if I can assist you further.


Sincerely,

{{ticket.assignee.name}}

Because we search only in ProQuest’s databases, texts from the webpage you referred to are unavailable to our checker.

Information::Features::Plagiarism - Scores Change - Explain WhyHi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thanks for contacting Grammarly! I'm happy to clarify this for you. Our plagiarism database is composed of documents that have been indexed by the major search engines, as well as the major proprietary databases available through our partner, ProQuest. Therefore, the plagiarism checker can return different results depending on the sources found by the search engines. Plagiarism scores may vary from time to time even for the same text. Please also note that per our Terms of Service and License Agreement (http://www.grammarly.com/terms.php) we provide the plagiarism checking tool “as is” and can’t guarantee the consistency of results for checks done at different times. I hope this clarifies the issue for you, but do not hesitate to contact me if you have any further questions or concerns. Whether or not you have already cited a source in your text, the Grammarly Editor will bring each instance of potential plagiarism to your attention. Information::Features::Readability Score in Denali

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for contacting Grammarly! I'm happy to assist you today.


The readability score is based on sentence length and word length. Normally, longer sentences tend to be harder to read and understand.


You can improve your writing by simplifying sentences with lower readability scores -- this would increase your readability score.


To view your document statistics, please click Correct with Assistant and select the Performance option. This section offers a lot of useful information about your text, including your overall readability score.


Alternatively, you can click on the word count tab in the bottom of the screen and then choose readability score. Note: to enable the word count option, please click on the gear icon in the lower left corner and toggle the switch next to the preferred setting.


You can learn more about our readability scores at https://www.grammarly.com/blog/readability-scores/


I hope this information helps, but don't hesitate to reach out for any further assistance.


Kind regards,

{{ticket.assignee.name}}

Information::Features::Synonyms Not Shown - Not Found (Explain)Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thank you for contacting Grammarly! I'm happy to assist you today. When we show synonyms for words, we are relying on the data collected in Webster’s New World Roget’s A-Z Thesaurus. If Grammarly does not show a synonym for a particular word, it means that the thesaurus we are using doesn't provide synonyms for this word. We do update our thesaurus from time to time, so I will pass your request to the development team. I hope this clarifies the matter, but please let me know if I can assist you further. Kindly, {{ticket.assignee.name}}information, information_features_synonyms_not_shown_explain
Information::Features::Unique Words in Weekly Report (Explain)Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thanks for contacting Grammarly Customer Support! I'm happy to answer this for you. Vocabulary is calculated based on the number of unique words that were checked. For example, if you used the word ‘Beautiful’ five times in a week, then it will count as one unique word. However, all five uses of the word will be counted in the Productivity section. This is why the Productivity number will almost always be higher than the Vocabulary number. (It is possible for you to have a tie if you don’t use any word more than once.) Please note that in this context, we use the word "unique" in the sense of "different." This metric is intended to help users see how many different words they used as opposed to the total number of words they wrote. Function words such as 'and' and 'the' are included in the Vocabulary calculation. You can find more information in this article: https://gram.ly/Ds9z I hope this answers your question, but please do not hesitate to reach out at any time. Kindly, {{ticket.assignee.name}}information marketing, information_features_unique_words_in_weekly_report_explain

To prevent this issue from happening in the future, please make sure you're logged in to your Grammarly account associated with {{ticket.requester.email}} in all Grammarly products.

I hope this explanation makes sense, but please let me know if there’s anything else I can do to help. We apologize for any inconvenience.

Information::FP/FN::-ise and -ize in Australian English

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for contacting Grammarly. I'm happy to answer this for you!


Grammarly recognizes both "-ise" and "-ize" variants as correct in Australian English. The "-ise" variant is indeed the preferred, more frequent spelling in Australian English. Grammarly's decision to allow the "-ize" variant in Australian English spelling is based on sources such as the Macquarie Dictionary. The Macquarie Dictionary lists "-ize" spelling variants of words such as "recognize" as legitimate. According to the Macquarie Dictionary, the "-ize" spelling variants are

an acceptable form occurring less frequently than the main form. Sometimes this is only slightly less frequently, sometimes it is a much rarer occurrence, but it is, nevertheless, an acceptable variation.


I hope this clarifies the matter, but please do not hesitate to contact us with any questions or concerns you might have.


Kind regards,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

information fpfn, information_fpfn_ise_and_ize_in_australian_english
Information::FP/FN::Capitalization Issue Not Flagged (Free User)Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thanks for contacting Grammarly! I'm happy to help get you oriented to what we have to offer. Unfortunately, the free version of Grammarly does not identify capitalization issues at this time. Currently, you are using the free version of the Grammarly Editor or its browser extension. This allows you to use some of Grammarly’s functionality on many popular websites. Also at your disposal: helpful services like the contextual spell checker and a grammar checker. You can view everything that’s available to you here: https://www.grammarly.com/spell-check If you want to supercharge your writing performance and leave no errors unchecked, you’ll want to consider Grammarly Premium. It will grant you access to specialized checking (for different types of documents) and stellar tools like the plagiarism detector and vocabulary enhancement. You can find out more about Grammarly’s Premium service here: https://www.grammarly.com/premium Please feel free to contact me with any additional questions or comments. And have a great day! Sincerely, {{ticket.assignee.name}}information fpfn, information_fpfn_capitalization_issue_not_flagged_free_user
Information::FP/FN::Closing Punctuation Check Delayed by DesignHi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thank you for voicing your concern. I'm happy to clarify this for you! Because we check your text dynamically (as you are writing), we will not suggest closing punctuation until the sentence is finished. We don’t want to bombard you with annoying (and misleading) suggestions every time you pause to think. This applies even if you upload a finished document in the Editor. The last sentence you are working on will not be checked for closing punctuation. Please do not hesitate to contact us with any questions or concerns. And have a great day! Sincerely, {{ticket.assignee.name}}information fpfn, information_fpfn_closing_punctuation_missing
Information::FP/FN::CollocationsHi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thank you for contacting Grammarly. I'm happy to answer this for you! Currently, Grammarly catches collocational mistakes in the following structures only: adjective + noun (strong rain - heavy rain). However, we are planning to extend this check in the future to include more structures. Although we don't have any ETA for this release yet, I'm confident it will be released in the near future. I hope this clarifies the matter for you, but please do not hesitate to contact us with any questions or concerns you might have. Kind regards, {{ticket.assignee.name}}information fpfn, information_fpfn_collocations

Information::FP/FN::Document Title Not Checked (Explain)Hey {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thank you for your question! Let me try to shed some light on why some mistakes haven't been caught here. Unfortunately, the Grammarly Editor doesn't check content in document title fields. As a workaround, we suggest that you type your full title in the text field. I hope this clarifies the matter, but please do not hesitate to reach out at any time. We apologize for any inconvenience. Sincerely, {{ticket.assignee.name}}information fpfn, information_fpfn_grammarly_document_title_not_checked_explain
Information::FP/FN::Double Spacing After Period Not CaughtHi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thank you for contacting Grammarly. I'm happy to answer this for you! As Grammarly uses several grammar and style guides for checking your document, and some style guides prescribe double spacing between sentences, we do not flag double spacing issues after a period as it might be correct in many cases. However, please note that Grammarly catches double spacing issues on a sentence level. I hope this answers your question, but please feel free to contact us with any further questions or comments. We are here to help! Sincerely, {{ticket.assignee.name}}information fpfn, information_fpfn_double_spacing_not_caught
Information::FP/FN::Explain Inaccuracy (Based on Algorithms)Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thank you for sending us this information! Our developers and linguists are carefully analyzing your text but it will take a little time to identify the cause of these issues, so we thank you for your patience. What I can tell you is that because Grammarly is an automated service, all our suggestions are generated based on algorithms. We do not claim that our service is 100% accurate because there are limitations to what a program can do (versus what a highly-trained English or writing expert can do). Please understand, while we strive to improve our algorithms in order to provide accurate and helpful suggestions, they are not perfect (yet!). Thank you for your patience and understanding! Please feel free to contact us with any questions or concerns you may have. Sincerely, {{ticket.assignee.name}}information fpfn, information_fpfn_explain_inaccuracy_based_on_algorithms
Information::FP/FN::Explain Inaccuracy (Long Wordy Sentence)Hey {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thank you for your question! Let me try to shed some light on why some mistakes haven't been caught in this sentence. The fact that the sentence is too long complicates the task of error correction, and Grammarly cannot guarantee catching all errors in such a case. Please consider breaking your sentence into shorter ones and running the check again. Currently, Grammarly cannot break long sentences into shorter ones for you, but we are constantly working to improve our algorithms. I hope this answers your question, but please do not hesitate to reach out any time. Sincerely, {{ticket.assignee.name}}information fpfn, information_fpfn_explain_inaccuracy_long_wordy_sentence
Information::FP/FN::Explain Inaccuracy (Nonsensical)Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thank you for sending us this information. I think I can shed some light on the situation. Grammarly is designed to find and correct naturalistic writing errors. Our algorithms may be less effective on sentences with several mistakes artificially inserted because these are not naturalistic errors. I hope this clarifies the matter! Please feel free to contact us with any questions or concerns you may have. Kindly, {{ticket.assignee.name}}information fpfn, information_fpfn_explain_inaccuracy_nonsensical
Information::FP/FN::Explain Inaccuracy (Suggest to Check Paragraph)Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thank you for sending us this information! I am happy to provide clarification of the situation. The Grammarly Editor works most effectively when checking texts that are at least one paragraph long, because many of Grammarly’s algorithms are based on context. Therefore, it’s better to check more than one sentence at a time. Please feel free to contact us with any questions or concerns you may have. Sincerely, {{ticket.assignee.name}}information fpfn, information_fpfn_explain_inaccuracy_suggest_to_check_paragraph
Information::FP/FN::Explain Inaccuracy (Too Many Errors)Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thank you for sending us this information. I think I can shed some light on the situation. If a sentence contains too many errors for our algorithms to understand what the sentence means, our suggestions may be less effective. I hope this clarifies the matter, and we apologize for any inconvenience. Kindly, {{ticket.assignee.name}}information fpfn, information_fpfn_explain_inaccuracy_too_many_errors
Information::FP/FN::Explain Inaccuracy - Mistake Not Caught (Free User)Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thank you for sending us this example! I think I can shed some light on the situation. Some grammar checks come only with Grammarly Premium. The free version of Grammarly identifies many basic writing errors. The Premium version includes everything that comes with the free version but also flags many additional advanced errors that are not included in the free version. If you want to supercharge your writing performance and leave no errors unchecked, you’ll want to subscribe to our Premium service. It will grant you access to specialized checking (for different types of documents) and stellar tools like the plagiarism detector and vocabulary enhancement. You can find out more about Grammarly’s Premium service here: https://www.grammarly.com/premium Please feel free to contact us with any additional questions or comments you might have. Information::FP/FN::Gender-Biased Checks Complaint

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for taking the time to report this to us!


Please note that suggestions on gender-biased language are one of several types of feedback that Grammarly provides to help people communicate effectively. As with all of Grammarly's feedback, we are here to provide suggestions — as a user of Grammarly, you ultimately decide whether to accept or reject the suggestions.


Language evolves, and certain words and phrases can express bias — even when the writer has no intent to do so.


If you’d like Grammarly to stop flagging a particular word as incorrect or being used incorrectly, you can add the word to your personal dictionary. To access this feature, go to the Profile tab in the Grammarly Editor and then select Personal dictionary:



I hope this helps! If there's anything else we can do for you, please let us know.


Kind regards,


{{ticket.assignee.first_name}}

information fpfn, information_fpfn_gender_biased_checks_complaint
Information::FP/FN::Incorrect Capitalized Word Not Flagged (Explain)Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thank you for submitting your text! At this time, Grammarly considers most capitalized words as proper names. Since the word "___" is capitalized, Grammarly does not suggest a correction. We do not check proper names for spelling, except for very common proper names, e.g. Microsoft. We apologize for any inconvenience this may be causing. Please feel free to contact us with any further questions or concerns. And have a wonderful day! Sincerely, {{ticket.assignee.name}}information fpfn, information_fpfn_incorrect_capitalized_word_not_flagged_explain

Please note that Grammarly is able to identify whether a certain sentence is missing a word. For example, our service suggests inserting "know" in "I don't what you are talking about." or "It" in "Doesn't matter how far into the future it is." However, this feature comes with Grammarly Premium. If you want to supercharge your writing performance and leave no errors unchecked, you’ll want to subscribe to our Premium service. Currently, Grammarly raises a red flag if the same word in a sentence is repeated twice or several times in a row. Unfortunately, our algorithms do not catch repeated phrases at this time, but we are constantly working on the improvement of our algorithms. Information::FP/FN::What's Weak or Uncertain Language?

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for reaching out! I'm happy to assist you today.

These checks catch hedging language and suggest alternative phrasing that sounds more confident. For example, it would suggest changing "I think we should set up a meeting" to "Let's set up a meeting."

You're welcome to visit this page for more details:

https://www.grammarly.com/blog/hedging-language/

Please feel free to contact us with any further questions or comments you may have.


Kindly,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

information fpfn, information_fpfn_weak_or_uncertain_language_explain
Information::FP/FN::Whom vs WhoHi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thank you for contacting Grammarly. I'm happy to answer this for you! If you choose the Academic, Business, Technical, or Medical document type, Grammarly will suggest changing "who" to "whom." However, using "who" instead of "whom" in an objective position has become very conventional, so "whom" is often considered very formal. I hope this clarifies the matter for you, but please do not hesitate to contact us with any questions or concerns you might have. Kind regards, {{ticket.assignee.name}}information fpfn, information_fpfn_who_whom
Information::FP/FN::Why Passive Voice Is FlaggedHi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thank you for writing in today! I'm happy to clarify this for you. Our writing app thoroughly reviews texts for passive voice constructions. This feature is in demand because the active voice is the preferred style of most readers as the card puts it. The passive voice is a grammatically correct construction, but is frowned upon in many writing styles. Please note Grammarly does not discourage passive voice. Grammarly notifies you of the frequency of passive constructions in the document. This check serves as a suggestion. Grammarly checks for the passive voice constructions in all writing styles except for Casual and Creative. I hope this explanation makes sense, but please do not hesitate to contact us if you have any further questions or concerns. Kind regards, {{ticket.assignee.name}}information fpfn, information_features_passive_voice_is_not_incorrect

We hope you find our free service's features useful! You're welcome to review all that's available to our free users at https://www.grammarly.com/faq#toc2 If there's anything else we can do for you, please let me know. We believe that this is a more effective way to allow users to become familiar with Grammarly than a free trial. As a workaround, you may consider upgrading to the monthly plan at $29.95 USD to check whether Grammarly suits your needs. If you decide to continue using Grammarly Premium for a longer period of time, you can contact our support team with a request to apply your payment of $29.95 USD toward the cost of the quarterly/annual subscription. Note: we'll be able to do this only if you contact us before your monthly subscription renews. If there's anything else we can do for you, please let me know. Also, as a workaround, you may consider upgrading to the monthly plan at $29.95 USD to check whether Grammarly suits your needs. If you decide to continue using Grammarly Premium for a longer period of time, you can contact our support team with a request to apply your payment of $29.95 USD toward the cost of a quarterly or annual subscription.

Information::How To::Add to Dictionary & Personal Dictionary

Hi {{ticket.requester.name}},


Thank you for contacting Grammarly! I'm happy to provide more information about our 'Add to dictionary' feature.


If you’d like Grammarly to stop flagging a particular spelling as incorrect, you can add the word to your personal dictionary by clicking the book icon. Clicking it will add this word to your dictionary and prevent it from being marked as a mistake in the future. The book icon is indicated in this screenshot:



Also, we offer a feature called Personal Dictionary that allows you to manage the words you've added at any time. To access this feature, go to the Account section in the Grammarly Editor, and then select Customize:


​​


To learn more about these features, please visit https://www.grammarly.com/blog/how-to-add-new-words/


I hope this helps! Please don't hesitate to contact me with any additional questions or requests.


Sincerely,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}


information_how_to_add_to_dictionary, information

I'm happy to provide more information about our 'Add to dictionary' feature. Unfortunately, words containing symbols other than the English language letters cannot be added to your Grammarly dictionary. Several words separated by a blank between them cannot be added as well. We apologize for any inconvenience. If you have any other questions or concerns, just let me know and I’ll be happy to help. And have a fantastic day!
