Information::How To::Change Language Preference

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for contacting Grammarly. That's a great question!


Grammarly recognizes a number of spelling, grammar, and punctuation differences in American, British, Canadian, and Australian English.


You can change your language preference at https://account.grammarly.com/customize.


You can also set up your language preference in the Grammarly extension: simply click the Grammarly icon in your browser's toolbar and select your preferred setting in the dropdown menu next to I write in.


To learn more about this feature, please visit https://www.grammarly.com/blog/how-to-switch-dialects/


Please feel free to contact us with any questions or comments you may have.


Best regards,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

Information::How To::Check My Emails In Multiple MailboxesHi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thank you for contacting Grammarly! I'm happy to assist you with this. To check emails in multiple mailboxes, you need to log in to your Grammarly account associated with {{ticket.requester.email}} at https://www.grammarly.com and have our browser extension installed and/or Grammarly for Microsoft Office installed. Note: Your Grammarly email address can be different from an email address where you compose your emails. I hope this answers your question, but I am happy to address any other questions you may have. Information::How To::Convert or Export .pages Into .docxHi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, First of all, thank you for your message! At this time, Grammarly supports the following file types: MS Word (.doc, .docx), OpenOffice (.odt), .txt and .rtf. Please note that you can save your documents in .docx or .doc format using Pages. Follow the steps below: Step 1: Open the file you want to convert into a .docx/.doc document. Step 2: From the menu bar, click on File → Export To. Step 3: Then, click on Word: http://take.ms/6yGXg Step 4: Next, click on Advanced Options. You should see a drop-down labeled Format. Step 5: Now, choose the appropriate extension – ".docx" or ".doc" Step 6: Click on Next. Step 7: Type a name for the word document, pick a destination, and click Export. I hope this helps! Please feel free to contact us with any questions or concerns you may have. Kindly, {{ticket.assignee.name}}information, information_how_to_convert_pages_file_to_docx
Information::How To::Copy/Paste in the Editor

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for contacting Grammarly!


You can copy and paste your text using the Copy to clipboard feature indicated in this screenshot:


​

Alternatively, you can use the Command+C and Command+V combination on macOS, or the Ctrl+C and Ctrl+V combination on Windows.


You can also upload .doc or .docx files to Grammarly and then download the edited document back to its source. Use the “Import” (or "Upload") button on the dashboard and the “Export” ("Download") button on the toolbar. Alternatively, you can simply drag and drop your document onto the “My Grammarly” directory.


I hope that helps! Please feel free to contact us with any questions or comments you may have.


Best regards,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

information online_editor desktop information_how_to_copy_paste_in_the_editor
Information::How To::Delete Account - Instructions (Social Sign-in)

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for reaching out. We apologize that Grammarly did not perform for you as expected.


If you would like to delete your free Grammarly account, see the instructions below:


FACEBOOK:


  1. Log in to Grammarly using the "Continue with Facebook" option
  2. Select the Account tab to the left
  3. Click the "Delete Account" button on the page that opens next.


Grammarly may ask you to provide your password to confirm the action. Since you used Facebook to sign up with Grammarly, you'll need to enter your Facebook password to confirm the deletion. Once you do that, your account will be deleted. Please note that once you delete an account, the documents on that account will no longer be available.


Note: The option to manage your account isn't available on mobile devices at this time. Please use a laptop or a desktop computer to proceed with deleting your account.



GOOGLE:


  1. Log in to Grammarly using the "Continue with Google" option
  2. Select the Account tab to the left
  3. Click the "Delete Account" button on the page that opens next and confirm the deletion
  4. You'll see the message "Are you sure you wish to delete the Grammarly account associated with {{ticket.requester.email}}?" Please choose "Yes, continue with account deletion".
  5. Select the account you'd like to delete in the window that opens next and wait a second for the page to refresh and the account deletion confirmation to appear.


Note: The option to manage your account settings (including account deletion) on mobile devices is available at https://account.grammarly.com/.


I hope this helps! Please don't hesitate to reach out for any further assistance. We hope to serve you again in the future.


Kindly,


{{ticket.assignee.first_name}}

information_how_to_delete_account_social_signin, information social_signin
Information::How To::Delete Account - Instructions (Standard Sign-in)

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for reaching out. We apologize that Grammarly did not perform for you as expected.


If you would like to delete your free Grammarly account, see the instructions below:


  1. Log in to Grammarly under {{ticket.requester.email}}
  2. Select the Account tab to the left
  3. Click the "Delete Account" button on the page that opens next.


Grammarly may ask you to provide your password to confirm the action. Once you do that, your account will be deleted. Please note that once you delete an account, the documents on that account will no longer be available.


Note: The option to manage your account settings (including account deletion) on mobile devices is available at https://account.grammarly.com/.


I hope this helps, but please feel free to contact us should you need any further assistance. We hope to serve you again in the future.


Sincerely,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

information_how_to_delete_account, information

Hey {{ticket.requester.name}},

Once you’ve finished editing, you can copy the text to your clipboard or download the document:

If you started by uploading a document file, Grammarly will export your document in the same file format that you began with (for example, if you started by uploading a .doc file, your Grammarly document will be available to download as a .doc file).

Information::How To::Download PDF Report in Denali

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for contacting Grammarly! I'm happy to assist you today.


To download the detailed report, please do the following:


  1. Go to app.grammarly.com and open any document you need
  2. Click Correct With Assistant
  3. Go to Performance

  4. Click Download PDF Report at the bottom of the window that opens next:



Please note that the PDF report will become available once Grammarly finishes checking your document.


I hope this helps, but let me know if you have any further questions!


Kind regards,

{{ticket.assignee.name}}

Information::How To::Download the Classic Detailed PDF Report

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for contacting Grammarly! I'm happy to assist you today.


First, let me note that the previous version of the detailed PDF report is not currently available in the new editor interface. While our engineers work on adding this feature to the new editor version, you can switch to the classic editor version for any specific document and download the classic version of a detailed report then.


To switch to the previous version of the Grammarly Editor, please open any document, click the question mark in the bottom left corner, then choose Back to classic Editor:


​

Once you've switched to the classic version of the Grammarly Editor, click the Score button in the bottom right corner of the page, then select Download detailed report in the window that opens next:


​


If you change your mind after switching to the classic Editor for a certain document, click the question mark in the bottom left corner again and choose Switch to the new Grammarly Editor:


​


I hope this helps, but please don't hesitate to reach out for any further assistance.


Kind regards,


{{ticket.assignee.first_name}}

  1. Enable the plagiarism checker in the right-hand toolbar at the bottom of the page.

  3. Go to Performance
  4. Click Download PDF Report in the window that opens next.

Information::How To::Download the Premium Grammarly (Confusion) - Detailed

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for writing in today! I'm happy to clarify this for you.


Grammarly Premium is a subscription-based service that you can access from anywhere with internet access as long as you are signed in to your account using your email and password. Your type of account (free or Premium) is identified once you log in.


Here are a few tips to ensure you're using the Premium version of our service:


When logged in to https://app.grammarly.com/ or Grammarly's desktop app using {{ticket.requester.email}} as your login, you should see the blue Premium banner in the top left corner:

​​​​

If you use the Grammarly browser extension for your preferred browser, you should also see the indicator of the Premium version when clicking on the green G icon in the top right corner of the browser window:
​​

When using Grammarly for Microsoft Office, please open Grammarly tab and click Settings. In this menu, you will see the golden Premium banner:
​​​​

​​

I hope this helps! Please let me know if there’s anything else I can do for you.


Kind regards,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

information subscription, information_how_to_download_Premium_confusion_detailed
Information::How To::Edit Emails with Grammarly

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for reaching out! I'm happy to assist you today.

To edit emails in your preferred browser (Chrome, Safari, Firefox, or Edge), simply install our browser extension. For more details on how Grammarly's browser extension works, please visit https://support.grammarly.com/hc/en-us/articles/115000091592


If you prefer Microsoft Outlook and have a Windows computer, you can edit your emails using Grammarly for Microsoft Office. The necessary system requirements are listed here.


Alternatively, you can copy the text of your email into the Grammarly Editor and then copy-paste it back to your email after editing.

Note: Grammarly doesn't support integration with Apple Mail, the Airmail app, Mozilla Thunderbird or Windows Live Mail.


I hope this helps! Please keep in touch and let us know how we can assist you further.


Kindly,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

Information::How To::Enable Character Count in Denali

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for contacting Grammarly! I'm happy to assist you today.


To enable character count in the Grammarly Editor, please do the following:


1. Open any document and click the gear symbol in the lower left corner of the page. In the window that opens next, simply toggle the switch next to "Show word count" and click "Done." Here's what that window will look like:



2. Once the Preference window is closed, you'll see the number of words at the bottom of the page, which will look like this:


​​


Simply click on the number of words to bring up the menu and select the characters option:


​​



I hope this helps! Please don't hesitate to reach out for any further assistance.


Kindly,

{{ticket.assignee.name}}

Information::How To::Hide Track Changes/Revisions (Mac)

Hello {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for reaching out! I'm happy to assist you with this.


To quickly delete all comments in your Word document, please follow these steps:


  • Click any comment and then click Review > Delete.



  • To remove all comments at once, click a comment and then on the Review tab, click the arrow by Delete, and click Delete All Comments in Document.


I hope this helps!


Please feel free to contact us with any questions or concerns.


Best regards,

{{ticket.assignee.name}}

information_how_to_hide_track_changes_mac information
Information::How To::Hide Track Changes/Revisions (Windows)

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for reaching out! I'm happy to assist you with this.


To quickly delete all comments in a document, please follow these steps:


Click the comment, and then click Review > Delete.



To remove all comments at once, click a comment, and then on the Review tab, click the arrow below Delete, and click Delete All Comments in Document.


I hope this helps! Please do not hesitate to contact us with any questions or concerns.


Best regards,

{{ticket.assignee.name}}

Information::How To::Navigate Grouped Alerts in Denali

Hi {{ticket.requester.name}},


Thank you for sharing this! We take your feedback seriously and use it to improve our service.

Please note that by navigating through the alerts in each group, the text scrolls to the appropriate alerts. This is an expected behavior and makes it easier to stay in the context of the same alert type.

However, there is still a way to navigate through the alerts chronologically. You can go through the alerts in the document chronologically by clicking underlined words in the text. This way the alerts on the right will open to the appropriate group.

Also, you can adjust your Preference settings to disable the auto-jump feature for a certain document — simply open any document and click the gear symbol in the lower left corner of the page. In the window that opens next, toggle the switch next to the auto-jump setting to either enable or disable it. Here's what that window will look like:




Please feel free to go through this guide on the new Grammarly Editor interface: https://gram.ly/HSMc

Please let me know if there’s anything else I can do to help. And have a great day!


Kind regards,

{{ticket.assignee.name}}

information_how_to_navigate_grouped_alerts_in_denali online_editor desktop, information

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},

You can select your preferred dialect settings at https://account.grammarly.com/customize or by clicking the Account tab and then selecting the Customize section.


You can also set up your dialect preferences in the Grammarly extension: simply click the Grammarly icon in your browser's toolbar and select your preferred setting in the dropdown menu next to I write in.


Please feel free to contact us with any questions or comments you may have.

Information::How To::Undo/Redo in the Editor

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for contacting Grammarly!


If you've deleted a part of your document in error or would like to undo some previous action made while editing your text, simply press the combination of Ctrl+Z (on Windows OS) or Cmd+Z (on macOS). To redo something you've just undone, press Ctrl+Y (on Windows OS) or Cmd+Y (on macOS).


I hope that helps! Please feel free to contact us with any questions or comments you may have.


Best regards,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

information online_editor desktop information_how_to_undo_or_redo_in_the_editor
Information::How To::Unsubscribe | Stop Emails - Instructions

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for reaching out!


We offer you the opportunity to opt out of marketing and certain other Grammarly emails. To opt out, open any email from Grammarly, navigate to the bottom of the email, and click Unsubscribe.


Alternatively, you can use this link to adjust your email preferences: https://account.grammarly.com/notifications


Please note: If you are subscribed to Grammarly Premium, you will continue to receive emails about billing-specific issues and notifications for your Premium account even if you unsubscribe from all other Grammarly emails.


If you would like to uninstall the Grammarly extension for your browser, please follow the instructions in the relevant section of this article:

https://support.grammarly.com/hc/en-us/articles/115000091591


Please do not hesitate to contact me with any questions you might have.


Sincerely,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

Information::How To::Update All G Products (Add-in, Desktop, Extension)

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


First of all, thank you for your message!


Please note that all Grammarly products are updated automatically for your convenience. If you wish to check for an update manually, please see the instructions for your product below:


GRAMMARLY'S DESKTOP APP FOR WINDOWS:


Launch the app and then press Alt, after which you'll see a dropdown menu. Then, please click Help and select Check for Update from the dropdown list.



GRAMMARLY'S DESKTOP APP FOR MAC:


Launch the app and click Check for Update:


​


MS OFFICE ADD-IN FOR WINDOWS:


Navigate to the Grammarly tab in Word, click Settings, then choose Check for updates.



GRAMMARLY'S BROWSER EXTENSION:


Grammarly for Safari is updated automatically. Ensure "Automatically update extensions from the Safari Extensions Gallery" is enabled in Safari > Preferences > Extensions.


Grammarly for Chrome is updated automatically.

If you would like to update all extensions you have, go to chrome:extensions, enable the Developer mode and click Update.


Grammarly for Firefox is updated automatically. To check for updates, paste about:addons into your address line, click on the gear button > Check for Updates. Afterward, please click on Grammarly for Firefox in the list of your extensions, and make sure settings for Automatic Updates are set to default (radio button) and enabled to make sure ​Grammarly for Firefox is updated automatically in future.


I hope this helps, but please let us know how we can assist you further. And have a great day!


Sincerely,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

information addin desktop browser_plugin, information_how_to_update_all_products

Information::How To::Use Editor w/out Installing the ExtensionHi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, That's a great question! Using the Grammarly Editor in Chrome, Safari, and Firefox without installing the extension is possible. You’ll need to register an account by following a couple of simple steps: 1) Go to https://www.grammarly.com/signup/ 2) Enter your name, email address, and preferred password. 3) Click Continue to Grammarly. 4) Enjoy using Grammarly! Please let me know if you need any further assistance. And have a great day! Regards, {{ticket.assignee.first_name}}information_how_to_use_editor_without_installing_the_extension online_editor, information
Information::How To::Use G Free of Charge

Hi {{ticket.requester.name}},


I’m really glad you reached out!


All you need to do to be able to use Grammarly free of charge is to install our free Grammarly browser extension for your favorite browser -- Chrome, Safari, Firefox, or Edge. Please follow the instructions in the relevant section of this article.


Once you have downloaded and installed the Grammarly extension, you should be able to use Grammarly wherever you write online.


Anytime you are writing in a comment field, Grammarly flags potential mistakes and allows you to review them one by one (by hovering your mouse over the text) or all at once (by opening a pop-up window).


Simply click on the "G" button in the bottom right-hand corner of a text field, and Grammarly will show mistakes in the Editor window that opens automatically. Also, you can hover over a highlighted mistake and apply a correction suggested by Grammarly on the card that will appear. Finally, you can log in to your account at https://app.grammarly.com/ and proofread your writing by copying or uploading your text to the online Grammarly Editor.


To learn more about how the Grammarly Editor works, simply check this article we've created for you.


To find out more about all Grammarly products, please check this article.


Please keep in touch, and let us know how we can assist you further.


Sincerely,

{{ticket.assignee.name}}


information_how_to_use_g_free_of_charge, information

Information::Ticket Set to Solved/Closed - Explain WhyHi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, I apologize for the confusion about closing your ticket! The short answer is that we tentatively set tickets on the subject you asked about to “resolved” after we give you all the available information about your question. However, if you have further questions, you can always reopen the ticket by reaching back out to us. Here is a proper explanation of why we close such tickets: In cases when Grammarly Support cannot directly resolve a technical matter (or a feature request), and we don’t have a timeline from our product team for when the issue will be fixed, we first make sure that our product team logs the issue, and then we notify the customer and tentatively close the ticket. The reason we don’t leave the ticket open is that it may lead customers to believe that we will have more updates for them in the near future, and we don’t want to set false expectations. We constantly evaluate the issues and priorities on our log, and I have passed your request along to our product team. You can always reopen this ticket by sending a message to this thread. We are here to help! I hope this clarifies the matter, and we once again apologize for any confusion. Sincerely, {{ticket.assignee.name}}information_explain_why_ticket_was_marked_solved, information
Information::Track Changes/Revisions No Longer Show (Explain)

Hello {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for reaching out! I'm happy to assist you today.


Please note that the feature in question has been disabled as a part of our recent product update. However, we appreciate your letting us know that it was something you found useful. I’ve shared your comments with our development team, and while I can’t provide an exact time frame for resolution, you can rest assured that they will take your comments into account when making development plans for the future.


Please do not hesitate to contact us with any questions or concerns you might have. We are committed to making your experience at Grammarly pleasant and rewarding.


Sincerely,

{{ticket.assignee.name}}

information information_track_changes_revisions_no_longer_show_explain
Information::Will G Help with My CV/Resume?

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for reaching out!


Our goal is to ensure that your document is grammatically accurate. Grammarly reviews each submission for errors in grammar, spelling, punctuation, and form. Please note, our Editor does not organize, restructure, or otherwise rewrite your text. Issues regarding content remain at the discretion of the author.

You can change your document type by clicking Start Assistant (or Correct with Assistant)> Set Goals > Domain and choosing Business:



You can also get customized suggestions by selecting the Intent, Audience, Style, and Emotion of your resume.

Additionally, you may find these articles useful:

https://www.grammarly.com/blog/grammarly-glassdoor-resume-tips/

https://www.grammarly.com/blog/resume-length-2/


Kind regards,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

information online_editor desktop, information_will_g_help_check_cv_or_resume

* APPLY THE MACRO, SAVE THE PDF OF THE TICKET AND FORWARD AS PER THE MACRO DESCRIPTION



Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for contacting Grammarly. We take such feedback very seriously.


We take great measures to ensure our ads do not run alongside offensive or sensitive content. Grammarly exists to empower effective communication that enables human connection. We would never knowingly associate ourselves with videos or sites that promote discrimination or hate.


We will investigate this case and disable our advertisements for this YouTube channel if it promotes discrimination.


Thank you again for reporting this to us, and we hope we addressed your concern.


Best wishes,

Marketing::Gmail Ads Confused with Emails

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for your message!


First, let me note that because the email address {{ticket.requester.email}} isn't registered with Grammarly, it appears that you might have confused Gmail advertisements with emails from us. We assure you that Grammarly hasn't been sending any emails to {{ticket.requester.email}} recently.


For your reference, Grammarly does not control the ads showing in your browser. However, as your browser collects your browsing information while you're surfing the web, it might identify your search history as such that points to your possible interest in our services, showing you our advertisements as a result. You can learn more about web advertising here: http://computer.howstuffworks.com/advertiser-custom-ads2.htm


If you'd like to block advertisements from Grammarly, please do the following:


1. Open the Grammarly advertisement in Gmail


2. Click the "i" icon next to the Ad sign in the Subject field:



3. Select Control ads like this, then click Block this advertiser:



You're welcome to review this article for more information on Google ads: https://gram.ly/cbbHSNt


Kind regards,


{{ticket.assignee.first_name}}

marketing_gmail_ads_confused_with_emails, donotsurvey marketing

Marketing::Racial/Sensitive Issue with G Advertisement

PLEASE CHECK THE MACRO DESCRIPTION FIRST.


Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for reaching out to Grammarly to express your concern about our advertisement. We take such feedback very seriously.

Grammarly exists to empower effective communication for everyone looking to write better in English. This includes professionals and students from all over the world — whether native or non-native English speakers. As such, our advertisements seek to reflect this diverse population and the millions of people who use our product every day. We have a variety of ads that are currently running, and these ads feature people of various races and genders.

We hope this provides some clarity and addresses your concern. We will certainly keep your feedback in mind going forward as we develop our ads.


OR, A SLIGHTLY DIFFERENT VERSION FOR AGGRESSIVE ACCUSATIONS:

Thank you for reaching out to Grammarly to express your concern about our advertisement. We take such feedback very seriously.

Grammarly exists to empower effective communication for everyone looking to write better in English. This includes professionals and students from all over the world — whether native or non-native English speakers. As such, our advertisements seek to reflect this diverse population and the millions of people who use our product every day. The ad you’ve highlighted is one of many Grammarly ads that are currently running, which feature men and women of various races.

Grammarly is a company founded by immigrants, and we do not tolerate discrimination of any kind. That includes racism and anti-immigrant sentiments.

We hope this provides some clarity and addresses your concern.



Best wishes,


{{ticket.assignee.first_name}}

marketing_racial_or_otherwise_sensitive_issue_with_our_ads, donotsurvey marketing

Marketing::ShakesPeer Confusion

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for contacting Grammarly!


ShakesPeer is the name of a fictional company that the jobseeker in the ad is applying to. Many of us here at Grammarly are Shakespeare fans (and we know lots of our users are, too), so we chose the sound-alike name ShakesPeer to show our appreciation.

I hope that clarifies the matter! Please feel free to reach out with any further questions or concerns.


Best wishes,


{{ticket.assignee.first_name}}

marketing_ads_shakespeer_confusion, marketing
Marketing::Subscriber ExactTarget Status is Held/Error 180008Hey {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thanks for reaching out! To resolve the issue, we suggest you search your inbox/spam folder for any previous emails from Grammarly, open one of them, and click any link in the email. You will also need to add info@send.grammarly.com and donotreply@grammarly.com to your contact list. If this doesn't help, we suggest that you ask your IT team to whitelist the following IPs: 13.111.6.89 199.122.124.187 Please also check that your inbox wasn't full and that your mail provider wasn't temporarily disabled. If there's anything else we can do for you, please let us know. Kindly, {{ticket.assignee.name}}marketing, marketing_subscriber_exacttarget_status_is_held_error_180008

User is SUBSCRIBED to receiving Weekly Progress Reports. 2. The status in Adminka is not HELD. 3. I checked Bounce in the Subscriber Lookup Tool using the user's email address. 4. I confirm that the last Weekly Report was not sent to this user within the last month or ever. 5. The user shows activity. 6. The user has opened emails from Grammarly in the last 30 days. 7. Marketing::Transactional Email Status: "ERROR" - Assign to Digital Additive Experts

Transactional email status - "ERROR".

assign_to_outside marketing_transactional_email_status_error_assign_to_outside_digital_additive marketing
Marketing::Unwanted Advertising Follows Me

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for contacting Grammarly. I understand your frustration, but let me take a moment to clarify this.


Please note that Grammarly does not control the ads showing in your browser. However, as your browser collects your browsing information while you're surfing the web, it might identify your search history as such that points to your possible interest in our services, showing you our advertisements as a result. You can learn more about web advertising here: http://computer.howstuffworks.com/advertiser-custom-ads2.htm. You can also opt out of interest-based targeting provided by participating ad servers through the Digital Advertising Alliance (http://youradchoices.com).


If you normally use Google as your main search engine, you might find this article useful for hiding the advertisements you don't want to see: https://support.google.com/ads/answer/2662850?hl=en.


Some customers have also complained about our ads showing as unskippable. We are working with YouTube to fix this problem.


We apologize for any inconvenience you may have experienced while we’re working to fix this. It’s never our intention to cause any frustration, and we’ll make sure the advertisement mechanisms in question are a better use of your time. Thank you for helping us improve here. There’s nothing like user feedback to help us get a better picture of what our customers need.


I hope this clarifies the matter, but please don't hesitate to reach out with any further questions or comments.


Best wishes,


{{ticket.assignee.first_name}}

marketing_unwanted_ads, donotsurvey marketing
Marketing::Unwanted Advertising Pops Up on Mobile (Liftoff - GAID/IDFA)

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for contacting Grammarly! I'm happy to assist you in getting this resolved.


Could you please provide us with your GAID (Google Advertising ID)? We'll need this information to block your device for our advertisements.


To find your GAID, open the Google Settings app on your Android device and click on “Ads.” Your Advertising Identifier will be listed at the bottom of the screen.


OR


Could you please provide us with your IDFA (Apple Identifier for Advertisers)? We'll need this information to block your device for our advertisements.


Thank you for your time and help!


Best wishes,


{{ticket.assignee.first_name}}

marketing_unwanted_ads_popup_on_mobile_liftoff, marketing

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},

If you'd like to disable the Grammarly Keyboard on Android, please follow these steps:


1) Open Settings on your Android device.

2) Go to Language and Input > Keyboards > Manage Keyboards > Switch Grammarly off.

Mobile Keyboard::Android::How to Enable Voice Typing/Dictation

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for contacting Grammarly! I'm happy to help you today.


To enable voice typing, please follow these steps:

1. Open Settings, and go to System

2. In the menu that appears, choose Language & Input, and select Virtual Keyboards

3. Click Manage Keyboards, and enable Google voice typing

I hope this helps! Should you need any further assistance, just let me know.

Best wishes,

{{ticket.assignee.name}}

Mobile Keyboard::Android::How to InstallHi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thanks for contacting Grammarly! I'm happy to help you today. To begin the installation, open Google Play Store on your Android device, then download the app onto your device. If you already have a Grammarly account, choose Log In and enter your login information. If not – create a Grammarly account. Next, follow the installation instructions: 1) Tap on the "Enable in Settings" button 2) Switch the Grammarly Keyboard to "On" 3) Tap "Switch Input Methods" 4) Select the "Grammarly" Keyboard 5) Go to any app and tap on any text field If you don’t yet see a green Grammarly logo in the top left corner of the app, tap on the globe icon on your keyboard and select the Grammarly Keyboard. We hope you'll love it! If you have any questions or comments, please let us know -- we're here to help! Sincerely, {{ticket.assignee.name}}mobile_keyboard_android_how_to_install, mobile_keyboard
Mobile Keyboard::Android::How to Reinstall

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for contacting Grammarly! I'm happy to help you today.

We recommend that you reinstall the Grammarly Keyboard for Android by following the steps below:

1. Uninstall your current version of the Grammarly Keyboard

2. Open Google Play Store on your Android device and download the app onto your device

3. Choose Log In

4. Next, follow these installation instructions:

Tap on the "Enable in Settings" button
Switch the Grammarly Keyboard to "On"
Tap "Switch Input Methods"
Select the "Grammarly" Keyboard
Go to any app and tap on any text field

If you don’t yet see a green Grammarly logo in the top left corner of the app, tap on the globe icon on your keyboard and select the Grammarly Keyboard.

If you have any questions or comments, please let us know — we're here to help!


Sincerely,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

Mobile Keyboard::Android::Unlock Notification

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for contacting Grammarly! I'm happy to assist you today.


The message about unlocking your phone is standard for Android. Android prompts all users to unlock their device after each restart; this message is not related to Grammarly, and our keyboard does not unlock any OS settings.

Mobile Keyboard::iOS::Emoji on iOS

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for contacting Grammarly! I'm happy to assist you today.


To access emoji when using the Grammarly Keyboard for iOS, please ensure you're using the latest version of this product. That's just a couple of simple steps:


1. Uninstall your current version of the Grammarly Keyboard


2. Open the App Store on your iOS device, search for "Grammarly Keyboard" and download the app onto your device


3. Choose Log In


4. Next, follow these steps to set up the Grammarly Keyboard on your device:


  • Tap the "Add Grammarly Keyboard" button
  • Tap "Add new keyboard…"
  • Tap "Grammarly"
  • Tap "Grammarly" again
  • Toggle the "Allow Full Access" switch on
  • Go to any app and tap on any text field


Note: If you don’t see a green Grammarly logo in the top left corner of your keyboard after following the instructions, tap on the globe icon.


Hope that helps!


Sincerely,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

mobile_keyboard_ios_emoji development, mobile_keyboard ios
Mobile Keyboard::iOS::Fingerprint Touch IssueHi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thanks for contacting Grammarly! I'm happy to help you today. To resolve the issue, we recommend that you restart your device and try again. If that doesn't help, please temporarily switch off the fingerprint option for iTunes and App Store by going to Settings > Touch ID & Passcode > Enter the passcode > Disable the "Use touch ID for: iTunes and App Store. If the issue persists after following these steps, could you please tell whether you're able to download any other apps? Thank you and many apologies for the inconvenience, {{ticket.assignee.name}}mobile_keyboard_ios_fingerprint_touch_issue, mobile_keyboard development ios
Mobile Keyboard::iOS::How to Disable KeyboardHi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thanks for contacting Grammarly! I'm sorry that Grammarly did not perform as expected for you. The Grammarly Keyboard makes sure everything you write is mistake-free. If you don’t like the absence of features like predictive typing, you can easily switch to the native iOS keyboard by tapping the globe icon in the bottom left corner of your keyboard. Should you need to check your text, simply tap the globe icon again and the Grammarly keyboard will appear. If you'd still like to disable Grammarly for iOS, please follow these steps: Open Settings on your iOS device Go to General > Keyboard > Keyboards > Edit > Delete Grammarly > Done. We hope to see you back soon! Sincerely, {{ticket.assignee.name}}mobile_keyboard_how_to_disable_on_ios, mobile_keyboard

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for contacting Grammarly! I'm happy to help you today.


We recommend that you reinstall the Grammarly Keyboard for iOS by following the steps below:


1. Uninstall your current version of the Grammarly Keyboard


2. Open the App Store on your iOS device, search for "Grammarly Keyboard" and download the app onto your device.


3. Choose Log In.


4. Next, follow these steps to set up the Grammarly Keyboard on your device:


  • Tap the "Add Grammarly Keyboard" button
  • Tap "Add new keyboard…"
  • Tap "Grammarly"
  • Tap "Grammarly" again
  • Toggle the "Allow Full Access" switch
  • Go to any app and tap on any text field

Mobile Keyboard::iOS::More Information (Request) - Video

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for contacting Grammarly! I'm sorry that you're experiencing this issue.


I'd like to get additional information from you to help the development team investigate this case more thoroughly.


Could you please record a video showing the issue you're experiencing?


To record a video on an iPhone, please follow these instructions:


  1. Open Settings and tap on Control Center > Customize Controls.
  2. Find 'Screen Recording' in the list and tap on the + button beside it.
  3. Once added you can leave Control Center.
  4. Now if you swipe up from the bottom of the display to access the Control Center, you will see the new Screen Recording button appear (it's a circle with a dot inside it).
  5. Tap the recording icon to start the screen recording.
  6. Following a three-second countdown, everything on-screen will be recorded.
  7. While you are recording there will be a red bar at the top of the screen.
  8. When you have finished recording tap on the red bar (or if that doesn't register, swipe up and then press the Record button in Control Center again).
  9. Tap on Stop.
  10. Your screen Recording video will be saved in Photos, where you can edit the video if you wish.


Please provide us with the video, and I'll forward it to our development team.


Thank you for your time and help,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

mobile_keyboard_more_information_request_a_video_ios, mobile_keyboard development development_request_more_information ios

Proofit::About Proofit

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


I’m so glad you asked about Grammarly’s proofreading service for Premium subscribers.


You can save precious writing time by submitting your text to our proofreaders. They’ll review the entire document for errors and will apply corrections automatically. Please note that our proofreaders only correct grammar and spelling issues.


To submit your document for proofreading, select the Human Proofreading option in the lower right corner of the page:




Current turnaround time options are Instant (within 30 minutes), 3-hour, and 24-hour.


To provide the best service possible, we may occasionally adjust our prices and pricing models to find the optimum balance between cost, quality, and efficiency. You will see the per-word and total price for each job every time before you order.


Please feel free to contact me with any further questions. And have a great day!


Best regards,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

proofit, information, about_proofit
Proofit::Added/Optional ServiceHi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thanks for your interest in Grammarly's proofreading service! Your Grammarly Premium subscription provides full access to our industry-leading grammar- and spell-checking software and our plagiarism checker. Human Proofreading, however, is an optional service that is provided separately from your Grammarly subscription. If you use Human Proofreading, our professional proofreaders will review your document and correct spelling, grammar, and punctuation errors. Charges are assessed per word in your text. I hope this clarifies the issue for you, but I am happy to answer any other questions you may have. Sincerely, {{ticket.assignee.name}}Proofit_added_service, proofit

I have forwarded your email to the corresponding department. They will get back to you on this within 24 hours. Thank you for your patience!proofit_another_order-related_complaint_assign_to_hailey_or_chris, proofit assign_to_outside

Our proofreaders are currently working on it. Please expect the order to be completed according to the turnaround option you chose when submitting the order. Thank you for your patience, and please let us know if you have any other questions or concerns. Sincerely, {{ticket.assignee.name}}proofit_are_you_working_on_my_order_explain, proofit
Proofit::British English RequestHi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thanks for contacting Grammarly! I'm happy to answer this for you. Please note that American English is our standard for proofreading, but we will try to apply British standards if it's clear that the document is in British English. I hope this clarifies the matter for you, but please feel free to contact us with any further questions. Sincerely, {{ticket.assignee.name}}proofit_british_english_request, proofit
Proofit::Cannot View Track Changes/Applied Edits in MS Word

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for contacting Grammarly! I'm happy to assist you today.


Please make sure that you are using the full version of Microsoft Word, not Word Starter. If you are using the full version, and you have the Windows operating system, please do the following:


1) Go to the "Review" tab in your Microsoft Word document.

2) Click on the "Show Markup" box. You may select either the “Original” (your text) or “Final” (corrected text) version.

3) Make sure that all the options have a check mark next to them. If not, enable them by clicking these options.


If the comments are still not showing up, please follow these instructions:


1) Go to the main menu in your Word file (button in top left corner).

2) Click on the “Word Options” button at the bottom of the menu.

3) Click on the “Trust Center” category.

4) Click “Trust Center Settings”.

5) In the “Privacy Options” category, make sure there is a check mark next to "Make hidden markup visible when opening or saving" and click “OK” twice.


Note: In case you're viewing your proofread document in the Protected View mode, click Enable Editing to view the applied edits. You're welcome to check this article for mode details on this:


https://support.office.com/en-us/article/what-is-protected-view-d6f09ac7-e6b9-4495-8e43-2bbcdbcb6653


Please feel free to contact us with any further questions or concerns you may have. We are committed to making your experience at Grammarly pleasant and rewarding.


Best wishes,


{{ticket.assignee.first_name}}

Proofit_cannot_view_changes, proofit
Proofit::Current PricingDELETE AFTER CHECKING: https://proofit.grammarly.io/admin/settings/ Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thanks for reaching out. I’m happy to answer this for you! Current pricing for Human Proofreading is as follows: Instant – $___ per word 3 hours – $___ per word 24 hours – $___ per word Please note, to provide the best service possible, we may occasionally adjust our prices and pricing models to find the optimum balance between cost, quality, and efficiency. You will see the price for each job, every time, before you order. Please keep in touch and let us know how we can assist you further. Sincerely, {{ticket.assignee.name}}proofit, information, proofit_current_pricing
Proofit::Explain Charges (Clarify If Unauthorized)

* Use this macro only if the usage locations in Gnar do not show any conclusive patterns of unauthorized access.



Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for contacting Grammarly! My name is {{ticket.assignee.name}}, and I'm happy to assist you today.


According to our analysis, a proofreading order, #____, was submitted using your Grammarly account {{ticket.requester.email}} on ____.

If you didn't submit this order, please let me know and I'll proceed accordingly.

{{ticket.assignee.first_name}}

proofit_explain_charges_clarify_if_unauthorized, billing proofit
Proofit::Grammarly vs Proofit (Differences)

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for contacting Grammarly!


In general, there are four major areas that we aim to resolve in the Human Proofreading service: spelling, grammar, punctuation, and sentence structure. I'll provide a brief example of each topic to help illustrate what we do.

Spelling includes catching typos or confused words such as "advice" vs. "advise." Grammar includes ensuring that all sentences are grammatically accurate—for example, saying "the staff is happy" instead of "the staff are happy" for certain dialects. Punctuation includes choosing the right marks to add to the appropriate places within the sentence, such as a semicolon vs. a comma. And sentence structure includes ensuring that the internal logic and fluency of each sentence.

Furthermore, there are several benefits to choosing Human Proofreading. First, when using our service, you'll save time that you'd normally have to spend analyzing all the changes the Grammarly software suggests. Second, your work will be reviewed by our team of experts, who have a great deal of experience working with all sorts of texts, and who have the ability to connect with their colleagues to improve the quality of the document. Third, we're extremely passionate about helping others improve their writing, and we love to bring our enthusiasm for language to our clients.

Also, it's worth noting that, due to the inherent subjectivity of the English language, every proofreader will approach every document a little differently, but we're always careful to make and review all of our changes to ensure accuracy and proofreading excellence.

We hope that this added context helps you distinguish between the two services! Thank you for your time and consideration.


Kind regards,

{{ticket.assignee.name}}

proofit_grammarly_vs_proofit_differences, proofit
Proofit::How To::Submit Long Manuscripts

Hey {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


My name is {{ticket.assignee.name}}, and I’m happy to answer your questions about our Human Proofreading service.


Submitting your text for proofreading is easy: open the document you want to have proofread and click the Human Proofreading button in the lower right corner indicated in the screenshot below:


​


We can process any text document through our system. However, your text may need to be submitted in pieces to meet our size limitations (no more than 60 pages at a time). For longer documents, the service can become costly. Current turnaround time options are Instant (within 30 minutes), 3-hour, and 24-hour.


Note: You need to have a Grammarly Premium subscription to use our human proofreading service.


Please let me know if you have additional questions or concerns.


Sincerely,

{{ticket.assignee.name}}

proofit, information, proofit_how_to_submit_long_manuscripts
Proofit::How To::Submit Order in Denali

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for reaching out! I'm happy to assist you today.


Submitting your text for proofreading is easy: open the document you want to have proofread and click the Human Proofreading button in the lower right corner indicated in the screenshot below:


​


Note: Our proofreaders correct grammar and spelling issues only. We do not rewrite or reorganize your paper to make it more accurate or convincing, and we attempt to keep the original meaning of the sentence and document fully intact.


Please feel free to reach out for any further assistance. We're here to help!


Sincerely,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

proofit, information, proofit_how_to_submit_order_in_denali

Proofit::Limitations - We Don’t RewriteHi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thanks for contacting Grammarly! I'm happy to assist you today. Our proofreaders review and correct your document for all mistakes in spelling, grammar, and punctuation. We will rewrite sentences if they need to be changed to conform to English rules of grammar and syntax. However, editing is confined to clear errors; we do not rewrite or reorganize your paper to make it more accurate or convincing, and we attempt to keep the original meaning of the sentence and document fully intact. I hope that this clarifies the matter for you and I thank you for your patience. Please let me know if you have any further questions or concerns. Best wishes, {{ticket.assignee.name}}proofit_limitations_we_dont_rewrite, proofit

Proofit::Order Canceled - Explain and Refer to Other Service

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


We apologize for the inconvenience. The message you received was generated automatically because our proofreader determined that it was not possible or practical to make changes to your document. In accordance with our service's criteria, proofreaders may cancel jobs that are translated or difficult to understand for a variety of reasons. If you still need editing services, we recommend that you find another professional with whom you can work individually to address the specific concerns unique to your text.


Your funds should be released and available to you soon. When you review your updated credit card statement, you will find that there is no settled payment for Grammarly. Please let me know if you have any further questions or concerns.


You can review this article to learn more about our submission standards: https://support.grammarly.com/hc/en-us/articles/360024803951


We thank you for taking the time to review our submission standards and look forward to reviewing and improving your documents in the future!


Best wishes,

{{ticket.assignee.name}}

proofit_order_canceled_explain_and_refer_to_other_service, proofit

Proofit::Price Change Based on Demand - 2Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thank you for expressing your concerns. Because of the popularity of our Human Proofreading service, we face a choice about how to deal with periods of extreme demand. While we are working to increase supply by hiring more editors, demand can still outpace supply at times. In those cases, we have to keep the order volume low enough to serve all of the customers who have already submitted their text. Otherwise, we won’t be able to return the corrected documents on time, and the service will be broken. One way to deal with this issue is to turn off the service – i.e., prevent anyone from ordering Human Proofreading. This can happen on occasion when it becomes impossible for us to complete all orders on time. Another way to balance demand is to increase prices. That way, the service is at least still available for some users. We would rather keep the service running at a higher cost than turn it off altogether, which is why you see price increases. This allows us to serve as many customers as we can while maintaining our standards for quality and punctuality. We understand that our approach necessarily limits the availability of our service to some people. Unfortunately, we have no universal remedy to address this problem. Prices follow demand, so if you wait, you are likely to see a decrease. We are sorry for the inconvenience, but we hope to have the opportunity to serve you again in the future. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us. Best regards, {{ticket.assignee.first_name}}proofit, price_change_proofit_second_request
Proofit::Price Change Based on Demand 1Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thanks for your inquiry. Our Human Proofreading service has become extremely popular, so in order to handle the demand while providing the best quality to the most customers possible, we have temporarily increased the price of our service. Please keep in mind that prices fluctuate according to demand and that both per-word and total prices are always shown before you submit your order. We appreciate your interest and are working tirelessly to increase our capacity. Please let us know if you have any additional questions, and thanks for your support. Best regards, {{ticket.assignee.first_name}}proofit, price_change_proofit

I am sorry to hear that you are not satisfied with your order. As a courtesy, we’ve refunded your payment. Please look for these funds to appear on your statement within the next 10 business days, depending on your payment method. For future reference, our goal is simply to ensure that your document is correctly written and grammatically accurate. We thoroughly review each document for errors in grammar, spelling, punctuation, and form. However, some issues identified by Grammarly, such as the use of passive voice or personal pronouns, are a matter of choice for the author. These issues are not necessarily errors; consequently, they may remain unchanged in your final document. I hope this clarifies the issue, and I thank you for your patience. You can email this file to us directly, and we will return the edited version free of charge as soon as possible. Many apologies for the inconvenience, and thank you for your patience. Proofit::Refund - Lost Formatting (User Error)Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thanks for contacting Grammarly Customer Support! I'm very sorry to hear that you're not satisfied with your order. <<>> For your reference, Grammarly converts your document to plain text if you copy and paste from another text field, which means all the formatting in your original document will be lost. Any text that is copied and pasted into the Editor before being sent for professional proofreading will be sent as is (i.e., without formatting). To retain the original formatting of the document, please use the Upload (Import) and Download (Export) buttons to check documents that have been written in other text editors like MS Word, TextEdit, or OpenOffice. This will allow our proofreaders to edit and return your document with the original formatting intact. I hope this clarifies the issue for you, but do not hesitate to contact me if you have any further questions or concerns. Thank you for your patience. Sincerely, {{ticket.assignee.name}}proofit_refund_lost_formatting_user_error, proofit

We were sorry to learn that you were not notified about the order completion due to a technical error. Our records show that your order was completed on time. However, the document is still marked as being proofread in your account. I have reported this to the development team. They are working to resolve this as quickly as possible.


To compensate for the inconvenience, we've refunded your payment for this order. Please note that it may take up to 10 business days for the refund to appear on your credit card statement, depending on your bank. If you paid with PayPal, the refund should post to your account within a maximum period of 5 business days.


I'll also be happy to send you the completed order. To enable me to proceed, I need some additional information from you to confirm that you are the owner of the account currently associated with {{ticket.requester.email}}. Please provide the following details about your submitted order:


  • the charge amount
  • the document title
  • the first sentence of the text sent for proofreading


I know this process is a hassle, but this security procedure allows us to protect your document from unauthorized access.

For your reference, our goal is to ensure that your document is grammatically accurate. We diligently review each submission for errors in grammar, spelling, punctuation, and form. However, our proofreaders do not organize, structure, or otherwise rewrite your text. Issues regarding content, style, or voice are at the discretion of the author. Proofit::Refund Denied (Although Asked Twice)

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for your message.


Unfortunately, we are unable to provide a refund if the following two conditions are met: An order is submitted and processed by our team, and the refund request is submitted after the order completion.

In the future, if you place an order mistakenly, it is vital to contact us as soon as possible (so that we don't work on the job unnecessarily) and to avoid downloading the revised document. As we're sure you can understand, it is impossible for us to process a claim if the document has been submitted and proofread without any intervention on the customer's part.

If you have any questions about this protocol, please do not hesitate to contact us again.

Best wishes,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

proofit_refund_denied_although_asked_twice, proofit

Thank you for contacting Grammarly.


According to our analysis, you submitted a refund request after your proofreading order was completed. For this reason, we're unable to refund your payment.


You're welcome to review this article for more information about Human Proofreading and our policy regarding order cancellation requests:


https://support.grammarly.com/hc/en-us/articles/360029743831


If you have any other questions or requests regarding your order, please let us know.

Proofit::Refund Fraudulent Order (Identity Theft)

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


My name is {{ticket.assignee.first_name}}, and I'm happy to assist you today.


A proofreading order, #____, was submitted from your Grammarly account, {{ticket.requester.email}}, on ___.


Per your request, I have canceled the fraudulent order and refunded the payment.


Please note that it may take up to 10 business days for the refund to appear on your credit card statement, depending upon your bank's protocol. If you paid with PayPal, the refund should post to your account within 5 business days.


We have disabled the Human Proofreading service for your account under {{ticket.requester.email}} until further notice from you. Please update your Grammarly password as soon as possible to protect yourself more reliably against identity theft. You can also find some tips on how to keep your account secure here.


Please let us know whether you require any further assistance, and we will do our best to help you in a timely fashion.


Sincerely,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

Proofit::Refund Fraudulent Order(s) Over $300 - Step 1: Forward to Hailey/Chris

If one order or several orders exceed $300 USD in total, report to #proofit tagging Hailey+Chris and using the following templated structure:



  1. Specify the user ID and the charge amount(s) for our reference.
  2. Provide the link to the ticket
  3. Does the account show unusual locations over the period when the orders were submitted? - Yes / No
  4. If yes, provide a screenshot showing locations on the date(s) the orders were submitted.

Proofit::Request to Send Order (Can't Verify Identity - Ask Again)

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for getting back to us.


Unfortunately, the information you provided doesn't match this proofreading order. Could you double-check the title and the first sentence for me?


Alternatively, you can provide this information to verify that you are the owner of the payment method used to submit the proofreading order:

- last four digits of the credit card number used to submit the order
- card network type (e.g., VISA)
- credit card expiration date (month/year)
- the reference number on your statement, if you see one (it should look similar to CO5DXT-8GCH, CO*5DXT-8GCH, or 5DXT-8GCH)
- if you are seeing "PAYPAL" next to the charge on your credit card statement, we will need to know your PayPal email and Transaction ID.

Thank you for your time and help,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

proofit_request_to_send_order_cant_verify_identity_ask_again, proofit
Proofit::Request to Send Order (Decline - Document Deleted from Editor)

Proofit::Thinks the Proofread Order Was Not Changed | Hailey/Chris

DO NOT APPLY - FOR HAILEY/CHRIS TO USE.


Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for contacting Grammarly Customer Support! My name is {{ticket.assignee.name}}, and I am happy to look into this for you.


I see that your document has been proofread and contains multiple edits. The proofread document should be available to you in the Grammarly Editor at https://app.grammarly.com or in the native (desktop) app. Alternatively, you can check your spam folder in case your order went there by mistake.

Note:


  • We suggest that you open your document using a text editor like MS Word to see the corrections applied by our proofreaders.

  • To see the edits applied by our proofreaders, please download your document using the link provided in the completion email you received. It’s also possible to download your document from the Grammarly Editor, but please note that if you use this method, you won’t be able to see our proofreaders’ corrections visibly tracked in the document.


If there's anything else we can do for you, please let us know.


Kindly,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

proofit_user_thinks_document_was_not_changed, proofit
Proofit::Unable to Submit Order (TS-2322) - Solution #1Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thanks for your message! I'm sorry to hear about this. We suggest that you try submitting the order again in your browser's incognito mode or after re-logging in to your account. To open an incognito window in Chrome: 1. Open Chrome. 2. Select New Incognito Window. To open a private window in Firefox: 1. Go to Firefox Menu. 2. Select New Private Window To start private browsing in Internet Explorer: 1. Use the Ctrl+Shift+P shortcut key or 2. Click on Safety and select Private Browsing To open a private window in Safari: 1. Choose File 2. Select New Private Window Please let me know if this doesn't help, or if you have any further questions. Kindly, {{ticket.assignee.name}}proofit_unable_to_submit_order_ts2322_solution_1, proofit development
Proofit::Unavailable for Voucher Subscriptions (Explain)Hello {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thank you for contacting Grammarly! I'm happy to clarify this for you. Your Grammarly Premium subscription provides full access to our industry-leading grammar- and spell-checking software and our plagiarism checker. Human Proofreading, however, is an optional service that is provided separately from your Grammarly subscription. As there is no billing information available on your account associated with {{ticket.requester.email}}, the Human Proofreading service isn't available to you. We apologize for any confusion. I hope this clarifies the matter, but let me know if you have any additional comments. Kind regards, {{ticket.assignee.name}}proofit_for_voucher_subscriptions_no, information proofit
Security Experts::Account Hacked (Address After Investigation)Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thank you for your message. Currently, there is no indication that the Grammarly system was itself compromised or hacked. The fact that a person was able to log into your account indicates that they may have gotten your email address and password from another website that was compromised. If you have used your Grammarly password for any other websites, we strongly recommend changing your password on those sites as well. To prevent this type of issue from occurring in the future, please make sure to use complex passwords and don't reuse passwords across websites. Since our investigation indicates that your account was compromised for reasons outside of Grammarly's control, we can’t offer you any compensation. Kind regards, {{ticket.assignee.name}}security_experts_account_hacked_address_after_investigation, donotsurvey security_experts subscription
Security Experts::Account Hacked (Sent for Investigation)

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for alerting Grammarly. Our team is investigating what may have happened, and we'll get back to you as soon as we have an update.


In the meantime, we have initiated an email address change back to {{ticket.requester.email}}. To finalize this change, please follow the instructions below:


1. Check your email inbox under {{ticket.requester.email}} for the email change confirmation email titled "Please Confirm Your New Email Address"


2. Open the email and confirm the change by clicking the yellow "Confirm Change" button


3. Go to https://www.grammarly.com/resetpassword and send yourself a password reset email.


The email should arrive within about a minute and contain a link that will bring you to a page where you’ll be asked to create a new password. The link in the email expires after 72 hours. If the link in the email has expired, you can send yourself another password reset email.


4. Log in with {{ticket.requester.email}} at https://www.grammarly.com/signin


Note: You can view and recover any of your recently deleted documents by going to https://app.grammarly.com/documentVersionHistory while logged in to your Grammarly account. These documents are stored only temporarily so you can recover them if you need to before they are permanently deleted from our servers.


I hope this helps, but please don't hesitate to contact me with any further questions or requests. I'm here to help!


Kind regards,


{{ticket.assignee.first_name}}

security_experts_account_hacked_sent_for_investigation, donotsurvey security_experts subscription unauthorized_access security_experts_unauthorized_email_change_identity_verified

For additional peace of mind, we suggest that you change the email address associated with your account to the alternative one by going to https://account.grammarly.com/.

Security Experts::Assurance of Document Deletion

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for contacting Grammarly! I'm happy to assist you with your question.

Deleting your documents from the Grammarly Editor will permanently delete them from our systems.

Please note that, to help you in case of accidental document deletion, our systems temporarily store your recently deleted documents, as well as recent versions of documents so that you can recover them if you need to. You can view exactly which documents are stored on our servers at any time by accessing https://app.grammarly.com/documentVersionHistory while logged into your Grammarly account.


We hope that helps!

Security Experts::Can Employees View Content on Servers?

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for your question! We appreciate and respect the concern.


Grammarly takes your privacy seriously. We have implemented a number of protections to keep your information confidential.


No one at Grammarly can access your text and read it just for fun. Grammarly employees can only access your text under very specific circumstances — for example, if you experience a problem with your account and the only way for us to fix it is by accessing your documents in the Grammarly Editor.


For more information, please visit our Privacy Policy.


Thank you!

{{ticket.assignee.name}}

Security Experts::Concern About Unauthorized AccessHi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thank you for contacting Grammarly! I'm sorry to hear about this. If you see any documents that you don’t recognize, it is possible that there was unauthorized access. OR If you’re prompted to verify an account change, it’s possible that there was unauthorized access. To prevent unauthorized access to your account, we suggest that you change your Grammarly password. Changing your password will log out all devices that might be connected to your account. You can change your password at https://app.grammarly.com/profile/account. Make sure you set a complex new password that you don't use on any other websites. Additionally, if you have used your Grammarly password for any other websites, we strongly recommend changing your password on those sites as well. I hope this helps, but please keep in touch and let us know how we can assist you further. Regards, {{ticket.assignee.name}}security_experts_concern_about_unauthorized_access, general donotsurvey security_experts

According to our analysis, you've successfully changed the password for your account under {{ticket.requester.email}}. Changing your password will log out all devices that might be connected to your account.


Additionally, if you have used your Grammarly password for any other websites, we strongly recommend changing your password on those sites as well. To prevent this type of issue from occurring in the future, please make sure to use complex passwords and don't reuse passwords across websites.

security_experts_concern_about_unauthorized_access_social_signin, general donotsurvey security_experts
Security Experts::Content Ownership/CopyrightHello {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thanks for reaching out! I'm glad to hear that you are interested in using Grammarly. The Ownership section of the Terms of Service should address your concern. It states “All intellectual property rights in and to the User Content are and shall remain your property, and Grammarly shall acquire no right of ownership with respect to your User Content.” Here’s what that means: By using Grammarly, you are giving us the right to use your content in connection with providing our services. In other words, you’re giving us formal permission to provide writing suggestions and corrections to you and to use your writing to improve our algorithms. You remain the owner of your content. For example, if you write a novel while using Grammarly, the copyright remains under your control. That means that only you have the right to sell, publish, or distribute your novel. Best regards, {{ticket.assignee.name}}security_experts_content_ownership_copyright_concern, general security_experts donotsurvey

Security Experts::Data Processing Agreement/DPA Request

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for contacting Grammarly.


Grammarly, like many companies, has reviewed its approach to data protection and privacy compliance, and made the necessary adjustments to our products, policies, and procedures in order to comply with the GDPR.


Due to the nature of the services we provide, data protection authorities consider us to be a data controller because we take "essential" decisions about how to provide the service. This allows us to take responsibility for our compliance with the GDPR. As a data controller, we do not enter into separate data protection agreements with our users, whether individual or group accounts – we already commit to you that we will comply with our legal obligations.


We hope that helps.


Thanks,


{{ticket.assignee.first_name}}

donotsurvey security_experts_dpa_request, general security_experts
Security Experts::Data Processing in MS Word

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for your question.


As a Software-as-a-Service company, Grammarly provides our service by sending your text to our servers. Grammarly uses powerful algorithms based on machine learning to check your writing and provide suggestions and corrections. This is true when you use any of our products, including Grammarly for Microsoft Office. We don't store permutations of MS Word documents, but the text that you check using Grammarly is sent to our servers and processed according to our Privacy Policy and Terms of Service.


Kind regards,

{{ticket.assignee.first_name}}

security_experts_data_processing_in_ms_word, donotsurvey security_experts addin
Security Experts::Data Storage Question

Hello {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for your question!


After Grammarly processes your text to provide writing suggestions and corrections, the text on our servers is disassociated from your user account and deleted. De-identified, random samples of this text may be retained by Grammarly to help us improve the algorithms underlying our software and services.


Please note that if you have a Grammarly account and save a document in the Grammarly Editor, we’ll store the document until you choose to delete it. You can access all of your saved documents when you’re logged into your Grammarly account at https://app.grammarly.com.


For more information, please visit our Privacy Policy and Terms of Service.


Kindly,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

donotsurvey general security_experts, security_experts_data_storage_question
Security Experts::Does Grammarly Read Everything I Type?

Hello {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for your question! We appreciate and respect the concern.


Please rest assured that Grammarly can’t access anything you type unless you are actively using a Grammarly product, such as the browser extension. Our software doesn't check text if it's not actively being used. Additionally, Grammarly does not process anything you type in text fields marked "sensitive," such as credit card forms or password fields.


For more information, please visit our Privacy Policy and Terms of Service.


Thank you!


{{ticket.assignee.first_name}}

security_experts_does_grammarly_read_everything_i_type, general security_experts donotsurvey
Security Experts::EDU Admin's Access to User Content

* TO RUN BY AYAN/SENKA BEFORE SENDING. REMEMBER TO CHECK IF AN INSTITUTION IS K12 OR NOT.


Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for your question! We appreciate and respect the concern.


NON-K12:


Please rest assured that your content isn't available to your institution's account administrator(s). Similar to files you may have stored on your computer, your documents stored on Grammarly servers are private and not publicly accessible.


K12:


Your institution's account administrator(s) can only view a user’s content stored within their Grammarly account (i.e., documents saved in the Grammarly Editor) by submitting a request to Grammarly.


Please note that once your account downgrades to the free version, it will be disassociated from your organization's license. It will no longer be accessible by the administrator(s).


Kindly,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

security_experts_edu_admins_access_to_user_content, general security_experts donotsurvey edu
Security Experts::Explain How Data for Weekly Reports Is Collected

Hello {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for contacting Grammarly!


When you use Grammarly products, your text is sent to our servers so that we can provide our service to you. Grammarly uses powerful algorithms based on machine learning to check your writing and provide suggestions and corrections.

Grammarly also calculates the statistics you see in your Weekly Writing Update email, so that you can see your writing improvements over time. These calculations (such as a number of words written) remain linked to your account, but the text that you wrote does not (unless it is a document you’ve saved in the Grammarly Editor). This calculation is updated continuously throughout the week as you write more text with Grammarly.

I hope that helps!


Best regards,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

donotsurvey security_experts_how_weekly_reports_data_is_collected, general security_experts

However, our service does not conflict with the Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act's requirements. Security Experts::How long user info & texts are stored

Hello {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for your question!


When you create a Grammarly account, we collect some basic information from you, including your name and email address, as well as your answers to some optional questions about your English proficiency and your profession. We store this information until you delete your Grammarly account.


When it comes to text you write: After Grammarly processes your text to provide writing suggestions and corrections, the text on our servers is disassociated from your user account and deleted. De-identified, random samples of this text may be retained by Grammarly to help us improve the algorithms underlying our software and services.


If you have a Grammarly account and save a document in the Grammarly Editor, we’ll store the document until you choose to delete it. You can access all of your saved documents when you’re logged into your Grammarly account at https://app.grammarly.com.


For more information, please visit our Privacy Policy and Terms of Service.


Thank you!


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

security_experts_how_long_user_info_and_texts_are_stored, general donotsurvey security_experts

Grammarly does not store this information on our servers, and it’s not accessible within your account. We hope this addresses your concern! Kind regards, {{ticket.assignee.name}}security_experts_is_my_billing_info_safe_after_the_hack, donotsurvey security_experts
Security Experts::ISO 27001 Compliance

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for writing in today!


Grammarly is committed to protecting the security of your information and takes reasonable precautions to protect it. We are not ISO 27001 compliant at the moment, but we do follow industry-standard security and privacy practices, many of which are included in the ISO 27001 requirements. You can review our Privacy Policy and Terms of Service for additional details.


Regards,


{{ticket.assignee.first_name}}

Security Experts::Keystrokes Concern

Hello {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for your question! We appreciate and respect the concern.


Please note that Grammarly does not record every keystroke you make on your device. Grammarly accesses only the text you write using a Grammarly product, and only for the purposes of checking your text and providing corrections. Additionally, Grammarly is blocked from accessing anything you type in text fields marked "sensitive," such as credit card forms or password fields.


For more information, please visit our Privacy Policy and Terms of Service.


Thank you!


{{ticket.assignee.first_name}}

Security Experts::Law Enforcement-related Data ConcernHi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thank you for your question! Grammarly, and the data on Grammarly's servers, is subject to court orders, search warrants, subpoenas and legal process from courts with jurisdiction over Grammarly and its operation, as well as applicable laws and rules regarding user notification of law enforcement actions, just as any other business would be.
