Security Experts::Password Reset (Identity Verified) - Instructions

{{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for providing this information!


Per your request, we have initiated the email address change to ___________. To finalize this change, please follow the instructions below:


1. Check your email inbox under ___________ for the email change confirmation email titled Please Confirm Your New Email Address.
2. Open the email and confirm the change by clicking the yellow Confirm Change button


Then, to reset your password, send yourself a password reset email by going to https://www.grammarly.com/resetpassword. The email should arrive within about a minute and contain a link that will bring you to a page where you’ll be asked to create a new password. The link in the email expires after 72 hours. If the link in the email has expired, you can send yourself another password reset email.


I hope this helps, but please don't hesitate to contact me with any further questions or requests. I'm here to help!


Best wishes,


{{ticket.assignee.first_name}}

security_experts_password_reset_identity_verified_instructions, subscription security_experts
Security Experts::Payment Security

Hello {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for contacting Grammarly! I appreciate the opportunity to assist you with your questions.


Grammarly takes privacy seriously, which is why we are using PCI-compliant payment providers and fraud-detection software. This ensures secure and fast payments without the need to go through extra time-consuming security steps.


For more information, please check our Privacy Policy and Terms of Service.


Best regards,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

donotsurvey security_experts_payment_security, general security_experts
Security Experts::Permission to Read and Change All Data (Text Fields Concern)

Hello {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for your question! We appreciate and respect the concern.


Reading and changing data allows Grammarly to check your writing across different websites. We need to access your texts to provide the service of checking grammar, punctuation, style, and word usage. However, Grammarly does not process anything you type in text fields marked "sensitive," such as credit card forms or password fields.


For more information, please visit our Privacy Policy and Terms of Service.


Thank you!


{{ticket.assignee.first_name}}

Rest assured that Grammarly is blocked from accessing anything you type in text fields marked “sensitive,” such as password fields or credit card forms. Grammarly reads and corrects text only in message fields.

Security Experts::Privacy on Android Concern (Explain)

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for contacting Grammarly! Let me tackle this concern.


When you enable any third-party keyboard, Android displays a message that says the keyboard may be able to collect the text you type, including personal data like credit card numbers. We know that our users may (understandably) be concerned about this, so we want to provide some more detail about how we protect your privacy.


Android displays this message because it is technically possible for a third-party keyboard to collect sensitive information. However, we have blocked the Grammarly Keyboard from accessing anything you enter in fields marked “sensitive.” That includes credit card forms and password fields. We have also blocked the keyboard from accessing text you type into search fields, URL fields, or email address fields.


Kind regards,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

security_experts_privacy_on_android_concern, mobile_keyboard security_experts donotsurvey
Security Experts::Privacy on Mobile Keyboard (Undefined)

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for contacting Grammarly! Let me tackle this concern.


Although you see that notification whenever you enable a third-party keyboard on your mobile device, we have blocked the Grammarly Keyboard from accessing anything you enter in fields marked “sensitive.” That includes credit card forms and password fields. We have also blocked the keyboard from accessing text you type into search fields, URL fields, or email address fields, so in fact, the keyboard cannot transmit that information to Grammarly.


Hope that helps!


Kind regards,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

security_experts_privacy_on_mobile_keyboard_undefined, mobile_keyboard security_experts donotsurvey
Security Experts::Provide a List of Names Linked to CC (More Information)Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thanks for contacting Grammarly! I'm happy to assist you today. I understand that you would like to receive a list of all emails and names linked to the credit card number you've provided. As Grammarly takes the privacy of our users very seriously, we can partially provide the names of users linked to your payment method. I need some additional information from you to confirm that you are the owner of the payment method that was used: - last four digits of the credit card number that was used for Grammarly, - card network type (e.g., VISA) - credit card expiration date (month/year) - charge amount - the exact date of the payment - first name and last name (if any) on your Grammarly account - the reference number on your statement, if you see one (it should look similar to CO5DXT-8GCH, CO*5DXT-8GCH, or 5DXT-8GCH) - If you are seeing "PAYPAL" next to the charge on your credit card statement, we will need to know your PayPal email and Transaction ID I know this process is a hassle, but this security procedure allows us to protect our users from unauthorized access. Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for your message.

We may store customer service emails for up to three years, but document attachments, billing information, and screenshots are typically redacted or removed within 14 days after a support issue is resolved. The duration of storage will depend upon the content of the emails, such as whether there is a dispute about the user account. We will also delete most correspondence upon user request.

Security Experts::SOC-2 ComplianceHi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thank you for writing in today. I'm happy to answer this for you! Grammarly fully relies on Amazon Web Services for its hosting needs, and AWS SOC compliance reports are available here: https://aws.amazon.com/compliance/soc-faqs/ Grammarly has not obtained an SOC 2 certification independently from AWS. If you're also an AWS user, you can download Amazon's compliance reports by following the link provided. I hope this answers your question, but please feel free to reach out anytime. Regards, {{ticket.assignee.first_name}}security_experts_soc_2_compliance, general donotsurvey security_experts
Security Experts::Stored in the US

Hello {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for your question!


Grammarly data is stored on servers hosted by Amazon Web Services in the US.


Grammarly complies with the EU-US and the Swiss-US Privacy Shield Framework, which are recognized mechanisms for complying with EU and Swiss data protection requirements when transferring personal data from the European Union and Switzerland to the United States. You can find more information about this in our Privacy Policy: https://www.grammarly.com/privacy-policy#eu-us-and-swiss-us-privacy-shield


For more information, please visit our Privacy Policy and Terms of Service.


Thank you!


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

donotsurvey general security_experts, security_experts_stored_in_the_us
Security Experts::Text Sent to Servers

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for contacting Grammarly! I appreciate the opportunity to assist you with your questions.


When you use Grammarly products, your text is sent to our servers so that we can provide our service to you. Grammarly uses powerful algorithms based on machine learning to check your writing and provide suggestions and corrections. Without access to your text, there is no way for our products to provide feedback.


For more information, please visit our Privacy Policy and Terms of Service.


Kind regards,

{{ticket.assignee.first_name}}

Security Experts::Tips on Securing Account (KB Link) You can also find some tips on how to keep your account secure at https://gram.ly/HSL8. Kind regards, {{ticket.assignee.first_name}}security_experts_tips_on_securing_account_kb_link, general donotsurvey security_experts
Security Experts::Type of Encryption

Hello {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for your question!


We use industry-standard encryption to protect your data in transit. This is commonly referred to as transport layer security (“TLS”) or secure socket layer (“SSL”) technology.


At rest, Grammarly uses a combination of technical, physical, and logical safeguards to make sure your data is safe and secure. This includes encryption, secure network configuration and data transfer, restricted employee access, and several other measures.


For more information, please check our Privacy Policy and Terms of Service.


Kind regards,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

security_experts_type_of_encryption, general donotsurvey security_experts
Security Experts::Unauthorized Email Change (Identity Theft) - Identity Verified/Instructions

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for your patience!


I understand that your Grammarly email address, which acts as a login, was changed by someone without your consent. We appreciate your reporting this incident. At Grammarly, we take security and unauthorized access issues very seriously.


Per your request, we have initiated an email address change back to {{ticket.requester.email}}. To finalize this change, please follow the instructions below:


1. Check your email inbox under {{ticket.requester.email}} for the email change confirmation email titled Please Confirm Your New Email Address


2. Open the email and confirm the change by clicking the yellow Confirm Change button


3. Go to https://www.grammarly.com/resetpassword and send yourself a password reset email.


The email should arrive within about a minute and contain a link that will bring you to a page where you’ll be asked to create a new password. The link in the email expires after 72 hours. If the link in the email has expired, you can send yourself another password reset email.


4. Log in with {{ticket.requester.email}} at https://www.grammarly.com/signin


To prevent this type of issue from occurring in the future, please make sure your new password is complex enough. If you use your Grammarly password for any other websites, we strongly suggest changing your password on those sites as well.


Note: You can view and recover any of your recently deleted documents by going to https://app.grammarly.com/documentVersionHistory while logged in to your Grammarly account. These documents are stored only temporarily so you can recover them if you need to before they are permanently deleted from our servers.


I hope this helps, but please don't hesitate to contact me with any further questions or requests. I'm here to help!


Best wishes,


{{ticket.assignee.first_name}}

security_experts_unauthorized_email_change_identity_verified unauthorized_access, subscription security_experts unauthorized_access donotsurvey
Security Experts::Unauthorized Password Reset Request (Explain)

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for reaching out!

If you didn't send yourself a password reset email, someone might have done that in error (for example, by mistyping their own email address). For additional peace of mind, we suggest that you change your Grammarly password by sending yourself a password reset email at https://www.grammarly.com/resetpassword. The password reset email should arrive within about a minute and contain a link that will bring you to a page where you'll be asked to create a new password.


If you have used your Grammarly password for any other websites, we strongly recommend changing your password on those sites as well. To prevent this type of issue from occurring in the future, please make sure to use complex passwords and don't reuse passwords across websites.


Additionally, we suggest that you review these useful tips on keeping your Grammarly account secure: https://gram.ly/HSL8.


Best wishes,


{{ticket.assignee.first_name}}

security_unauthorized_password_reset_request_explain, subscription security_experts donotsurvey
Security Experts::Unauthorized Registration (Gmail Dot Issue)

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


We are sorry for the inconvenience, as we know that this is frustrating since you did not create the account. Unfortunately, we do not have control over the email addresses that are being used to create Grammarly accounts. If this is done in error — or, in this case, by someone else who may be using your email address — the owner of the email address (you) can remove the account that was created. To protect your user privacy and security, we suggest that you follow these steps to delete the account that was created:


1) Click the link https://www.grammarly.com/resetpassword and enter ________.

2) You will receive an email with instructions to change the password.

3) Follow the instructions in the email and create a new password.

4) Now, log into Grammarly with the new password and the ________ email address.

5) Go to Profile -> Account and then click Delete account.


I hope this helps, but please feel free to reach out for any further assistance.


Kindly,


{{ticket.assignee.first_name}}

confusion_unauthorized_registration_gmail_dot_issue donotsurvey, subscription security_experts
Security Experts::Usage by Minor

Hello {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for reaching out!

At this time, we do not have a family product, which would allow you to manage your daughter's / son's account. You can, however, allow your daughter / son to use the account associated with your email address.

Please note that Grammarly welcomes the use of our services by minors 13 years of age and older, with the permission and supervision of their parent or legal guardian. However, to comply with laws protecting the online privacy of children, Grammarly does not permit children under 13 years of age to use our services


Thank you!


{{ticket.assignee.first_name}}

Security Experts::User Content Definition

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for your question.


“User Content” is all text, documents or other content or information uploaded, entered or otherwise transmitted by you in connection with your use of our services or software. This would include, for example, text you write while using a Grammarly product, such as the browser extension or the mobile keyboard.


For more information, please visit our Privacy Policy and Terms of Service.


Regards,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

donotsurvey general security_experts, security_experts_using_g_on_a_shared_computer
Security Experts::What Apple’s Full Access Warning Actually Means

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for contacting Grammarly! Let me tackle this concern.


Anytime you allow a keyboard to have full access, Apple displays a warning that says the keyboard can transmit credit card numbers and passwords. However, most app and website developers mark password and credit card fields as “sensitive.” Apple blocks all third-party keyboards (including Grammarly’s) from accessing any field marked sensitive, so in fact, the keyboard cannot transmit that information to Grammarly.


On our side, we have additionally blocked our keyboard from accessing anything you type in search fields, URL fields, and email address fields.


Kind regards,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

security_experts_what_apples_full_access_warning_actually_means, mobile_keyboard donotsurvey security_experts
Security Experts::What Happens if You Suffer a Security Breach? (Security Protocols, etc.)

TO RUN BY SENKA BEFORE RESPONDING (FOR NOW).



Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for your question.


At Grammarly, we view security as our most critical product feature. We value the trust that our users have in us to keep their information safe, and we want our users to know that any data they share with us while using our products are safe and protected. To continue improving our security, we recently launched a bug bounty program with HackerOne — you can learn more about this program here. We’re not just checking the box on security — it remains our number-one priority.


Kind regards,


{{ticket.assignee.first_name}}

security_experts_what_happens_if_you_suffer_a_breach_or_security_protocols_question, donotsurvey security_experts
Security Experts::Why Allow Full Access on iOS (Explain)

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for contacting Grammarly! Let me tackle this concern.


The Grammarly Keyboard needs full access in order to connect to the Internet. The keyboard needs an Internet connection because we use powerful servers to check your text and provide corrections. Without full access, you can still type with the keyboard, but Grammarly can’t check your grammar, punctuation, or contextual spelling.


The Grammarly Keyboard only reads and corrects the text you type while using it. This means that Grammarly does not see information from any of your other keyboards, including the default keyboard for iOS. We know that what you write on your phone is private, so we have encryption and several other measures in place to make sure it stays that way.


Kind regards,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

security_experts_why_allow_full_access_on_ios_explain, mobile_keyboard donotsurvey security_experts

Social Sign-in::Delete Account (Free) - Unauthorized RegistrationHi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thank you for reaching out. I'm sorry to hear about this. If you would like to delete the Grammarly account under {{ticket.requester.email}}, see the instructions below: 1. Log in to Grammarly at https://app.grammarly.com using the Google/Facebook sign-in option. 2. Visit the Profile page and click on the "Account" at https://app.grammarly.com/profile/account 3. Click the "Delete account" link. Grammarly may ask you to provide your password to confirm the action. Once you do that, the account will be deleted. We know it's frustrating when someone registers an account using your email address. However, we can't delete your account on our side for security reasons — this standard security process ensures that only the owner of the email address can delete the account. I hope this helps, but please feel free to contact us should you need any further assistance. Kindly, {{ticket.assignee.name}}social_signin_delete_account_free_unauthorized_registration donotsurvey, subscription social_signin
Social Sign-in::Google Sign-in Loop - "You already have a Grammarly account" (TS-3751)

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for contacting Grammarly. We're sorry to hear you are experiencing this issue.

I will be happy to assist you with restoring access to your Premium account. I need some additional information from you to confirm that you are the owner of the account currently associated with {{ticket.requester.email}}. Please provide the following information:

- the reference number on your statement, if you see one (it should look similar to CO5DXT-8GCH, CO*5DXT-8GCH, or 5DXT-8GCH)

OR

- last four digits of the credit card number that was used to purchase Grammarly
- card network type (e.g., VISA)
- credit card expiration date (month/year)
- charge amount
- the exact date of the payment
- first name and last name (if any) on your Grammarly account
- if you are seeing "PAYPAL" next to the charge on your credit card statement, we will need to know your PayPal email and transaction ID

I know this process is a hassle, but this security procedure allows us to protect your account from unauthorized access.

Thank you!


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

social_signin_google_signin_loop_you_already_have_a_g_account_ts3751, subscription social_signin development

Social Sign-in::Switch to Email+Password (Confirm)

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for contacting Grammarly! I'm happy to assist you today.


To enable you to change the email address associated with your Grammarly account, / Per your request, I've changed your sign-in method to email address and password. Your login email is now {{ticket.requester.email}}.


To set a password for your account, send yourself a password reset email by going to https://www.grammarly.com/resetpassword. The email should arrive within about a minute and contain a link that will bring you to a page where you'll be asked to create a new password. The link in the email expires after 72 hours. If the link in the email has expired, you can send yourself another password reset email.


Once that's done, you'll be able to update the email address associated with your Grammarly account {{ticket.requester.email}} at https://account.grammarly.com/


I hope that helps! Please feel free to contact me with any further questions or comments.


Kindly,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

social_sign_in_request_to_switch_to_email+password, subscription social_signin
Social Sign-in::Switch to Email+Password (Offer)

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for contacting Grammarly! I'm happy to assist you today.


I see that you registered your account {{ticket.requester.email}} using Google or Facebook as a sign-in option. If you'd like to change the email address associated with it, we'll need to switch your account to the email address and password type of registration.


If this option works for you, please let me know and I'll update your account. Afterward, you'll be able to set your preferred password to your account and then proceed with changing the email address associated with it.

social_sign_in_suggest_to_switch_to_email+password, subscription social_signin
Subscription:: Email Already Registered - Ask to Log inHi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thank you for your message. It looks like you have already created a Grammarly account. I suggest you go to www.grammarly.com and click "Login", enter your email and password (or "Subscribe" if it already displays your name) at the upper right-hand corner of the screen and then click "Subscribe" or "Upgrade". If you forgot your password, send yourself a password reset email by going to https://www.grammarly.com/resetpassword. The email should arrive within about a minute and contain a link that will bring you to a page where you'll be asked to create a new password. If you sent yourself the password reset email but never received it: 1. Check your spam folder (and any email filters you've set up) to make sure the message isn't being directed away from your email inbox. 2. If you cannot find the password reset email after checking your spam folder, try adding info@send.grammarly.com to your contact list. Afterward, please send yourself a password reset email again. I hope this helps! If there's anything else we can do for you, just let me know. Kindly, {{ticket.assignee.name}}subscription, subscription_email_already_registered_ask_to_log_in

Subscription::Apple::Cancel and Refund (Eligible)

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for contacting Grammarly!


I see that you purchased a Grammarly Premium subscription from Apple Store. To request a refund from Apple, please follow these steps:

  1. From any device, visit https://reportaproblem.apple.com and log in with your Apple ID
  2. Find the Grammarly Keyboard app on the list of purchases
  3. Tap the “Report a Problem” button
  4. Select “I’d like to request a refund” from the dropdown menu
  5. Describe your problem and add a note that you already reached out to the app developer and they approved a refund.


We wish we could help you more directly, but, unfortunately, our options are limited in this case.


Kind regards,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

cancel_and_refund apple_payment subscription_apple_cancel_and_refund_eligible, subscription billing
Subscription::Apple::Cancel and Refund (Not Eligible)

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for contacting Grammarly!


As you purchased a Premium subscription from Apple Store, you need to contact Apple for further assistance. Please visit https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT204084 for more details on how to request a refund from Apple.

We wish we could help you more directly, but, unfortunately, our options are limited in this case.


Thank you for understanding!


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

Subscription::Apple::How to Cancel

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for contacting Grammarly!


To cancel your Premium subscription and prevent future billing, please follow these steps on your mobile device:


1. Open the Grammarly app

2. Tap Account > Manage > Subscriptions

3. In the App Store window that opens next, tap Grammarly, and select Cancel Subscription:


​​


Note: If you deleted the Grammarly Keyboard from your device, you'll need to install it again to cancel your subscription.


Let us know if you have any further questions or comments!


Kindly,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

apple_payment subscription_apple_how_to_cancel, subscription billing

Subscription::Ask for First Six and Last Four Digits - Didn't Match Date

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for providing additional information.


Unfortunately, the last four digits and charge amount that you provided don't match the date (including +/- 2 days) you specified.


To do a more thorough search, I will need the first six digits and the last four digits of the credit card number so that I can definitively identify which account is charging your card.


Alternatively, if your statement shows a reference number similar to CO5DXT-8GCH, CO*5DXT-8GCH, or 5DXT-8GCH, you can provide that to help us proceed with your request.


If you see the word PAYPAL next to the charge on your credit card statement, then I'll need to know your PayPal email instead.


Thank you for your time and help,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

subscription_ask_for_first_six_and_last_four_digits_didnt_match_date, subscription billing
Subscription::Ask for First Six Digits and Screenshot

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for sending this information!


Unfortunately, I wasn't able to locate your paid account based on the information you kindly provided.


Rest assured that my goal is to locate your account as soon as possible, but I will need your help to do a more thorough search.


Please provide the first six digits of the credit card number so that I can definitively identify which account is charging your card.


Could you verify that this was a finalized charge that you paid? I know this is a hassle, but could you please send a scan or screenshot of the completed charge on your account statement? Please find the instructions on how to take a screenshot at https://www.take-a-screenshot.org/


Alternatively, if your statement shows a reference number similar to CO5DXT-8GCH, CO*5DXT-8GCH, or 5DXT-8GCH, you can provide that to help us proceed with your request.


Thank you for your time and help,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

subscription_ask_for_first_six_digits_and_screenshot, subscription billing
Subscription::Ask to Login with Email+Password (Social Sign-in Confusion)Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thank you for your message. I see that your account {{ticket.requester.email}} was registered using our standard sign-in method with an email address and password. Because you did not use Google or Facebook to register this account, selecting those options will not allow you to log in to Grammarly. To access your account, please go to www.grammarly.com, click "Login," and enter your email and password. If you forgot your password, you can send yourself a password reset email by going to https://www.grammarly.com/resetpassword. The email should arrive within about a minute and contain a link that will bring you to a page where you'll be asked to create a new password. If you sent yourself the password reset email but never received it: Check your spam folder (and any email filters you've set up) to make sure the message isn't being directed away from your email inbox. If you cannot find the password reset email after checking your spam folder, try adding info@send.grammarly.com to your contact list. Afterwards, we recommend sending yourself a password reset email again. I hope this helps! If there's anything else we can do for you, please let me know. Kindly, {{ticket.assignee.name}}subscription_ask_to_login_with_email_and_password_social_signin_confusion, subscription social_signin
Subscription::Asked to Delete Account (Decline)

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for your message.


For security reasons, I’m not authorized to delete user accounts. This is to prevent the possibility of someone else impersonating you over email and deleting your account without your permission. The only way for us to ensure that you alone can delete your account is by having you log in to Grammarly with your username and password and select “Delete account” in your account settings.


To delete your account, you must log in to Grammarly and follow these instructions: Delete my Grammarly Account


We’re sorry for the inconvenience! Our intention is only to keep your account protected and secure. Please let me know if you run into any problems.


Kind regards,


{{ticket.assignee.first_name}}

This is the case when:


The payment information in billing is outdated


The card was stolen and the fraudster has access to the billing info

Subscription::Cancel and Refund - Asked Twice

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for your message. Please note that when you subscribed to our service, you agreed to our Terms Of Service and License Agreement, which states that all payments made to Grammarly are non-refundable. Asking users to agree to the Terms Of Service and License Agreement upon sign-up is a standard industry practice on websites such as Grammarly.


However, we highly value every Grammarly customer, so we will refund your initial payment as a gesture of goodwill. Please note that it may take up to 10 business days for the refund to appear on your credit card statement, depending on your bank. If you paid with PayPal, the refund should post to your account within a maximum period of 5 business days.


If there's anything else we can do for you, please let us know.


Best regards,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

refund_asked_twice, subscription, cancel_and_refund
Subscription::Cancel and Refund - Asked Twice (For Renewal)

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for your message. Please note that when you subscribed to our service, you agreed to our Terms Of Service and License Agreement, which states that you will be billed if you do not cancel before the next billing date. Asking users to agree to the Terms Of Service and License Agreement upon sign-up is a standard industry practice on websites such as Grammarly.


However, we highly value every Grammarly customer, so we will refund your renewal payment as a gesture of goodwill. Please note that it may take up to 10 business days for the refund to appear on your credit card statement, depending on your bank. If you paid with PayPal, the refund should post to your account within a maximum period of 5 business days.


We hope you will consider Grammarly again in the future. Please feel free to contact me with any questions or comments.


Best regards,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

Subscription::Cancel and Refund::Any Renewal

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for contacting Grammarly! I'm happy to assist you today.


As a courtesy, we have refunded your renewal payment and deactivated your subscription associated with the email {{ticket.requester.email}}. You are still very welcome to use the free version of Grammarly.


Please note that it may take up to 10 business days for the refund to appear on your credit card statement, depending on your bank. If you paid with PayPal, the refund should post to your account within a maximum period of 5 business days.


For your reference, here is an excerpt from our Terms of Service and License Agreement: “Except as may be expressly set forth herein, all Fees paid or accrued in connection with any Services are non-refundable, and Grammarly will not prorate any Fees paid for a subscription that is terminated before the end of its term.”


We appreciate your patience and assure you that the refund has been processed. If you have any further questions or comments, please let us know.


Best wishes,

However, your second subscription under {{ticket.requester.email}} has not yet been canceled. I hope this explains the charge on your statement.

Per your request, your subscription associated with the email {{ticket.requester.email}} has been canceled and the renewal payment refunded, as an exception to our Terms of Service (https://www.grammarly.com/terms).

Please note that it may take up to 10 business days for the refund to appear on your credit card statement, depending on your bank. If you paid with PayPal, the refund should post to your account within a maximum period of 5 business days.

For your reference, here is an excerpt from our Terms of Service and License Agreement: “Except as may be expressly set forth herein, all Fees paid or accrued in connection with any Services are non-refundable, and Grammarly will not prorate any Fees paid for a subscription that is terminated before the end of its term.”


We appreciate your patience and assure you that the refund has been processed. Please do not hesitate to contact us if you have any questions, comments, or concerns.

Upon subscribing, you agreed to the renewal rate of $____ USD, unless you canceled your subscription prior to the renewal date. I hope this clarifies the issue for you. We apologize for any misunderstanding regarding our payment policy.

Thanks for contacting Grammarly Customer Support!

Please note that it may take up to 10 business days for the refund to appear on your credit card statement, depending on your bank. If you paid with PayPal, the refund should post to your account within a maximum period of 5 business days.


For your reference, we offer the following rates (https://www.grammarly.com/premium):


Monthly Subscription — $29.95 USD/month

Quarterly Subscription — $59.95 USD/three months (billed as one payment)

Annual Subscription — $139.95 USD/one year (billed as one payment)


To ensure that our users are aware of the cost savings of an annual subscription, we also list prices by the average cost per month, although plans greater than the 1-month plan are billed as one charge. Please see our billing policy for details at http://www.grammarly.com/terms#billing


I hope this explains the charge on your statement, but please let us know if you have any further questions.

Subscription::Cancel Only (Confirm - User Canceled)

Hello {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for contacting Grammarly. I'm happy to check this for you!


I see that your subscription associated with the email {{ticket.requester.email}} has been canceled (canceling a subscription cancels all future scheduled payments). You will still have access to Grammarly for the usage period covered by your payment (until ____).


Note: Grammarly doesn't send automatic refunds when a Premium subscription gets canceled. Canceling a subscription only prevents its renewal in your next subscription period.


Please do not hesitate to contact us with any additional questions or concerns. And have a great day!


Sincerely,

{{ticket.assignee.name}}

cancel_subscription confirm_cancellation subscription_cancel_only_user_canceled, subscription billing
Subscription::Cancel Only (Confusion) - Explain

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for your question! I can definitely clarify this for you.


Please be advised that canceling a subscription doesn't mean that you will immediately lose access to Premium. Canceling a subscription only prevents its renewal in your next subscription period (if you hadn't canceled, the subscription would have renewed on ____). Therefore, this means that your account will downgrade to the free version on _____. Until then, you'll have full access to all the Premium features Grammarly has to offer.


I hope this clarifies the issue! Should you need any further assistance, please let me know. I'm here to help!


Sincerely,

{{ticket.assignee.name}}

Subscription::Cancel Subscription for Someone Else (Request More Info)Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, First of all, thank you for your message! I'm happy to assist you today. To proceed with your request, I need some additional verification information from you: - the reference number on your statement, if you see one (it should look similar to CO5DXT-8GCH, CO*5DXT-8GCH, 5DXT-8GCH, or qWe23zA) OR - the email address associated with the account - the name on the account - last four digits of the credit card number that was used to pay for Grammarly - card network type (e.g., VISA) - credit card expiration date (month/year) - charge amount - the exact date of the payment - If you are seeing “PAYPAL” next to the charge on your credit card statement, we will need to know your PayPal email and Transaction ID. Once the account is verified, we'll go ahead and cancel the subscription. If you do not have these details, we recommend that the account owner contacts us directly regarding the cancelation. I know this is a hassle, but this security procedure allows us to protect user information. Subscription::Change Email (Ask to Delete Free Account First)

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for your message.


Unfortunately, it appears that your free account under _____ hasn't been deleted yet. To help us proceed with your request, please delete the free account in question and let us know once it's done by replying to this message.


To delete your free account under ____, please follow these steps:


  1. Sign out of all Grammarly accounts by clicking this link: https://auth.grammarly.com/logout_redirect
  2. Log in at https://www.grammarly.com/signin using your login credentials for the account _____
  3. Go to https://account.grammarly.com
  4. Click the "Delete Account" button, then confirm the deletion when prompted.


OR (NOTE THAT YOU NEED TO DELETE STEP 5 + SCREENSHOT IF A USER REGISTERED WITH FACEBOOK)


  1. Sign out of all Grammarly accounts by clicking this link: https://auth.grammarly.com/logout_redirect
  2. Log in at https://www.grammarly.com/signin by clicking "Continue with Google / Facebook"
  3. Go to https://account.grammarly.com/
  4. Click the "Delete Account" button, then confirm the deletion when prompted
  5. Select the account you'd like to delete in the window that opens next:




Looking forward to your reply,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

Subscription::Change Email (Free) - Deny/Ask to ResubscribeHi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thanks for contacting Grammarly! I'm happy to assist you today. If you no longer have access to the email address you signed up with and you don't remember your password, you will have to sign up again with your new email address. Alternatively, you can try contacting your email service provider (ESP) to regain access to your email account. Only your ESP would have the ability and authorization to help you regain access to your email address. Grammarly is not an ESP, and cannot contact ESPs on your behalf. Subscription::Change Email - Error (Ask to Delete Existing Account)

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for your message!


Grammarly shows this error because an account associated with ______ already exists. You will need to delete your free Grammarly account (_______) to be able to switch your current account to the new email address. Please see the instructions below:


  1. Log in to Grammarly under {{ticket.requester.email}}
  2. Go to https://account.grammarly.com
  3. Click the "Delete Account" button on the page that opens next.


Grammarly will ask you to provide your password to reconfirm the action. Once you do that, your account will be deleted. Please note that once you delete an account, the documents on that account will no longer be available.


I hope this helps, but please feel free to contact us should you need any further assistance.

- the reference number on your statement, if you see one (it should look similar to CO5DXT-8GCH, CO*5DXT-8GCH, 5DXT-8GCH, or qWe23zA)


OR


- last four digits of the credit card number that was used to purchase Grammarly

- card network type (e.g., VISA)

- credit card expiration date (month/year)

- charge amount

- the exact date of the payment

- first name and last name (if any) on your Grammarly account

- if you are seeing "PAYPAL" next to the charge on your credit card statement, we will need to know your PayPal email and transaction ID


I know this process is a hassle, but this security procedure allows us to protect your account from unauthorized access.


Thank you,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

change_email_verify_identity_ask_to_delete_existing_account, subscription billing

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},

I will be happy to assist you with restoring access to your Premium account. To enable us to proceed with your request, please provide an alternative email address that you authorize us to set as the default email for your Grammarly account.

- the reference number on your statement, if you see one (it should look similar to CO5DXT-8GCH, CO*5DXT-8GCH, 5DXT-8GCH, or qWe23zA)


OR


- last four digits of the credit card number that was used to purchase Grammarly

- card network type (e.g., VISA)

- credit card expiration date (month/year)

- charge amount

- the exact date of the payment

- first name and last name (if any) on your Grammarly account

- if you are seeing "PAYPAL" next to the charge on your credit card statement, we will need to know your PayPal email and transaction ID

I understand you would like to have your payment of $___ USD applied to a different payment method. What I can do for you is initiate a new charge to your new card (or PayPal account) on file and refund this amount to the payment method that was charged initially.


If you have not already, you can follow the instructions below in order to change your payment method so it's recorded in our system:


  1. Log in to your Grammarly account.
  2. Go to https://account.grammarly.com/subscription
  3. Click Update in the Payment Method section on that page and submit your preferred billing details.

change_plan_with_proration, subscription billing, change_plan_with_proration_downgrade_active
Subscription::Change Plan::Downgrade + Refund + Active (Offer) + Mark as Unclear Pricing ($11.66 / $19.98)

Hello {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for contacting Grammarly Customer Support! It sounds like you have some confusion about our rates and the amount shown on your account statement; let me clarify this for you.


Currently, we offer the following rates (https://www.grammarly.com/premium):


Monthly Subscription — $29.95 USD/month

Quarterly Subscription — $59.95 USD/three months (billed as one payment)

Annual Subscription — $139.95 USD/one year (billed as one payment)


To ensure that our users are aware of the cost savings of an annual subscription, we also list prices by the average cost per month, although plans greater than the 1-month plan are billed as one charge. Please see our billing policy for details at http://www.grammarly.com/terms#billing


As an exception, what I can do for you is refund $110 USD to make it a 1-month subscription at $29.95 USD. Alternatively, we can issue a full refund of $139.95 USD if that works better for you. Please let me know how you'd like to proceed.


Thank you,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

Subscription::Confirmation/Verification Email Not Received - Ask to Check Spam or Whitelist IPsHi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thanks for contacting Grammarly Customer Support! We are sorry that you're having difficulties confirming your email address. If the confirmation / verification email wasn't delivered to your email address {{ticket.requester.email}}, please try following these steps: 1. Check your Spam and Promotions folders (as well as any email filters you've set up) to make sure the message isn't being directed away from your email inbox. 2. If you cannot find the email after checking your Spam folder and any other tabs in your inbox, try adding info@em.grammarly.com to your contact list. Afterward, we recommend updating the email again / requesting a verification email again. If none of these steps help, it must be your firewall/email server or filter that is blocking Grammarly's emails. We recommend contacting your email service provider's Customer Support to whitelist the following IPs and email to ensure that all Grammarly emails get through: IPs: 199.122.124.187 13.111.6.89 Emails: info@em.grammarly.com info@send.grammarly.com donotreply@grammarly.com You may find this article helpful: http://support.incredimail.com/hc/en-us/articles/230698687 Please feel free to contact me with any questions or comments you might have. Best wishes, {{ticket.assignee.name}}subscription_confirmation_verification_email_not_received_ask_to_check_spam_or_whitelist, subscription

Subscription::Delete Account (Free) - Unauthorized RegistrationHi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thank you for reaching out. I'm sorry to hear about this. If you would like to delete the Grammarly account under {{ticket.requester.email}}, see the instructions below: 1. Reset the password to the Grammarly account in question at https://grammarly.com/resetpassword and follow the instructions provided in the email you'll receive shortly after. 2. Log in to Grammarly at https://app.grammarly.com 3. Visit the Profile page and click on the "Account" at https://app.grammarly.com/profile/account 4. Click the "Delete account" link. Grammarly may ask you to provide your password to confirm the action. Once you do that, the account will be deleted. We know it's frustrating when someone registers an account using your email address. However, we can't delete your account on our side for security reasons — this standard security process ensures that only the owner of the email address can delete the account. I hope this helps, but please feel free to contact us should you need any further assistance. Kindly, {{ticket.assignee.name}}delete_account_free_unauthorized_registration donotsurvey, subscription

Subscription::Delete Account (Premium) - Deactivated (Confirm)

Hey {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for getting back to us!


Per your request, I have deactivated your Premium subscription associated with {{ticket.requester.email}}. The account has been downgraded to the free version.


As a reminder, Grammarly does not refund any unused portion from your original subscription period.


You may now follow the instructions below to delete your free account:


  1. Log in to Grammarly under {{ticket.requester.email}}
  2. Go to https://account.grammarly.com
  3. Click the "Delete Account" button on the page that opens next.


Grammarly will ask you to provide your password to confirm the action. Once you do that, your account will be deleted. Please note that once you delete an account, the documents on that account will no longer be available.


Note: If you used Facebook to sign up with Grammarly, you'll need to enter your Facebook password to confirm the deletion.


Please feel free to contact us should you need any further assistance. We hope to serve you again in the future.


Best wishes,


{{ticket.assignee.first_name}}

Subscription::Delete Account (Premium) - Deactivated (Confirm) - GDPR Version

Hey {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for getting back to us!


Per your request, I have deactivated your Premium subscription associated with {{ticket.requester.email}}. The account has been downgraded to the free version.


As a reminder, Grammarly does not refund any unused portion from your original subscription period.


To exercise your right to erasure under GDPR, please follow the instructions below to delete your free account:


  1. Log in to Grammarly under {{ticket.requester.email}}
  2. Go to https://account.grammarly.com
  3. Click the "Delete Account" button on the page that opens next.


Grammarly will ask you to provide your password to confirm the action. Once you do that, your account and all of your personal data will be deleted. Please note that once you delete an account, the documents on that account will no longer be available.


Please feel free to contact us should you need any further assistance. We hope to serve you again in the future.


Best wishes,


{{ticket.assignee.first_name}}

My name is {{ticket.assignee.name}}, and I'm happy to assist you today. We appreciate your reporting this case to us. At Grammarly, we take fraud, identity theft and other unauthorized access very seriously. We can immediately cancel the account, and at your request, also block any further charges to your credit card or PayPal account. Could you please provide us with the following information: - the reference number on your statement, if you see one (it should look similar to CO5DXT-8GCH, CO*5DXT-8GCH, 5DXT-8GCH, or qWe23zA) OR - first six digits and last four digits of the credit card number that was used for Grammarly - card network type (e.g., VISA) - its expiration date (month/year) - payment amount - date of the payment - If you are seeing the word "PAYPAL" next to the charge on your credit card statement, your PayPal email address Thank you, {{ticket.assignee.name}}email_used_unknown_fraud unauthorized_access subscription_email_used_unknown_fraud_request_more_information, subscription donotsurvey identity_theft

Thank you for contacting Grammarly! I'm happy to assist you today.

  • the reference number on your statement, if you see one (it should look similar to CO5DXT-8GCH, CO*5DXT-8GCH, 5DXT-8GCH, or qWe23zA)


OR

  • last four digits of the credit card number your son / daughter used for Grammarly
  • card network type (e.g., VISA)
  • card expiration date (month/year)
  • the charge date
  • the charge amount
  • if your son / daughter used PayPal to upgrade, your PayPal email address


Thank you,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

Hello {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for contacting Grammarly Customer Support!


Unfortunately, the email address that you provided, {{ticket.requester.email}}, did not pull up a paid account.


However, I've located a subscription under the email address xx****@****.com, name: ____.


Might this be yours? Please confirm by providing the full email address. Otherwise, please help me locate your account by providing the following information:


- the reference number on your statement, if you see one (it should look similar to CO5DXT-8GCH, CO*5DXT-8GCH, 5DXT-8GCH, or qWe23zA)


OR


- last four digits of the credit card number associated with the account and card type (e.g. Mastercard, Visa)

- if you used PayPal for the purchase, your PayPal email

- the charge date

- the charge amount

Subscription::Email Used Unknown - Email LocatedHello {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, First of all, thank you for your message! I was able to locate your Premium account — it's associated with {{ticket.requester.email}}. To sign in at https://grammarly.com/signin or in your preferred Grammarly product, please use {{ticket.requester.email}} as your login. If you forgot your password, send yourself a password reset email by going to https://www.grammarly.com/resetpassword. The email should arrive within about a minute and contain a link that will bring you to a page where you'll be asked to create a new password. If you sent yourself the password reset email but never received it: 1. Check your spam folder (and any email filters you've set up) to make sure the message isn't being directed away from your email inbox. 2. If you cannot find the password reset email after checking your spam folder, try adding info@send.grammarly.com, info@em.grammarly.com, and donotreply@grammarly.com to your contact list. Afterward, we recommend sending yourself a password reset email again. I hope this helps! Kindly, {{ticket.assignee.name}}email_used_unknown_found, subscription
Subscription::Expected a Reminder (Monthly/Quarterly Plan)

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for your message!


We apologize for the misunderstanding about our payment policy. At this time, we don’t send automatic billing reminders about monthly or quarterly renewals, but our Terms of Service and License Agreement states that all subscriptions to the Site, Software and Services are renewed automatically. Please note that we ask users to agree to our Terms of Service and License Agreement before upgrading to Grammarly Premium.

At this time, Grammarly does not offer lifetime or one-time plans. As your account {{ticket.requester.email}} doesn't have any billing history on file, this leads us to believe that you may have purchased a Grammarly plan from a fraudulent third-party that advertised it as a lifetime offer. You can be sure that your Grammarly Premium subscription is authentic by upgrading your account at grammarly.com or through our affiliate partners. If you’re not sure whether a certain website is our affiliate, please double-check this with us before purchasing any offers on Grammarly Premium from them to avoid experiencing this issue in the future. Subscription::Fraud::Unauthorized Email Change (Identity Theft) - Email Hasn't Been Changed YetHello {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thank you for contacting Grammarly. I'm sorry that you've encountered this issue. I see that the email address associated with your Grammarly account {{ticket.requester.email}} hasn't been changed yet. To prevent the change, please do the following as soon as possible: 1) Log in to your Grammarly account under {{ticket.requester.email}} and go to https://account.grammarly.com/. 2) In the Email section, please click Cancel Update. 3) In the same profile settings, change the password associated with your account to a complex one. If you use your Grammarly password for any other websites, we strongly suggest changing your password on those sites as well. Please be advised that it's important to follow all of these steps as soon as you can. I hope this helps, but please don't hesitate to reach out should you need any further assistance. Subscription::Fraud::Unauthorized Email Change (Identity Theft) - Verify Identity

Hello {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


First of all, thank you for your message! My name is {{ticket.assignee.name}}, and I'm happy to assist you today.


I understand that your Grammarly email address, which acts as a login, was changed by someone without your consent. We appreciate your reporting this incident. At Grammarly, we take security and unauthorized access issues very seriously. We will try to help you recover access to your account.


Could you please provide us with the following information:


- the reference number on your statement, if you see one (it should look similar to CO5DXT-8GCH, CO*5DXT-8GCH, 5DXT-8GCH, or qWe23zA)


OR


- last four digits of the credit card number that was used for Grammarly,

- card network type (e.g., VISA)

- credit card expiration date (month/year)

- charge amount

- the exact date of the payment

- first name and last name (if any) on your Grammarly account

- if you are seeing "PAYPAL" next to the charge on your credit card statement, we will need to know your PayPal email and Transaction ID


Once your account is verified, we'll go ahead and, with your permission, change the email address associated with your Grammarly account back to {{ticket.requester.email}}.


I know this is a hassle, however, this security procedure allows us to protect your account against unauthorized access.


Thank you,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

subscription_fraud_changed_email unauthorized_access donotsurvey subscription_fraud_unauthorized_email_change_identity_theft_verify_identity, subscription
Subscription::Grammarly Emails HELD/BOUNCED (Instructions)Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thank you for getting in touch! I'm happy to assist you today. According to our analysis, the most recent emails sent to {{ticket.requester.email}} from Grammarly got bounced. This can happen because an inbox was deemed as full or an auto-responder or vacation reply has been activated for a while, or a sender's email was blocked by the receiving server. To resolve the issue, we suggest you search your inbox/spam folder for any previous emails from Grammarly, open one of them, and click any link in the email. You will also need to add the following email addresses to your contact list: info@em.grammarly.com info@send.grammarly.com donotreply@grammarly.com After that, send yourself a password reset email by going to https://www.grammarly.com/resetpassword. The email should arrive within about a minute and contain a link that will bring you to a page where you'll be asked to create a new password. I hope this helps! Please feel free to contact us with any questions or concerns you may have. Kindly, {{ticket.assignee.name}}subscription_grammarly_emails_are_held_or_bounced_instructions, subscription marketing
Subscription::How To::Cancel - Instructions

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for contacting Grammarly! I'm glad to help you change your subscription preference.


To cancel your subscription and prevent all future scheduled payments, please follow these instructions on a laptop or a desktop computer:


1. Log in to your Grammarly.com account at https://app.grammarly.com


2. Go to https://account.grammarly.com/subscription


3. Click the “Cancel subscription” button and confirm the cancellation when prompted.


You’ll keep access to all Premium features until the end of the subscription period that you’ve already paid for. After this period, your account will downgrade to the free version of Grammarly and you will not be charged any future payments. If you’d like to re-subscribe to Grammarly Premium in the future, you’re always welcome to upgrade again at any time!


Please feel free to contact us with any other questions or concerns you may have.


Sincerely,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

subscription_how_to_cancel_instructions, information subscription
Subscription::How To::Change Email Address

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for contacting Grammarly!


You can update the email address associated with your Grammarly account {{ticket.requester.email}} at https://account.grammarly.com


You should receive a confirmation email from Grammarly shortly after you update your address. If you’re not receiving the email, try the following:


1. Check your spam or junk folder and any tabs you may have in your inbox.

2. Open your email settings and check for typos in the email address. If the address is incorrect, you can change it by following the steps above.

3. Try adding info@send.grammarly.com, info@em.grammarly.com, and donotreply@grammarly.com to your address book and then update your email address again.


I hope this helps, but please feel free to contact me with any further questions or comments.


Kindly,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

Subscription::How To::Change Email Address (Premium) + Suggest to Delete Existing Account (Free)

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for contacting Grammarly. I'm happy to assist you today!


If you'd like to use ____FREE_____ as your login to the Premium account that's currently under ___PREMIUM____, you'll need to delete the free account under ____FREE_____ first:


  1. Log in to Grammarly using ____FREE_____ as a login.
  2. Select the Account tab to the left
  3. Click the "Delete Account" button on the page that opens next.


Please mind that once you do that, the documents on that account will no longer be available.


Note: [[[{{ticket.assignee.name}}, PLEASE REMOVE THE BULLET POINTS BELOW IF IT IS NOT APPLICABLE]]]


  • If you used Facebook to sign up with Grammarly, you’ll need to enter your Facebook password to confirm the deletion.


Then, you will be able to update the email address associated with your Grammarly account:

  1. Sign in to Grammarly using ___PREMIUM____
  2. Go to https://account.grammarly.com
  3. Click "Update" next to "Email"
  4. Enter your password and click "Update" again.


I hope this helps, but please feel free to contact us should you need any further assistance.


Kind regards,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

3. Select the plan you need and click Update.

Subscription::Multiple Accounts Confusion - Paid/Free (Add-in)

Hello {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for contacting Grammarly! I'm happy to look into this for you.


This type of issue usually occurs if you have registered two accounts with Grammarly (one is paid, another - free), and accidentally log in to your free account.


Please be advised that your paid account is associated with {{ticket.requester.email}}. Make sure you use it as your login to access Grammarly Premium:


1. Click Log out:


​


2. Then, click Log in in the same menu and use the email {{ticket.requester.email}} as your login to access the full service. / Then, click Continue with Google or Continue with Facebook and select the account under {{ticket.requester.email}} to access the full service.


Also, I encourage you to delete your free accounts(s) to avoid this confusion in the future. Here is how to do that: https://gram.ly/HCVF


I hope this helps! Please let me know if you have any additional questions.

subscription_payment_failed_suggest_to_repurchase, subscription billing
Subscription::Password Reset (Instructions)

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for reaching out! We are sorry that you're having difficulties signing in to your account.


To reset your password, send yourself a password reset email by going to https://www.grammarly.com/resetpassword. The email should arrive within about a minute and contain a link that will bring you to a page where you'll be asked to create a new password. The link in the email expires after 72 hours. If the link in the email has expired, you can send yourself another password reset email.


To delete your old password from your browser's cookies so the new password is accepted, click this link: https://auth.grammarly.com/logout_redirect


If you sent yourself a password reset email but never received it:


1. Check your Spam and Promotions folders (as well as any email filters you've set up) to make sure the message isn't being directed away from your email inbox.

2. If you cannot find the password reset email after checking your Spam and Promotions folders, try adding these email addresses to your contact list:


info@em.grammarly.com

info@send.grammarly.com

donotreply@grammarly.com


Afterward, we recommend sending yourself a password reset email again.


If the link in the email isn't working for you:


  1. Delete any Grammarly password reset emails that you might have received to {{ticket.requester.email}}
  2. Once you've deleted the emails, clear your browser cookies by following the steps described at https://gram.ly/DVSy
  3. Click https://auth.grammarly.com/logout_redirect. This will sign you out and take you back to the home page
  4. Go to https://www.grammarly.com/resetpassword
  5. Type in your email, then select "Send me reset instructions".
  6. Go back to your email inbox and follow the steps in the new Grammarly password reset email.


If you're still having trouble, use a different browser or machine to access the email, then click the link. You can use any of these browsers to access your account: Firefox, Chrome, Safari, Edge, and Internet Explorer.


I hope this helps!


Kindly,

{{ticket.assignee.name}}

subscription_password_reset_instructions, subscription
Subscription::Password Reset - Ask to Whitelist IPHi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Our technical team investigated the issue and it appears that your firewall/email server or filter is blocking Grammarly's emails. We recommend contacting your Email Service Provider's Customer Support to whitelist the following IPs and email to ensure that all Grammarly emails get through. IPs: 199.122.124.187 13.111.6.89 Emails: info@em.grammarly.com info@send.grammarly.com donotreply@grammarly.com You may find this article helpful: http://support.incredimail.com/hc/en-us/articles/230698687 Please feel free to contact me with any questions or comments you might have. Best regards, {{ticket.assignee.name}}password_reset_ask_to_whitelist_ips, subscription
Subscription::Password Reset - Verify Identity/Request Alternative Email

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for contacting Grammarly.


I will be happy to assist you with restoring access to your Premium account. Please note, however, that this will require changing the email address that's currently associated with your Grammarly account to an alternative email address. To enable us to proceed with your request, please provide an alternative email address that you authorize us to set as the default email for your Grammarly account.


Also, I need some additional information from you to confirm that you are the owner of the account currently associated with {{ticket.requester.email}}. Please provide the following information:


  • the reference number on your statement, if you see one (it should look similar to CO5DXT-8GCH, CO*5DXT-8GCH, 5DXT-8GCH, or qWe23zA)


OR


  • last four digits of the credit card number that was used to purchase Grammarly
  • card network type (e.g., VISA)
  • credit card expiration date (month/year)
  • charge amount
  • the exact date of the payment
  • first name and last name (if any) on your Grammarly account
  • if you are seeing "PAYPAL" next to the charge on your credit card statement, we will need to know your PayPal email and Transaction ID


Please be sure to provide an alternative email address so we can update your account right after confirming your ownership of the account under {{ticket.requester.email}}.


I know this process is a hassle, but this security procedure allows us to protect your account from unauthorized access.


Thank you,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

password_reset_verify_identity_ask_for_alternative_email, subscription billing
Subscription::Password Reset Not Possible (Free, Active Email) - Ask to Create New AccountHi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thank you for your message! For security considerations, we are not authorized to reset passwords without verifying the account holder identity first. Unfortunately, since you are using a free version of Grammarly, we have no viable means of verifying the account. You can create a new free account at www.grammarly.com/signup using a different email address. I know this is a hassle, but this security procedure is necessary for us to protect users’ accounts from unauthorized access. Thank you for your understanding, and please feel free to contact us anytime with any questions or concerns you might have. Kind regards, {{ticket.assignee.name}}password_reset_not_possible_free_user_active_email, subscription
Subscription::Password Reset Not Possible (Free, Inactive Email) - Ask to Create New AccountHi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thank you for your message! I'm happy to assist you today. I understand that a password reset email cannot be delivered because you don't have access to your email account. Grammarly requires that you have access to this email address to reset your account password. We recommend that you try contacting your email service provider (ESP) to regain access to your email account. Only your ESP has the ability and authorization to help you regain access to your email address. Grammarly is not an ESP, and we cannot contact ESPs on your behalf. Alternatively, you can create a new free account at www.grammarly.com/signup using your correct email address. I know this is a hassle, but this security procedure is necessary for us to protect users’ accounts from unauthorized access. Thank you for your understanding, and please feel free to contact us anytime with any questions or concerns you might have. Kind regards, {{ticket.assignee.name}}password_reset_not_possible_free_user_inactive_email, subscription

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


First of all, thank you for your message! I'm happy to assist you today.


I understand that you would like to receive a receipt of the payment associated with ______. To help us fulfill your request, please provide the following information:


- the reference number on your statement, if you see one (it should look similar to CO5DXT-8GCH, CO*5DXT-8GCH, 5DXT-8GCH, or qWe23zA)

OR


- last four digits of the credit card number that was used for Grammarly

- card network type (e.g., VISA)

- credit card expiration date (month/year)

- charge amount

- the exact date of the payment

- first name and last name (if any) on the Grammarly account

- If you are seeing "PAYPAL" next to the charge on your credit card statement, we will need to know the PayPal email


Once the account is verified, we'll go ahead and generate the receipt. I know this is a hassle, but this security procedure allows us to protect user information.


Note: As the employee is currently with your company, we're unable to provide their receipt to you directly. However, if you supply the necessary billing details to help us locate their account, we'll be happy to help you identify who purchased the subscription so you can ask them to provide you with a receipt.


Thank you for understanding,

Subscription::Request to Delete Account and Data (GDPR Version)

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for contacting Grammarly!


Let me note that our new Privacy Policy outlines how to delete your personal data from Grammarly in the How can I delete my Personal Data from Grammarly? section. Deleting your account will delete your personal data from Grammarly, including any user documents that you had stored in the Grammarly Editor (app.grammarly.com).


To delete your free Grammarly account, please follow the instructions below:


  1. Log in to Grammarly under {{ticket.requester.email}}
  2. Go to https://account.grammarly.com
  3. Click the "Delete Account" button on the page that opens next.


Grammarly may ask you to provide your password to confirm the action. Once you do that, your account will be deleted.


Note:


  • If you used Facebook to sign up with Grammarly, you'll need to enter your Facebook password to confirm the deletion.
  • The option to manage your account settings (including account deletion) on mobile devices is available at https://account.grammarly.com/.


I hope this helps, but please feel free to reach out for any further assistance.


Kindly,


{{ticket.assignee.first_name}}

Subscription::Request to Transfer Former Employee's Subscription (Verify Identity/Explain)

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thank you for contacting Grammarly! I’m happy to assist you today.


Please note that our security policies prevent us from transferring subscriptions between user accounts. However, as an exception, what we can do for you is provide a 50% discount on a new subscription for your preferred employee as a way to compensate for the remaining subscription period on the account under ____. The subscription under ____ will be deactivated as a result.


If this option works for you, please provide the following information to confirm that you purchased the subscription under _____:


  • the reference number on your statement, if you see one (it should look similar to CO5DXT-8GCH, CO*5DXT-8GCH, 5DXT-8GCH, or qWe23zA)


OR


  • last four digits of the credit card number that was used to purchase Grammarly
  • card network type (e.g., VISA)
  • credit card expiration date (month/year)
  • charge amount
  • the exact date of the payment
  • first name and last name (if any) on the Grammarly account in question
  • If you are seeing "PAYPAL" next to the charge on your credit card statement, we will need to know your PayPal email and Transaction ID


I know this process is a hassle, but this security procedure allows us to protect user accounts from unauthorized access.


Thank you,

We're unable to issue a refund directly because we are limited to refunds for payments made in the last 180 days. This limit is imposed by the credit card payment processor and is not a Grammarly policy. Best regards, {{ticket.assignee.name}}subscription_send_money_explain_why, subscription
Subscription::Send Money - Wire Transfer (Request)Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thank you for your patience. There are a few other options to send money: 1. If you reside outside of the United States, our accounting team can send an international wire transfer. We would need the following information from you: SWIFT code (routing number for the US banks), your bank account number, beneficiary name and address. 2. If you reside in the US, we can send a check. We would need your full name and residential address for that. Please let me know how you would like to proceed. Click Change Password Enter your current and new passwords as prompted. Forgot your password? Send yourself a password reset email at https://www.grammarly.com/resetpassword. Subscription::Thought Canceled by Dunning (Explain)

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for reaching out! I apologize for the confusion.


If there's an issue with your payment method, we send several emails reminding you to resolve the problem with processing your payment. These are simply reminders and are not intended to hassle you.


However, the issue with processing your payment doesn't automatically cancel the subscription right away.


Let me note that we offer a 13-day grace period during which we'll attempt to renew your subscription. If your renewal payment is not processed within the stated time frame, your subscription will be canceled with no further charges applied.


I hope this clarifies the matter. Please let me know if there is anything else we can help you with.


Kindly,

{{ticket.assignee.first_name}}


subscription_thought_canceled_by_dunning_explain, subscription

subscription billing, subscription_thought_early_charge_renewal_date_unclear_timezone_related
Subscription::Too Many Login Attempts (RATE_LIMITED)/Suggest to Reset PasswordHi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thank you for reaching out! We are sorry that you have difficulties signing into your account. If you receive the “Too many login attempts” message, we suggest you wait for up to 20 minutes and try logging into your account then. If you need to reset your password, send yourself a password reset email by going to https://www.grammarly.com/resetpassword. The email should arrive within about a minute and contain a link that will bring you to a page where you'll be asked to create a new password. The link in the email expires after 72 hours. If the link in the email has expired, you can send yourself another password reset email. To delete your old password from your browser's cookies so the new password is accepted, click this link: https://auth.grammarly.com/logout_redirect I hope this helps, but please feel free to contact us with any further questions or comments. Best wishes, {{ticket.assignee.first_name}} subscription_too_many_login_attempts password_reset, subscription information
Subscription::Transfer Documents or Merge Accounts (Decline)

Hi {{ticket.requester.first_name}},


Thanks for contacting Grammarly!


Unfortunately, the option to transfer documents from one account to another or merge your accounts is not available at this time.


As a workaround, you can save the documents stored on one account and then upload them to the other one. To download your edited document, please select the Download option shown in this screenshot:



Note: If you started by uploading a document file, Grammarly will export your document in the same file format that you began with (for example, if you started by uploading a .doc file, your Grammarly document will be available to download as a .doc file).


Additionally, you can update the email address associated with your Grammarly account. To update your email address, please follow the instructions at https://gram.ly/HSM6.


I hope this helps! Please feel free to contact me with any further questions or comments.


Kindly,


{{ticket.assignee.name}}

subscription_transfer_documents_or_merge_accounts_decline, subscription information
Subscription::Trying to Cancel Free Account (Worried About Charge) - Explain FreemiumHi {{ticket.requester.first_name}}, Thanks for writing in today! I'm happy to clarify this for you. We offer the Grammarly Editor, the Grammarly browser extension, Grammarly’s native app, Grammarly for Microsoft Office, as well as the Grammarly Keyboard for Android and iOS free of charge. If you decide to upgrade to Grammarly Premium, you will be charged the current Premium price, according to the plan that is selected. You will not be charged at any time for using the free version. Either way, it’s a win-win, so please feel free to contact us with any further questions or concerns. Subscription::Unauthorized Email Change (Identity Theft) - Why Delete Free Account?

Thanks for your message.

Please note that the email address {{ticket.requester.email}} is currently associated with a free/limited account. It appears that your paid account has been switched to _____________ without your authorization. We’ll be happy to reverse the switch, but before we can do that you will need to delete the free account under {{ticket.requester.email}}. Email addresses can only be associated with one Grammarly account at a time, so deleting the free account will enable us to switch your Premium account back to this email address..


I hope this makes sense, and we look forward to hearing from you.

Subscription::Unclear Pricing (Explain)Hi {{ticket.requester.name}}, ​Thanks for contacting Grammarly Customer Support! I see that you have some confusion about our rates and the amount shown on your account statement; let me clarify this for you. Currently, we offer the following rates https://grammarly.com/premium/: Monthly Subscription — $29.95 USD/month Quarterly Subscription — $59.95 USD/three months (billed as one payment) Annual Subscription — $139.95 USD/one year (billed as one payment) To ensure that our users are aware of the cost savings of an annual subscription, we also list prices by the average cost per month, although plans of more than one month are billed as one charge. Please see our billing policy for details at http://www.grammarly.com/terms#billing I hope this clarifies the matter for you, but please let me know if you have any other questions, comments, or requests. I’ve forwarded your comment to our developers to see if they can change this in the future. I wish I could provide a timeline for delivering this feature, but, unfortunately, we don’t have an ETA quite yet. Please do not hesitate to contact us with any questions or concerns you might have. We are committed to making your experience with Grammarly pleasant and rewarding. Sincerely, {{ticket.assignee.name}}thank_you_for_feedback_2, thank_you
